loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
N. Bakhtiyor is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Bakhtiyor has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Bakhtiyor harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By these, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children who always supports him unconditionally in his daily work. Bakhtiyor requests 5000 Somoni for purchasing young cattle. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well being and security to the members of his family.        


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita L. is from the village of Makawa. She is 51 years old. Pedrita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pedrita owns & operates a fishing business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Pedrita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Pedrita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith R., 39, lives in the village of Delusom, Leon Postigo. She is married to a fisherman and blessed with four children. She operates a small grocery store, selling mostly basic commodities, such as oil, sugar, coffee, salt, etc. Her business helps her husband in generating income.

She started her membership in August of 2007. She has a good credit record, and, in fact, she is already enjoying her third cycle loan in the cooperative.

She is applying for a loan in order to augment her working capital and increase her inventory in the store so that she can gain more profits in selling in it.

loans.use: To increase her store inventory

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe D. is from the village of Manticao, Iligan City. She is 36 years old. Ma. Fe is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Ma. Fe owns and operates a business where she makes and sells specialty food products in the local community. Ma. Fe has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ma. Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business.

loans.name: Friends Group

texts.en:
Yaa is 34 years old she is married and has given birth to four children. All are currently schooling. She trades in plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, cooking utensils etc. for three years now. For the cooking utensils she sells through hawking that is door to door selling. She has lots of marketing experienced, and it has helped her in her business growth. Demand for her goods is booming on a straight path and she sells during the market days. She requests for the loan facility to augment her working capital to buy more stock of cooking utensils and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family.  	

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Friends’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cooking utensils and plastics bowls.

texts.ru: Нишонова Махбуба проживает в районе Регара. Возраст 32 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Махбуба более 3 лет занимается торговлей. texts.en:
Mahbuba N., 32, lives in Regar district. She is married with two children. Her husband is currently working in Russia. Mahbuba has been in business for over three years. She buys glass jars from people in the community and then re-sells them to factories and businesses for a profit. Mahbuba is requesting a loan to purchase more jars.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Hasanjon

texts.en:
Hasanjon is a hard working person and he makes an effort to give his beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his home land so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 2 years in the purchase and sales of cattle Hasanjon has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase the cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests 3000 Somoni. Hasanjon thanks you very much for your love of the prodigal.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en:
K. Mehri is 53 years old. She is married with two children. Mehri is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Twelve years ago, she got an idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family's finances, taking advantage of the space she had available at her house for this business. Her son helps her with the business. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of her animals she keeps. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni. Please be an important part of the growth of Mehri’s business.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Their education is the most important inheritance Muborak and her husband can give to their two dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband and son (pictured), she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditure, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of cattle. Muborak and her family are waiting for your quick response.

texts.en:
Lorna P. is from the village of Naawan , Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Lorna is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting coconut for sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Mastul;a

texts.en:
Mastula is 30 years old and married with three children. She resides in and rents a two room house, where she is staying with six people. All her children go to school. Mastula takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

She resides and works in semi urban area. She incurs extra transport to and from shopping. She buys her food stuffs from Kalerwe market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to 35 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Mastula works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus medication. She has been in this business for the last six years.

Mastula has been with MCDT for three years servicing her sixth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more food items. Mastula aspires to see her business grow and to own a permanent business space and home.
 

.

loans.use: To stock more food items

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en: Justine is 39 years old and the leader of her lending group in Namugongo. She is a single mother with four children, ages 24 to 14 years, and she takes care of five dependents, including orphans and parents. She is a business lady with a clinic in Bulooli trading centre that she has owned for 11 years, and she is able to make 45,000/= as profits a week. She is a friendly person and this has enabled her to better take care of her patients and the general public. She strives to develop her business more as well as educate and build her home and family well. She needs a loan to be able to buy more drugs so as to increase her capital base.

loans.use: Buying more drugs for her clinic

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is a 36-year old married woman with five children. She owns a four-room house that she lives in with five people. Her home has electricity but no piped water. Berna takes care of her children as well as additional family members. The family gets three meals a day. Berna works seven days a week.

Berna sells retail merchandise to about 30 customers a day. Her customers are from all walks of life. Berna buys her merchandise twice a week at Kampala city shops. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business, plus medication. Berna lives and works in a semi-urban area, so she doesn’t incur extra transportation costs going to and from work. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, soap, salt, and other home-use products for resale.

Berna has been in this business for the last ten years. She has been with MCDT for five years. This is her tenth loan, working with the same people. Berna aspires to grow her business into a solid, permanent enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie C. is from the village of Naawan in the province of Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Annie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Annie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. Annie is expanding her business to provide motorcycle service to transport passengers in the local community. Annie is just starting this part of her business.

In 2009, Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to maintain and repair her motorcycle. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To maintain and repair her motorcyle.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 29 year-old carpenter who runs his business in Nairobi. The carpentry business is doing well, and David has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber, nails and glue (raw materials). He would like to grow his business and improve his living standards. David dreams of making enough money to educate his two children and build a home for his family. He describes himself as warm and friendly. 



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of raw materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 64 year old widow with no children. She resides in and owns a four roomed house where she stays with five people. Margaret takes care of additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from work. She buys her local brew from suppliers in Kibuye, who get it from villages, at one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells to 30 customers a day, both retail and wholesale. Margaret works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence, plus medication costs. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Margaret has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local brew and gin for resale. Margaret hopes to see her business grow bigger, as well as own a permanent business premise and home.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local brew and gin.

loans.name: Komi Wowuena

texts.fr: Cet homme ayant le sens des affaires exerce depuis 2005 au grand marché de Lomé le commerce de mèches.Il exerce cette activité réservée exclusivement aux femmes et c'est ce qui fait sa particularité. C'est pourquoi il a beaucoup de clients qui sont curieux de venir acheter chez lui .Il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour l’achat de 30 cartons de mèches de hautes qualité et 15 de qualité moyenne.
texts.en:
Komi Wowuena K. is a born businessman who sells hair extensions at the Great Market in Lomé. This is a trade carried out exclusively by women, which is why he attracts a lot of attention. Many customers are keen to see this particular man and buy from him. Komi applies to WAGES for a loan to buy 30 boxes of high-quality and 15 boxes of medium-quality hair extensions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 60 year widow with five children aged between 30 and 45 years old. None of her children go to school. She resides and owns a two roomed house where she stays with six people. Jane doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area selling charcoal in one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transport to and from shopping. Jane sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for her family. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Jane has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her ninth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, and salt. Jane aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a house in the plot she bought with previous profits.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her retail shop.

loans.name: Ndeye Coumba

texts.fr: NDEYE COUMBA N. HABITE A CAMBERENE OU ELLE EXERCE L'activité de vente de tissus.elle capitalise une expérience de plus de cinq ans dans ce domaine.elle sollicite un crédit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement .l'augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux participer a l'entretien de sa famille.elle est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1998.
texts.en:
NDEYE COUMBA N. lives in Camberene where she does business in selling clothing materials. She relies on over five years past experience in this sector. She is requesting a loan of hundred thousand(100 000) frs in order to increase her working capital.The increase in profit will allow her to contribute better for the upkeep of her family. She's been a recipient parent since 1998.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trading

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente d'oigons à des gens venant du Ghana le pays voisin; elle vend aussi les jours de marchés à Adidogomé, à Lomé et dans sa maison. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2002 et est très connue dans son milieu. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 50 sacs d'oignons. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant; ce commerce lui permet surtout de se prendre en charge

loans.use: Achat d'oigons

Faridah takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She incurs extra transport to and from shopping .She buys her cold drinks in Kibuye one of the busiest markets in Uganda and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to 35 customers a day.and sells to all categories of people on Faridah works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business plus medication. She has been in this business for the last six years Faridah has been with MCDT for6 years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. .

loans.name: Levita

texts.en:
Levita P. is from the village of Tawi-tawi. She is 60 years old, is married, and has six adult children.

Levita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2002, Levita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Levita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma M. is from the village of Naawan, Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Elma is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product selection. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Khaldé Fothy Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupes de femmes adultes qui faisons du commerce de denrées de premières nécessites comme du riz, de l'huile de cuisine , du sucre  et tout autre type de produits de grandes consommation.Nous avons deux boutiques qui se trouvent au marché de notre écovillage que nous voulons ravitailler en marchandise pour le mois de septembre, car à cette période de l'année, les difficultés de ravitaillement sont très nombreuses à cause de la saison des pluies qui s'installe et les routes sont difficilement praticable. Les populations des villages  environnants éprouvent des difficultés pour s'approvisionner en denrées alimentaires, à cause de leur enclavement. Donc grâce au prêt, nous pourront stocker beaucoup de produits pour faciliter l'accès aux populations voisines. Cela nous permettra aussi de créer des emplois fixes aux jeune de notre écovillage qui vont gérer ces boutiques.
texts.en:
We are a group of adult women doing commerce in staple goods, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, and any other kinds of widely-consumed goods.  We have two stores located at the marketplace of our eco-village that we want to resupply with merchandise for September because supply problems at this time of year are quite numerous due to the rainy season settling in.  And the roads are difficult to navigate.  The people of the surrounding villages exhibit difficulties in supplying themselves with food items due their isolation.  So, thanks to this loan, we'll be able to stock a lot of goods for facilitating access for neighboring populations.  This will also enable us to create steady jobs for our eco-village's young people, who are going to run these stores.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy essential goods and domestic items

She is requesting a loan of one hundred and fifty thousand frs in order to increase her capital and her market and to better support her husband with the family needs.

loans.use: Trading

loans.name: Anem

texts.fr: Cet homme pour couvrir les besoins de sa famille s'est lancée l'année dernière dans la publication de presse écrite, parce que c'est un secteur de plus en plus rentable. Actuellement il vient de signer un accord avec deux nouvelles agences qui viennent de faire leur entrée sur le marché de la presse écrite privée à Lomé. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle imprimante Laser couleur A3 pour satisfaire sa demande de plus en croissante. Ce monsieur est marié et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Il exerce son activité à Lomé.
texts.en:
To meet the needs of his family, this man got started in publishing last year because it's a sector growing in profitability. He just signed an agreement with two new agencies, which just made their entry into the private publishing market in Lomé (the capital of Togo).  Thus, he's requesting a WAGES loan to buy a new A3 laser color printer in order to satisfy the growing need.  This gentleman is married and has three children to support.  He operates his business in Lomé .

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a laser printer

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn A. resides in the small vicinity of Delusom, Leon B. Postigo. She is 35 years old and currently manages a small grocery store. She is married to a motorcycle driver and they don't have any children yet. She works hard and hand with her husband to raise income in their family.

She has been a good member since her membership in the cooperative last August 2008. She is already having an extension of her small sari- sari store. She is enjoying her third cycle loan already and manifests a good repayment records.

She is very hopeful that by availing loan, she can continue to generate more income in their family and uplift their economic status.

loans.use: Additional Capital on her Sari- sari Store

loans.name: Julgen

texts.en:
Julgen Z. is from the village of Balintawak. She is 28 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Julgen runs a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income from the business is from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Julgen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Julgen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julgen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julgen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Imeline

texts.en:
Imelina P. lives in Canubay. She is 30 years old, married and has two young children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP from her work.

In 2008, Imelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC, and has applied for a new one of 10,000 PHP to buy feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky T. lives in the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky raises livestock, primarily pigs. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Vicky joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buty livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. lives in the village of Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and expand her business. She is applying for a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional income generated by this loan to continue to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Yama De Amor 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana C. (third from left) is the  hardworking mother of three who lives in a small neighborhood just outsiD. of Samaná, Dominican Republic. Working with her father, Juana sells the fish and shrimp that her father buys at the market or catches on his own. Business is good, and she is now taking out her sixth loan from Esperanza.

This loan will allow Juana to buy more shrimp and fish to sell, and a brand new net especially designed to catch shrimp. This net will allow Juana and her father to increase their income and live a better life.  With previous loans, the two have bought a motorcycle, which allows them to buy food and go fishing in places previously difficult to reach.

Juana currently lives with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 5 and 13, and is hoping to earn enough money to do some home improvements. She would love to buy a refrigerator and a stove for her kitchen, along with bars to protect her windows from rocks and other objects thrown by the children in the neighborhood.  Most of all – Juana is excited to see her business continue to grow.

Thank you for helping make this Kiva loan possible!

loans.use: to buy a new net and other supplies

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet Udechkwu is 34 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the town of Warri with her family and makes a living selling second-hand clothes. She has applied for a loan of $650 to buy more second-hand clothes to sell to her customers, and wishes to extend her thanks to all Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou T. evolue dans la vente de produits cosmetiques depuis 1997.elle est parent beneficiaire habitant le quartier de camberene qui contribue beaucoup a l'amelioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.a cause de la forte demande a laquelle elle fait face elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille(50 000)frs pour qugmenter son capital et renforcer son stock.
texts.en:
Fatou T. has sold cosmetics since 1997. She is a UIMCEC client living in Camberene who contributes a lot to the improvement of her family’s living conditions. Due to high demand, she is requesting a 50,000 franc loan to increase her capital and build up her stock.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital and stock

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 49 years old and married with 7 children. She is a photographer. She has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more photograph materials to work.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more photograph materials to work

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is a 28 year married with three children aged between 9 and 12 years.  She resides and owns  a two roomed house where she is staying with six people and All her children go to school. Faridah takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She incurs extra transport to and from shopping .She buys her cold drinks in Kibuye one of the busiest markets in Uganda and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to 35 customers a day.and sells to all categories of people on Faridah works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business plus medication. She has been in this business for the last six years Faridah has been with MCDT for6 years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more food stuffs Faridah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premise 
 

.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: aissatou D. est vendeuse de tissus mèches greffages et divers articles pour femmes depuis six ans.elle est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1994.elle sollicite un crédit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond et renforcer son stock.son activité lui permet d'entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: La dame Amy B. âgée de 48 ans est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle prépare des crèmes glacées et de la glace qu’elle vend. Elle aimerait avec ce prêt renforcer cette activité très rentable en cette période de forte canicule. Avec ces revenus, elle pourrait mieux contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
48-year-old Amy B. is married and the mother of seven children. She makes and sells ice cream and ice. She would like to strengthen this business, which is very profitable in this period of extreme heat. With the income, she could better contribute to her family’s daily expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream

loans.name: Ngara

texts.fr: Ngara D. est une dame de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de pâte d’arachide. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille
texts.en:
Ngara D. is a 51-year-old lady who is married and the mother of four. She is active in selling peanut butter. Her goal is to improve her family's situation in terms of life, health, and schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling peanut butter

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old and divorced, with four children aged between 10 and 26 years of age. She lives in a three-room house with her children and additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water in the house. The family receives three meals a day.

Mary sells a variety of soaps, including toilet soaps and bath soaps. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo, an area in Uganda, and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to an average to 35 customers a day, and she works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and medication. She has been in this business for the last six years.

Mary has been with MCDT for 9 years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more items. Mary has aspirations of seeing her business grow bigger and of owning permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more soap for resale

loans.name: Yama De Amor 3 + 4 Group

texts.en:
Joely M. (fourth from left) has a fledgling fresh juice sales business just outside of Samaná, Dominican Republic.  This is her second loan with Esperanza, and Joely is excited to continue to see her business grow.

Living with her mother, father and sister, Joely is happy to be brining in an income of her own to support herself and her 10 month old daughter.  This new loan will allow Joely to purchase ice for her juice, which is a significant purchase.  She can use this ice to make sure her drinks are colder for her customers, and can also use a blender to create icy fruit drinks – very important for her business during the hot Dominican summer.

In the future, Joely dreams of owning her own house for herself and her daughter, and going into some other type of business.  Since this is her first venture into the world of sales, selling juice from her mother’s house – where juice was sold previously – is a good place to get her feet wet.  As this loan grows and Joely gains experience, she hopes to see another business opportunity to start with a future loan.

Thank you for this Kiva loan!

loans.use: additional fruit supplies and ice

loans.name: Marie Pierre

texts.fr: Marie Pierre N. est âgée de 50 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Elle fait du commerce de fruits de saison : mangues, pastèque, orange, mandarine). Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: Vente de fruits de saison

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es: Rosa Matilde Hernández M. tiene 61 años. Ella es cliente de Fundación León 2000, por lo que es una mujer que siempre se ha preocupado por sus pagos y es muy responsable.  Su actividad económica es un bazar. Es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y mantener a su familia. Inicio este negocio por su hijo que le ayudo a establecer la venta en donde ofreciera botones, hilos, tijera entre otras cosas. Su mayor desafío fue mantener a sus clientes ya que como ella no tenía el suficiente capital para compra de todo un poco perdió clientes. Pero con el paso del tiempo fue recuperándolos. Rosa necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima botones, hilo, encajes, cintas, papel entre otras cosas. Su sueño es de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Matilde Hernández M., 61, is a client of Fundación Leon 2000. She is a woman who has always been conscientious about her payments, and she is very responsible. She has a bazaar. She is a woman who likes to work and support her family. She started this business with her son, who helped to set up selling buttons, threads, scissors, and other things. Her biggest difficulty was keeping her customers. She did not have enough money to buy a little bit of everything, so she lost customers. But, with the passage of time she has been getting them back again. Rosa needs a loan to buy materials like buttons, thread, lace, ribbons, paper, and other items. Her dream is to make improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou  D. est une femme de 40 ans, divorcée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison et actuellement fait du commerce de mangues. Les revenus générés lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Codou D. is a 40-year-old woman who is divorced and the mother of four children. She sells seasonal fruit and is currently doing commerce in mangoes. The income generated enables her to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling fruit in season

loans.name: Doroty

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 42 year single mother of two children aged 14 and 16 years.  She resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with three people and all her children go to school. Dorothy doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She incurs extra transport to and from work  .She buys her fabrics from the very place where she works.Dorothy is a tailor in Kiyembe one of  of the very many place where tailors assemble their fabrics Finished and unfinished and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to 35 customers a day.and sells to all categories of people on Dorothy sells varieties of clothing children and women, Seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus medication. She has been in this business for the last ten years Dorothy has been with MCDT for two years servicing her fourth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more fabrics in preparation for the festive season. Dorothy is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premise 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for dressmaking

loans.name: Cathy

texts.fr: Cathy N. est une femme de 44 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruits et légumes sur étal. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin d’augmenter son capital pour ainsi mieux venir à bout des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Cathy N. is a 44-year-old woman and the mother of six children. She sells fruits and vegetables in a stall. She is requesting this loan to increase her capital, so as to cover family expenses more easily.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Teddy Nanfuka’S Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 27-year-old married mother of two children, aged 4 and 8, who currently attend school. She rents a two-roomed house in a semi-urban area where she lives with three people. There is electricity but no piped water at the house, and her family eat three meals a day. Teddy also takes care of additional family members.

Twice a week, Teddy buys used clothing from Owino market. She then sells these clothes in Kalerwe market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. She sells a variety of children's and women's clothing, and has about 30 customers a day, seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses are business and domestic rent plus medication. Teddy has been in this business for the last ten years, and has been with Kiva partner MCDT SACCO for three years. She is now servicing her ninth loan, working with the same group mate. She wants to use this loan to stock more clothes in preparation for the festive season. Teddy aspires to grow her business and own permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: aminata N. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1995.elle réside a camberene et s'active dans l'activité de restauration c'est a dire vente de diner le soir  comme activité principale.parallèlement cette dame parent bénéficiaire vend aussi des tissus.elle sollicite un prêt de cent mille(100 000)frs pour aug,enter son fond et sa part de marche.cet activité l'aide a soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata N. has been a recipient parent since 1995. She resides in Camberene and is active in food service. That is, she sells dinners in the evenings as her principal business. Concurrently, this lady member also sells cloth. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her capital and her market share. This business helps her to support her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A small restaurant

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 52 years old, and is married with four children and five grandchildren. He describes himself as active and friendly. For the past 28 years, Ephantus has owned a small retail shop in Kayole of Nairobi. He is requesting his first loan of 50,000 KES in order to increase his stock of soda, cereals, flour, and telephone cards. While this is his first loan, Ephantus hopes to grow his business and, one day, become a wholesaler. 

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase his stock of soda, cereals, flour, and telephone cards

loans.name: Lidia Del Transito

texts.es: Lidia del Transito R. L. tiene la edad de 54 años. Es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independencia. Su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Lidia es una mujer que disfruta mucho de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para elaborar sus refrescos. Su mayor sueño es establecer una tienda de ropa, para seguirle proporcionando a su familia el alimento diario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, frutas naturales, vasos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Lidia del Transito R. L. is 54 and the single mother of three children, who are out on their own, working. She earns her living selling soft drinks. Lidia is a woman who really enjoys her job serving customers. She been in this business for five years, and gets up very early to prepare the soft drinks. Her greatest wish is to open a clothing store, so she can continue to feed her family daily. She is seeking a loan for working capital, and plans to buy sugar, fresh fruits, glasses, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fe Delia

texts.en: Mrs. Fe Delia T. lives in Tabon Jose Dalman. She is a single mother and has three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and three of them live in Zamboanga because they work there. Mrs. T. has successfully repaid her previous loans from Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), and she is now committing to her third loan cycle. She uses her loans as additional capital for her sari-sari store business because her store is very small. Now she is very happy because her business has benefited from many improvements and she has more stock. This has made her the favorite vendor in her barangay. She gives the warmest thanks to PMPC for helping her business and giving her family insurance.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Ndoumbé

texts.fr: Ndoumbé P. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de mangues en détail. Cette activité lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: Commerce de fruits

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is a 59 year old food vendor in their village. She has been a CEVI client for a quite long time and since she joined in the program, she develops a sense of business skills that she uses to earn and income their whole family income. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy dried fish for retail. She hopes that this could help her grow her income to end her children to school.

She likes the services of CEVI because it gives a very low interest rates which is only 2% a month.

loans.use: To buy dried fish for retail

loans.name: Fatma

texts.fr: Fatma N. est une femme âgée de 54 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison et aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux subvenir aux charges familiales.

loans.use: Vente de fruits de saison

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 49-year-old father of five children. Formerly an employee, he has operated a carpentry business in Nairobi for the past four years. He has requested his first loan of 20,000 KES in order to increase his stock of timber. He hopes to own a furniture shop in Nairobi one day, buy a home for his family, and educate his children to the highest level. Alexander describes himself as jovial and determined.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase his stock of timber

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Aby G. est âgée de 55 ans et mère de 8 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de légumes sur un étal qu’elle tient. Cette activité avec les revenus générés lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille.

loans.use: Vente de légumes

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en: Mrs. Cleofe S. lives in Tabon, the most productive barangay in Jose Dalman. When she was an adolescent she was a fish-seller until she met her now-husband, Mr. Norberto S., and they decided to get married. The couple now have one daughter, Niza Fe S., and she has one son. Mrs. S. is a member of the special program of Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She has had two previous loans from PMPC and is now proposing her third loan cycle to improve her sari-sari (variety) store business. Mrs. S. is happy about the success of her business. She is grateful to PMPC for the help she has received for her business and for the life insurance that covers her entire family.

loans.use: To improve her sari-sari (variety) store business

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona B. is a CEVI client for a quite long time already. She is a sari-sari store owner where she sells variety of goods since 2005. Her customers are people around the village where she resides. She has three children and 19 years old the eldest. 

She needs additional capital of Php 23,000  for her business growth. She thinks of buying additional merchandise to attract cuctomers and improve her income as well.

She is hoping that she will get a loan to support her business. She preferred CEVI because it only has small interest rate of 2% a month and they are really concern to people to grow their small business like hers.

loans.use: additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mrs. Editha C. is residing at Migcanaway Tangub City, blessed with 4 children. Her husband just passed away in June 2009 due to cardiac arrest. In spite of the adversity that arises, she still pursued to handle their business of buying and selling fish, shrimp and crab as their source of living.

She started their business 25 years ago, together with her husband, and this was their source of income to educate their 4 children. She joined PMPC last January 2008 because she admires the programs and services that the coop offered to the members like savings, insurance and loan products.

This is her second loan and her first loan was P 50,000.00 with a good record of repayment. Right now she is applying for her second loan in the amount of Php 40,000.00 as additional capital for buying and selling her fish, shrimp and crab.

Her future plan for her family is to be able to finish their house and have a provident living.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase fish, shrimp and crab

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a thirty five year old father of two. He runs a carpentry workshop in Nairobi where he manufactures beds, sofa sets and wardrobes. He has requested for a first loan of Ksh. 25,000 to add to his stock of timber and paint. Joseph has been in this business for the last fifteen years. He hopes to grow his business and out of his profits build a home and buy a family car. He describes himself as social, loving and caring. 


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of timber and paint

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna F. est une mariée de 45 ans, mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait de la restauration et sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son capital d’investissement. Les revenus générés lui permettent de mieux participer aux dépenses familiales afin d’améliorer leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Maïmouna F., age 45, is married and the mother of ten children. She works in food service and is requesting this loan to increase her investment capital. The income generated enables her to help further with covering family expenses in order to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food catering

loans.name: Fagui

texts.fr: fagui H. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1994.elle est vendeuse de poissons dans le quartier de camberene.elle capitalise dix ans d'expérience dans cette activité.elle sollicite un crédit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond et accroitre ses bénéfices car elle contribue beaucoup a l'amélioration du cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fagui H. has been a recipient parent since 1994. She is a fish seller in the Camberene district and capitalizes on ten years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her capital and to grow her profits because she contributes a lot to her family’s living standard.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 57 year old father of five and grandfather to three. He operates a carpentry business manufacturing household and office furniture. He has requested a first loan of Ksh. 50,000 to add stock of timber, bolts, fittings and paint. He hopes to recruit his children to his business and convert it into a family business and install machines for efficiency. He describes himself as a focused team player.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a thirty five year old father of two. He has been running a carpentry business in Nairobi for the past fifteen years. He has requested for his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to purchase more timber. He hopes to have a branch in another location to generate enough income that will enable him to educate his children and start a business for his wife. He describes himself as friendly and loving.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of timber

loans.name: Leonor Mauricio

texts.pt:
Leonor Mauricio M. nasceu na cidade de maputo, viúva, de 34 anos de idade e mãe de 1 filho menor de idade escolar. Estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado de estudar após a separação dos seus progenitores, tendo ficado com a mãe sem capacidade financeira para costear as despesas escolares. Para alem da filha, sustenta sua mãe com mais 2 irmãos que ainda estão sob sua responsabilidade.

Mudou se de maputo para Matola-rio (limite entre distrito de Boane e cidade da Matola)
Casou se quando tinha 18 anos, ano em que aprendeu a fazer negócios para como forma de incrementar o ingresso familiar. Actualmente é dona do negocio que exerce a mais de 12 anos de experiência. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade (arroz, açúcar e outros). Para alem dos resultados do negocio, conta uma pensão, por ser viúva, no valor de 2.230,00MT com os qual sustenta a família e iniciou a construção de uma casa de alvenaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de material de construção da sua casa de alvenaria.
Obteve informações sobre a instituição graças as suas vizinhas e amigas que são também clientes.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a construção da sua casa para depois comprar mobiliário.
texts.en:
Leonor Mauricio M. was born in the city of Maputo. She is a widow, 34 years old, and has a young daughter who is in school. She was in school until sixth grade, when she had to leave her studies because her parents separated and her mother was no longer able to pay for her schooling. In addition to her daughter, she supports her mother and two siblings who are still under her care. , viúva, de 34 anos de idade e mãe de 1 filho menor de idade escolar. She moved from Maputo to Matola-Rio, on the border between the district of Boane and the city of Matola. She got married when she was 18 years old, the same year she learned to run a business as a way of increasing her family's income. She has owned a business for more than 12 years selling staple goods such as rice and sugar. In addition to her income from the business, she has a widow's pension of 2230 meticals a month, which helps support her family and pay for the construction of a brick house. She's never had loans with other institutions and this is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 10,000 meticals to buy construction materials for the house. She heard about the organization through her friends and neighbors who are also clients. She intends to pay off the loan on time and in full so she can request additional loans in order to finish building her house and buy furniture for it.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: yacine S. est vendeuse de poissons au marche de camberene depuis trois qns.elle est parent beneficiaire et exerce cette activite pour soutenir sa petite famille.elle sollicite un pret de cent cinquante mille (150 000)pour aug,enter son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Yacine S. has been a fish seller at the Camberene market for three years. She is a recipient parent and operates this small business to support her family. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia P. is a 57-year old mother of nine children. Her eldest son is now 33 years old and is already married. She is a fish vendor and a seaweeds grower. Her husband knows how to fish so if ever her husband catches plenty of fish she also sell it in the village.  What she likes to do is buy  more fish from other fishermen wso that she will have more fish to  resell at 40% mark up value.

She needs additional capital in her business for pumpboat repair and buy seaweeds seedlings for her seaweeds farm. 

She likes availing loans from CEVI because they are very kind and they give only 2% interest rate.

loans.use: Pump boat repair and buy seaweeds

loans.name: Teresa Antonio

texts.pt:
Teresa Antonio C. nasceu no distrito de Boane, de 35 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 8 e 18 anos que frenquentam escola no mesmo distrito. Estudou ate 3 classe tendo interrompido devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Sustenta mais 3 sobrinhas que estão sob sua responsabilidade cujos pais faleceram vitimas de guerra dos 16 anos terminada no ano de 1992, com assinatura do acordo geral de paz assina em Roma.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores em boane e saiu da casa dos mesmos quando contraiu matrimonio. O seu marido, também, exerce actividade de venda de outro tipo de produtos assim como prestação de serviços de pedreiro a mais de 20 anos enquanto que a Teresa possui 10 anos de experiência em negócios e actualmente possui um espaço ao lado do mercado de Boane. Não tem trabalhadores. Aprendeu a fazer este tipo de negocio (venda de camas, cadeiras e outros artigos plásticos) com amigas e marido ajuda na gestão financeira do negocio.

O seu melhor são camas que compra na áfrica do sul a 4.700,00mt e revende a 6.800,00mt. Em media ganha 14.000,00mt que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de credito e tambe pouca algum valor no banco comercial.

Teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos residentes, tendo aproximado e desembolsado 10.000,00MT para aumentar o stock.
Com o presente credito de 17.000,00MT pretende comprar camas e  artigos plásticos para vender( cadeiras, bacias, e outros).

Propõe se a pagar o emprestimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos co o objectivo de concluir a sua obra de construção de casa de alvenaria.
texts.en:
Teresa Antonio C. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo, Mozambique. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 8 and 18, all enrolled in school. Her studies were interrupted in 3rd grade, due to her parents' financial difficulties. She is also responsible for 3 nieces, whose parents died during the 16-year war which ended in 1992. She left Boane when she got married. Her husband has a small retail business and over 20 years of experience as a construction worker. Teresa has 10 years of experience running her own retail business selling beds, plastic chairs and other articles made of plastic––an activity she learned from friends. She doesn't have any employees, and her husband helps her manage the finances. Her most profitable articles are the beds, which she buys in South Africa for 4.700,00MT and resell in Boane for 6.800,00MT. On average, she earns 14.000,00MT per month, which allows her to support her family, make loan payments, and put a little money into the savings account she has at the Commercial Bank of Mozambique. Teresa learned about Kiva and Hluvuku-Adsema through neighbors. She plans to use this 17.000,00MT loan––as she did with the first, in the amount of 10.000,00MT––to increase her stock. She expects to pay off this loan without difficulties and plans to apply for additional credit in the future, to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beds, chairs and other articles made of plastic, all for resale

loans.name: Alfredo Jose

texts.es: Alfredo José B. Méndez tiene la edad de 38 años. Desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el dinero de manera muy humilde. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica esta actividad. El do inicio a este negocio por su Padre ya que él no podía seguir adelante con este negocio y Alfredo tenia los conocimientos para administrar este negocio por lo que su Padre decide que Alfredo se haga cargo del negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de vestidos, camisetas, faldas, pantalones y ropa extra grande ya que esta es la más buscada por sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es seguir adelante con este negocio
texts.en:
Alfredo José B. Méndez is 38 years old, and since he was young he has liked working and earning money in a humble manner. For more than five years he has been selling used clothing. He started in the business because his father could not continue with the business and Alfredo had the knowledge to run the business, so his father decided that Alfredo should take control. The funding that Alfredo requests is for working capital for the purchase of dresses, shirts, skirts, pants and extra large clothing because that is the most sought after by his clients. His biggest dream is to have success with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elisa Domingos

texts.pt:
Elisa S. nasceu na província de Gaza, no distrito de Chibuto, de 35 anos de idade, casada e mãe de dois filhos com idades compreendidas entre 2 e 6 anos e o primeiro filho freqüenta escola na vila de boane. Concluiu 12 classe.
Alem dos filhos, sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ela na casa do serviço na vila de Boane.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores e m chibuto e mudou juntamente com os pais para o distrito de Boane no ano de 1983.
Trabalha na Escola primaria de Boane como assistente técnico há mais de 10 anos e recebe 2.400,00MT mensais que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de uma empregada domestica. Teve formação técnica em matérias de administração de escolas.

Teve empréstimos com outros Bancos (Associação de credito de Gueguegue, que opera na vila de boane) tendo concluído sem problemas. Procurou a Hluvuku-Adsema por preferir a metodologia de credito individual.
É pela primeira vez que vem solicitar o empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de uma casa de alvenaria.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir a sua casa pra confortar a família orgulho de ter casa própria.
texts.en:
Elisa S. was born in the province Gaza, district of Chibuto. She is 35 years old, and is married with two children, 2 and 6 years old. Her elder son goes to school in the town of Boane. She finished 12th grade. In addition to her two children, she also supports a nephew who lives with her in her house in Boane. She was raised by her parents in Chibuto, and moved with them to Boane in 1983. She has worked in Boane's elementary school as a technical assistant for more than 10 years, where she earns 2400 meticals a month. She uses her salary to support her family and employ someone in her home. She has technical training in school adminsitration. She's had loans from other banks (the Gueguegue Credit Association, which operates in Boane), which she paid back without difficulty. She came to Hluvuku-Adsema because she preferred our method of offering individual loans. This is the first time she's requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals to buy construction materials for a brick house. She intends to pay off her loan without problems so she can apply for more, with the goal of finishing her house and offering her family the pride of having their own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas Group 1, 2 & 3

texts.en:
Amada is the group coordinator and president of Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Con Sueños y Metas (Women with Dream and Goals) which is starting its first loan cycle with Esperanza. She resides in the Northern slums of Santo Domingo, an area where both electricity and water services (none of which is potable) are unreliable. In addition she shares her small house with seven other individuals including her husband and three children. 

With this loan she hopes to open her own butcher shop to serve her community. She intends to put the profits she gains from the butcher shop  towards imporving her home, seeing her children educated to become professionals and finally towards her own education. Amadas long term dream is to study family psychology and she is hoping that with the new income from her butcher shop she will be able to see her dreams fulfilled. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Opening her own butcher shop

loans.name: God Tenki Group

texts.en:
This is Abie K., Kadiatu K., Suffie K. and Marie L..  They are small scale businesswomen in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They called their group God Tenki, a Krio phrase meaning “ thank you God”. This is the third loan they are getting from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,600,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve their standard of living.

Abie K. (right) is the leader of this group. Abie was born in Mabom village about five miles from Magburaka town. She is forty-eight years of age, married to a teacher and they have four children – two of her children have already sat to the  Senior Secondary Schools Examinations, the others are in Junior Secondary School III. Abie sells bowls and sometimes also cottons. Abie has been a businesswoman since 1999. With this loan, she will be able to further strengthen her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody S. is 31 years old and married to a fisherman. She has four children, the eldest being 10 years old.

Melody has been a Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) client for quite a long time already and, since she joined CEVI, she said to herself that she has improved a lot, especially in making her business profitable for her family. She started selling fish in 1997 and has been able to sustain it up to the present.

Melody would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI and will use the loan to buy a compressor. Some of the loan will also be used for buying food for their family consumption and in sending her children to school.

She said, she is pleased with CEVi services. She likes the idea of it giving insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy a compressor

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.pt:
Maria Justina M. nasceu no distrito de Boane, de 39 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 10 e 20 anos, todos os filhos freqüentam escola e vivem com o pai que é militar no quartel de Boane tem a sua casa própria onde mora com toda família. Para alem dos seus filhos, não vive com mais ninguém sob sua responsabilidade. Maria estudou ate 7 classe tendo parado, na altura da guerra, devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores.

Nunca saiu do distrito de boane, cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e passou a viver com seu marido depois de um casamento tradicional.
Aprendeu a fazer negócios com as irmãs e vizinhos. Dedica se a venda de produtos diversos (bebidas, bolos bolachas e outros) no seu estabelecimento onde trabalha sozinha. Rende pro mês 1.000,00MT.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e este é o seu quarto credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema, primeiro do kiva no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de produtos (bebidas, bolos, bolachas, chips e outros).
Os primeiros três créditos foram também para a mesma actividade (5.200,00MT; 10.000,00MT e 13.500,00MT).

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de manter firme o negocio assim como fazer mais um estabelecimento comercial no quintal da sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Maria Justina M. was born in the district of Boane, She is 39 years old, and is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 20. All of her children are in school and they all live with their father, who is a soldier in Boane. They own their own home, where the whole family lives. Apart from her children, she isn't responsible for supporting anyone else. Maria attended school through the 7th grade but had to stop during the war because her parents didn't have the money to send her. She's never left Boane. She was raised by her parents and then went to live with her husband after a traditional wedding. She learned how to run a business with her sisters and neighbors. She sells a variety of goods -- soft drinks, sweets, etc. -- in her shop, where she works by herself. She earns 1000 meticals a month. She's never had loans from other institutions and this is her fourth from Hluvuku-Adsema and her first with Kiva. She will use the 15,000 meticals to stock her store (soft drinks, sweets, snacks, chips, etc.). Her first three loans were for the same purpose (5200 meticals, 10,000 meticals, and 13,5000 meticals). She intends to pay back her loan on time and in full so she can request additional loans, with the goal of keeping her business going and opening a shop in the backyard of her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her store

loans.name: Olímpia Vânia

texts.pt:
Olímpia Vânia nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 24 anos de idade, freqüentou a 10 classe, solteira e mãe de um filho de 6anos. Para alem do filho, sustente seu sobrinho e uma irmã sob sua responsabilidade.  

Em 1992 saiu de Maputo para viver na Matola juntamente com sua família, onde se encontra até então.
Olímpia é comerciante a tempo inteiro, dona do seu negócio. Trabalha a 4 anos sozinha e sem empregados.

Aprendeu através de uma Senhora amiga em Maputo já tem 8 anos de experiência de. Vende roupa de cama e outros artigos de tecido (Duves, lençóis, cortinas e outros artigos). Compra uma parte dos produtos na áfrica do sul a 1.500,00MT e vende a 3.000,00MT. O seu rendimento mensal é de 12.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e ainda poupa algum valor no final de Mês. Não tem casa própria.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 11.000,00MT. Pretende comprar diversos artigos de tecido (lençóis, duves, cortinas e outros). Nunca teve outros empréstimos noutras instituições, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema graças a uma amiga que tinha levantado Credito na instituição. Ela acha que o seu negocio poderá crescer com o aumento de volume de mercadoria.

 São desafios os custos aduaneiros bem como os próprios funcionários das alfândegas que podem desviar seus produtos quando ela não tem valores para poder pagar. Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas. Com o sucesso do negocio pensa em construir casa própria e responder as necessidades da família que tanto precisa e para tal conta com kiva para mais empréstimos.
Projeta, para futuro, r ser médica e proprietária de um salão de cabeleireiro.
texts.en:
Olímpia Vânia was born in the city of Maputo. She is 24 years old. She attended school until 10th grade, and she's the single mother of a 6-year-old boy. In addition to her son, she also supports her nephew and a sister. In 1992 she left Maputo to live in Matola with her family, and she's still there. Olímpia is a full-time shopkeeper, owner of her own business. She's worked for four years by herself, without any employees. She learned business from a friend in Maputo and has 8 years of experience. She sells bedsheets and other cloth goods (duvets, handkerchiefs, curtains, etc.). She buys some of her products in South Africa at 1500 meticals and sells them at 3000 meticals. She earns 12,000 meticals a month, which she uses to support her family. She is also able to save a little each month. This is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 11,000 meticals. She will use it to stock her store. She's never had loans from other institutions. She heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through a friend who had received a loan from the organization. She believes her business will be able to expand with an increase in the quantity and variety of goods she stocks. Customs fees are a major challenge, since customs officials can send deny her products entry when she doesn't have the money to pay them. She intends to pay back her loan in full without any problems. With her business's success, she hopes to build her own house and meet her family's needs. She is counting on Kiva for additional loans. It the future, she'd like to be a doctor and own a beauty salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer B. owns small sari-sari store. She sells rice and varoius goods to people around their village. She is 30 years old and two kids. She wanted to grow her business but needs additional capital to make it sustain.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchnadise to be able to attract customers and increase her income. 

She likes that CEVI is not jsut giving loans to everybody but education as well to business and money savings.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 40 years old and married with five children. She has been in the business of selling foodstuffs since 1985. Esther lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco H. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción de la escuela, comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares de su hija. Ya que para el es muy importante que su niña tenga los estudios necesario para salir a delante en la vida.
Don Francisco es una persona pensionada esté es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual, una parte será para pagar este préstamo.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son su esposa la señora María Antonia González y su hija.
texts.en:
Francisco H. has had a loan with FVP, which he paid back punctually. He is asking for a new loan to be able to pay for school enrollment fees, school uniforms, and school supplies for his daughter.
