It is very important to him that his daughter has the education that is necessary for his daughter to get ahead in life. Francisco receives a pension. This is the income he has for his family, and he will use part of it to pay for the loan. The people in the photo are his wife, María Antonio González, and their daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for school enrollment fees, school uniforms, and school supplies

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs like plantain and oil e t c. Angela lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou F. es une femme mariée, mère de 5 enfants. Elle vend de l’arachide et en même temps du jus de fruit. Les revenus générés lui permettent de participer en partie aux charges de la famille
texts.en:
Aïssatou F. is a married woman and the mother of five children. She sells peanuts and, at the same time, fruit juices. The income generated enables her to cover part of the family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling peanuts and juices

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou D. est commercante specialisee dans la vente de tissus depuis plus de sept ans.elle aide beaucoup son mari dans l'entretien de la famille.compte tenu de l'accroissement de la demande ses marches s'elargissent de jour en jour.par consequent elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter ses fonds.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 43 years old and married with five children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase a cooking stove and freezer and more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cooking stove and freezer and more drinks

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Luis Miguel R. y su esposa la señora Dazally Corina Gutiérrez son un matrimonio joven que tiene dos hijos pequeños, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
Están solicitando un crédito para poder pagar la inscripción, comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares, de su hijo para que pueda ingresar ha la escuela, ya que en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder pagar está necesidad de su hijo.
Don Luis Miguel trabaja como mensajero de una compañía y su esposa como vendedora de una casa de empeño. Son los ingresos y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son la señora Dazally Corina y su hijo, ya que cuando se realizo la visita el señor Luis estaba en horario de trabajo.

loans.use: Pago de Inscripción, comprar uniformes y útiles escolares

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is 34 years old and married with a child who is in school. She is a hair stylist and also sells sarongs and clothes. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is 40 years old. She is married and has seven children, two sons and five daughters, who are all still in school. Abena works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. Abena trades in smoked fish. She hawks to sell in her community. She procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for seven years now and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Na We Yone Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata S., Osman B., Magret K. and Kadiatu S.. They named their group Na We Yone. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small-town which is about twenty-two miles away from Freetown. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT, a partner of Shine On Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they will make better profit to look after themselves, children and extended family members. 

Aminata S. (right and attached below) is the leader of the group. She is thirty years of age. She was born in Waterloo. Her husband is a businessman and the two of them have one child who is attending school. Aminata sells ground-nuts, bulgur wheat and beans. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. With this loan, she will buy two bags of beans. A bag costs her Le 250,000.00.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La señora Ramona Z. es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito Gubernamental el cual le está haciendo falta una parte para el enganche, pero ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario para liquidar está deuda y que la casa sea de ella y de sus hijos.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder pagar el enganche y así su familia va estar más segura.
Doña Ramona trabaja de intendente de un edificio de la ciudad, este es el ingreso que tiene y con el cual pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Ramona Z. is a single mother with three children in her care. Recently she bought a house through a government loan. She still needs to pay off part of the down payment, but she doesn't have the money to pay off the debt and get the house for herself and her children. She is seeking a loan to be able to pay the down payment so her family can be more secure. Ramona will pay back the loan from the income she receives as a janitor in a building in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the down payment on a house she is financing through the government

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 30 years old. She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter, who are both still in school. Juliana works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She hawks to sell in her community and treks as well. She procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. Juliana has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme âgée de 32 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des perles, de l’encens et divers autres articles. Elle aimerait avec ce prêt renforcer son capital afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle participe aux charges familiales dans le but d’améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 32-year-old woman and the mother of four children. She sells pearls, incense, and various other items. She would like to use this loan to bolster her capital in order to satisfy her customers better. She helps cover family expenses with the goal of improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in pearls, incenses, and other products

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are ladies and are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. Hannah runs a cold store. She supplies to food vendors in her community. Hannah procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for over five years now and wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Tawopaneh Traders Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata G., Zainab F. and Aminata K.. They call their group Tawopaneh Traders, a Temne phrase meaning “let us join hands together traders”. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town 20 miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. Each of them is requesting a loan of LE 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, they can make better profits and improve their standards of living. 

Fatmata (left and attached below with her business) is the leader of this group. She is 43 years old. She was born in Rotufunk, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with seven children. Four of her children are adults, one is in class three, one in class four and the other is not of school going age. Fatmata sells sticks and firewood. She has been in this business for over ten years.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo R. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito, con el cual su negocio ha superado bastante.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirle al negocio de material ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar y no tiene suficiente material para entregar a tiempo, es por eso que solicita un nuevo préstamo, para que pueda entregar a tiempo la ropa que tiene pendiente.
Don Rodrigo planea pagar este crédito con los ingresos que genera el negocio ya que también es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.

loans.use: Inversión en el negocio

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 28 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are girls and are in school. She works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. Elizabeth lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a grocery store in her community. Elizabeth buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is forty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband who is a famer to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Joyce is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Joyce procures bales of second hand textiles from Accra. She has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles

loans.name: Diariatou

texts.fr: Diariatou S. a 38 ans, est mariée avec 7 enfants en charge. Elle fait du petit commerce de poissons secs, arachide et divers légumes. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité afin de mieux participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diariatou S. is 38 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a small business selling dried fish, peanuts and various vegetables. She hopes to build up her business to better contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell dried fish, peanuts and vegetables

loans.name: Sababu Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed K., Jaminatu K. and Mumunatu B.. They are local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo, a small town 20 miles from Freetown city. They named their group Sababu. They are requesting a loan of LE 500,000 for each of them to help them expand their businesses. This loan will be the first these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. 

Mohamed K. (left and also attached is a picture of his business) is the leader of Sababu group. Mohamed is 35 years old. He was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children together. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School II and the other is in Class V. Mohamed sells ready-to-wear-clothes. He has been in this business since 2000. With the help of this loan, he will be able to expand his business by traveling to neighboring Guinea to buy more clothes at a cheaper rate to add into his shop. In this way, he will be able to meet the growing demand of his customers, make higher profits and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina I. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Georgina sells sauce pans and groceries at Cape Coast, which she has done since 1996. Her husband is a supplier. Georgina uses her income to pay for upkeeping of her family. Georgina will use the loan to purchase to buy more sauce pans and groceries for resale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase to buy more sauce pans and grocery items for resale at the market

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 48 years old. She is married and has seven children, three sons and four daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Grace lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader and owns a store. She supplies to food vendors in her community. Grace procures fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for over ten years now and wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is thirty – six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Afia lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, pepper, etc. on a table top at the market square. She supplies to food vendors in her community. Afia procures her goods from nearby communities at moderate prices. She has been in business for over twenty – five years now and wants a loan to buy vegetables in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Eleazar Bruno

texts.es:
El señor Eleazar Bruno es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos que actual mentes están estudiando. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar los uniformes y los útiles escolares a sus niños ya que, empiezan el ciclo escolar y no cuanta con el dinero para surtir los útiles y comprar los uniformes.
El trabaja en un taller de mecánica en el departamento de ventas de piezas de autos, este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sr. Eleazar Bruno is a family man who has two children who are currently studying. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy uniforms and school supplies for his children. The school year is starting and he does not have the money to pay for these items.

Sr. Eleazar sells auto parts at a mechanics shop. His income enables him to support his family and part of it will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase uniforms & school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar Pantalones de mujer, Blusas, camisolines, trajes con chaquetas, pantaletas, tanga scorpiño y shorts de mujer.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El Grupo FORTALEZA, está integrado por 10 personas entusiastas y emprendedoras de la zona de Carabayllo, quienes adquieren sus préstamos para el crecimiento de sus negocios.

La Sra. Isabel S. Aranda (que la apreciamos al lado izquierdo del grupo), de 45 años de edad, madre soltera ha logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales gracias a su sacrificio y mucho trabajo. 
Ella inició vendiendo en la puerta de su casa menú y con tan solo apenas 12 clientes al día y teniendo muy poco ingreso. Un día la invitaron a participar de un Grupo de EDAPROSPO que le ofrecían obtener un crédito para poder invertirlo, con mucho temor de no poder mantener una deuda aceptó; con su primer préstamo compró mesas y sillas para poder atender a más clientes, y ofrecer la venta de ceviches los sábados y domingos.
Hoy en día es una comerciante exitosa atiende a mas de 50 clientes al día, gracias a sus ingresos pudo construir su casa y ubicar su negocio en todo el primer piso y su vivienda en el segundo piso. Ella manifiesta que su mayor logro fue poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos y lograr que tengan una profesión.
El préstamo solicitado lo destinará la mitad a gastos de publicidad y la otra mitad lo invertirá en la venta de licor; pues así podrá tener mas ingresos y poder adquirir una congeladora.
texts.en:
The FORTALEZA Group is working on behalf of 10 enthusiastic and enterprising people from the Carabayllo area who are requesting loans in order to grow their businesses. Mrs. Isabel S. Aranda (on the left in the photo) is a 45 year old single mother. Thanks to her effort and hard work, her children have all grown up to become professionals. She began her business of selling food from her home to 12 customers with little investment. EDAPROSPO (A Kiva Field Partner) offered to help her obtain credit so that she could invest in her business. She was reluctant at first because she was concerned about going into debt, but she accepted. With her first loan, she bought some tables and chairs so that she could serve more customers and was able to add "ceviches" (citrus marinated seafood dishes) to her menu on the weekends. Today she is a successful businesswoman who serves more than 50 customers a day. Thanks to her income, she has been able to build a home with her business located on the first floor and her residence on the second. She feels that her greatest accomplishment has been to allow her children to obtain good educations and help them become professionals in their fields. She plans to use half of the money from this loan to buy advertising for her business and the rest to buy alcoholic beverages for resale so that she could increase her revenue and be able to buy a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest toward the growth of her restaurant

loans.name: Salapateh Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Aminata T., Memuna K., Rugiatu B. and Ramatu B.. They call their group Salapateh. They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small-town, about 22 miles from Freetown. This is the first loan this group of entrepreneurs is accessing from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. With the help of a loan of LE 500,000 for each entrepreneur, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profits and consequently improve the status and quality of their businesses.

Isatu K. (right and attached below left) is the leader of the group. She is 23 years old. She was born in a village called Masinra, in northern Sierra Leone. Isatu is a widow with one child who is four years old. Isatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), bananas, plantains, cucumbers, pineapples, and any other items she discovers to be in high demand in the market. With this loan, Isatu will buy gallons of palm-oil. Five gallons make a “barter” and a barter of palm-oil costs her LE 60,000, which she sells at LE 65,000 - 70,000. Isatu has been in business for a year now.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm-oil for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Sarah is a trader. She trades in textiles – under wears for ladies. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures her goods from Accra. Sarah has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
This is Masiray K., Warrah A.T. D., Adama C. and Iye S.. They called their group Talapsu. This is the first loan they are receiving from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. They’re requesting a loan of Le 500,000 to enable them expand their businesses. This will helped them a lot. They will able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve much of their household problems. 

Masiray is the leader of this group. Masiray was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. She is twenty-four years of age, married with two children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School I and the other is in nursery I. Masiray sells cottons, she will use this loan to buy bales of cotton. A bale of cotton costs Le 40,000.00. Presently, Masiray is trading with ten bales of cottons, but with the loan, she will be able to get least eleven more bales of cottons. Masiray has been a businesswoman for ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mariama Bagna

texts.fr: Mariama Bagna D. est une femme âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des tissus teintés « Thioup » et de l’huile de palme. Son objectif est de contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
36-year-old Mariama Bagna D. is married and the mother of four children. She sells “Thioup” dyed fabric and palm oil. Her goal is to contribute to her family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell "Thioup" dyed fabric and palm oil

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando y  ha los cuales les quiere dar la educación necesaria para su futuro.
Ya empezó el ciclo escolar y no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar el inscripción y comprar les los útiles y uniformes escolares. Es pos eso que está solicitando un préstamo para que sus hijos puedan en pesar el ciclo escolar sin ningún problema.
El es empleado de una fábrica en el departamento de planeador de materiales, este el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual planean pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos is a family man with two school-aged children. He wants to provide them with the education they need for their future.

The school year has already started and he does not have the money to pay for the registration fees, school supplies, and uniforms. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that his children can attend school without any problems.

Sr. Juan Carlos is employed at a factory where he works in the materials planning department. His income enables him to support his family and will use part of it to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for registration fees, school supplies and uniforms

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is fifty – six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. Mary trades in cereals and other food stuffs. She sells in her community and also supplies to other food vendors. She procures the goods from nearby communities. Mary has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy cereals in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 43 years old. She is married and has four daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. Mercy lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. Mercy has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Kalokoh Group

texts.en:
This is Alice Y. M., Musu A. K. and Asha S.. They named their group Kalokoh Group.  They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small-town which is about twenty-two miles to Freetown. This is their first loan with SMT/Kiva. They have come to seek a loan from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in order to help them develop their businesses. With a loan of Le 500,000 for each, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better sales and consequently improving on their standard of living.

Alice Y. M. (left and also attached top left with her business picture) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with four children. One of Alice children in now a nurse, the other has just written the West Africa Senior Secondary schools Examination, the other is in Senior Secondary School II and the other has just written the National Primary Schools Examinations. Alice sells second hand clothes especially bras, under wears and night dresses. She has been in this business for eight years now. With this loan, she will be able to buy at least one bale of night dress. A bale costs Le 400,000.00

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 33 years old. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Georgina is a trader. She trades in all kinds of cosmetics. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Georgina procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda D. est une femme mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de perle, encens, beurre de karité et divers articles. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin de renforcer ses capacités d’autofinancement pour mieux participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aïda D. is married and the mother of seven children. She sells pearls, incense, shea butter and various other items. She is requesting a loan to help her become self-sustainable to better cover her family expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell pearls, incense, shea butter and various other products

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 54 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, one son and four daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to be able to provide for the family. Beatrice lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. She sells it with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. Beatrice buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for eight years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Bear The Weather Group

texts.en:
Here are members of The Bear the Weather group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 700,000 for each for the fourth time to enable them further  improve on the quality and sizes of their businesses. With a lot of goods into their stalls, they will be able to attract a lot of customers into their stalls, make more sales and increase profit. Consequently, they will be able to better look after themselves and children.

Isatu K. (left) is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in a village called Kakump, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately age fifty-six, married to a businessman and they have six children together. Three of Isatu’s children are grown-ups and three are attending school.  Isatu sells market food like pepper, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions,  rice and other locally produce food stuffs. She has been in this business for many years now. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business, make more sales and better profit.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 58 years old. He is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters. All are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Stephen is a trader. He runs a cold store. He supplies to food vendors in his community. He procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. Stephen has been in business for barely one year now and wants a loan to buy fresh fish and meat in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Biter Oscar

texts.es:
el sr. Biter Oscar V. tiene 36 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de papas y yuca, tiene   cuatro años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, vende de lunes a sabado en el mercado las Americas de la ciudad de comayaguela, compra en el mayoreo los quintales de papas y yuca, va muy temprano para poder obtener una verduras de buena calidad, el saco de papa lo compra a $ 20,00 y lo vende a $ 30,00, y el de yuca compra $ 30,00 y lo lo vende a $ 35,00 obtiene utilidades mensuales de $ 360,00.
El vive con su esposa y su hija de tres años, el solicita el credito para comprar verduras papas y yuca asi mismo quiere comprar productos de abarroteria como ser maiz, frijoles, huevos, arroz, café, ya que tiene una pulperia, la cual se la administra su esposa.
Quiere tener una variedad de productos para ofrecer mas a sus clientes, es un señor muy risueño, querido por sus clientes.
el desde niño se dedica a esta actividad, su meta a corto plazo surtir ambos negocios y asi tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Biter Oscar V. is 36 years old, and he has been selling potatoes and yucca for four years. He sells his products Monday through Saturday in the Americas market in the city of Comayaguela. He purchases wholesale potatoes and yucca. He goes very early so that he can get good quality vegetables. He buys a sack of potatoes at $20,00 and sells it at $30,00. He buys yucca at $30,00 and he sells it at $35,00, from which he earns $360,00 in monthly profits.

He lives with his wife and his 3-year old daughter. He is asking for this loan to purchase vegetables, potatoes, and yucca, as well as grocery items such as corn, beans, eggs, rice, and coffee since he has a store that his wife manages.

He wants to have a variety of products to offer more to his clients. He is a very cheerful man and is loved by his clients.

Since he was a child, he has been engaging in this type of business. His short-term goal is to stock both businesses to have better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes and yucca

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. Florence supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for six years now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina B. sells gari,beans and provisions at Cape coast. Regina has received junior high school.  She is single and has two children. Regina has been selling gari and beans since 2004. She is responsible for up keeping of her family. Her loan will be used to buy to purchase more fresh beans and provision for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy to purchase more fresh beans and provision for resale.

loans.name: Mayra Yamileth

texts.es:
la sra. Mayra Yamileth L. tiene 35 años de edad, se dedicaba a la venta de zapatos desde hace varios años, la cliente vendia en un mercado local de comayaguela en la quinta avenida, el jueves 30 de julio hubo un incedio en el cual perdio todo su negocio y quedo completamente calcinado, la perdida fue aproximadamnete de $ 3,750,00 ella solicita el credito a la institucion para comenzar de nuevo ya que no cuenta con un capital para invertir de nuevo en su producto, la alcaldia de Tegucigalpa les va a ayudar a hacer los puestos de venta de madera, y si no es asi, ella va a comenzar a vender como vendedora ambulante por mientras se lo hacen, ella vive con su esposo quien labora en una empresa privada como guardia de seguridad y lo que el gana es para el sustento de los alimentos y la escuelas de sus dos hijas.
Fue bien triste platicar con la cliente ya que se encuentra bien decaida por la perdida de su negocio, su meta a corto plazo es poder comenzar de nuevo con la venta de zapatos ya que viene una temporada alta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra Yamileth L. is 35 years old and has been selling shoes for many years. She sold them at a local market on Fifth Avenue in Comayaguela, but she lost her entire business due to a fire on July 30th. Everything was completely reduced to ashes and the loss was approximately $3,750. She is requesting a loan to restart her business since she doesn't have capital to reinvest in more products. The mayor of Tegucigalpa is going to help rebuild the wooden market stalls, but if this doesn't happen, she is going to become a travelling salesperson in the meantime. She lives with her husband who works as a security guard at a private business. Her earnings help provide food and education for her two daughters. It was very sad talking with Mayra because she is in low spirits after the loss of her business. Her short-term goal is to start selling shoes again now that peak season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and flip-flops for men, women, and children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Colosa is the group coordinator of the Banco De Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action). She lives in the slums of Santo Domingo where both electricity and water (none of which is potable) services are unreliable. She lives in a small home with her husband and four children and sustains herself with her business selling "Ebel" brand cosmetics to salons in her neighborhood.

Colosa hopes to use this new loan to continue increasing the size of her business with the goal one day of opening a "super salon." To help make this a reality she is also continuing to study technical studies at her local university. In addition to her own studies, Colasa insists that her children continue to study and she intends to use her business earnings to see her children through to university. A final dream is to one day have the ability to travel all over the world! She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: More Ebel cosmetics to sell to Salons

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace G. Jonah sells cosmetics at Cape Coast. Grace G. has received senior high school education. She is married and has three children. Grace G. has been selling cosmetics since 2009. She is responsible for paying of rent and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cometics for resale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more cometics for resale at the market.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: La joven Noemí M. de 28 años de edad, se caso a los veinte años con su esposo de profesión ebanista, tiene un hijo de dos años,  desde hace un año se ha dedicado al negocio de cuajadas, y zapatos y ropa por encargo, y hasta ahora le ha ido bien ya que es un producto consumible por todos los Nicaragüenses, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, con este préstamo es su cuarto ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de zapatos y en cantidad de cuajadas para seguir ofertando en diferentes sectores y captar clientela para obtener mejores utilidades de ganancias, lo cual utilizara con los ahorros la remodelación de su casa. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo ya que ha sido de muchos beneficios para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar zapatos y cuajadas

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena B. sells phone cards and second hand clothing at Tantri near Cape Coast. Helena has received no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a painter. Helena has been selling phone cards and second hand clothing since 2005. She is responsible for upkeeping of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more phone cards and second hand clothing for sale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards and second hand clothing for sale at the market

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is fifty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all out school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. Hannah is into palm oil production business. She supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. Hannah has been in business for over twenty – five years now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. sells materials, clothing, shoes and bags Cape coast. Sarah has received senior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a phone cards dealer. Sarah has been selling materials, clothing, shoes and bags since 2007. She is responsible for paying up keeping of her family. Her loan will be used to buy to purchase more cloths, bags, shoes, and weavon for resale on the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy to purchase more cloths, bags, shoes, and weavon for resale on the market.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, two sons and five daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into ointment production business. Beatrice produces the ointment from raw materials such as shear butter and other ingredients. She supplies to retailers in her community. She buys the butter from northern Ghana where cost is effective. She has been in business for ten years now and wants a loan to buy shear butter in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy shear butter

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana C. S.; vive en la zona de la Calichera de Comas; de 37 años de edad, separada de su esposo, debe trabajar duro para poder solventar los gastos de mantención de sus dos menores hijos.
Hace unos años, inició trabajando en la venta de cerámicas, compraba la mercadería y la iba ofreciendo casa por casa, esta rutina le tomaba casi todo el día, debiendo dejar solos a sus hijos.
Viendo que cada vez sus pequeños hijos necesitaban de su presencia, decidió que debía cambiar de rubro.
Con los préstamos obtenidos de EDAPROSPO, fue invirtiendo golosinas, abarrotes, gaseosas e instaló una bodega en su casa. Así ella puede ahora trabajar y a la vez pasar más tiempo con sus hijos quienes son su razón y motivo de tanto sacrificio.
A la fecha ella cuenta con una bodega, que su fuente de ingresos y con ello puede cubrir sus gastos personales y algunos gastos del hogar.
Su sueño, es tener un bazar de ropa y regalos en un lugar comercial, le ha puesto mucho empeño y está ahorrando para lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Ana C. S. lives in the region of Calichera de Comas. She is 37 years old and she has separated from her husband. In order to provide for her minor children, she has to work hard. A few years ago, Ana started to sell pottery. She used to buy her pottery supplies and sell the pottery door-to-door. This routine kept her busy almost all day long and she was forced to leave her children alone. When she realised that her little children needed her presence, Ana decided to change business. With the loans she has received from EDAPROSPO, Ana invested in sweets, groceries, and soft drinks and she set up a small grocery story in her own house. Now she can work and at the same time spend more time with her children, who are the reason for so much sacrifice, but give her motivation. To date, Ana owns a small grocery store, which is her main source of income. With the profit from the store, she can cover her personal expenses and also part of the house expenses. Her dream is to own a clothes and gifts store in a commercial centre. Ana has put much effort in this dream and she is saving money to achieve it.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Luisa Silva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business - Store

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 24 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter, who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to provide for her family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Vida is a trader. She trades in textiles, particularly underwear for ladies. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures her goods from Accra. Vida has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
GABRIELA C. S.; casada, tiene una hija de 5 años y se dedica a la venta de salchipapas todas las noches, en la zona de la Calichera de Comas.
Hace ocho años, su madre le traspasó su carrito sanguchero y desde ese momento empezó a trabajar con la meta de hacer crecer su negocio.
Como todo nuevo trabajo al comienzo fue un poco difícil y le tomó mucho esfuerzo sacar adelante su negocio; inició vendiendo menú al medio día a muy pocos clientes; ahora tiene una clientela fija a quienes brinda pensión y por las noches ofrece sus salchipapas, pollos broaster y sanguches siendo satisfactoria la venta; ya no solo con su carrito sanguchero si no que ha implementado un espacio de su casa para habilitar un pequeño restaurante.
Gracias a su trabajo ella puede cubrir los gastos del pago de la pensión del colegio particular de su hija y el pago de una profesora particular; además de otros pequeños gastos.
Su próxima meta a lograr en el lapso de uno a dos años es alquilar el local ubicado al lado de su casa e implementar una juguería.
El préstamo solicitado en ésta oportunidad es para invertir en la compra al por mayor de mercadería.
Ella manifiesta que gracias a EDAPROSPO ha conseguido progresar en su negocio, ya que el tipo de préstamo que le brinda es beneficioso para ella por ser a corto plazo.
texts.en:
GABRIELA C. S. is married and has a five year old daughter. Every night, she sells “salchipapas” (a dish made with fried potatoes and sausages) in the Calichera de Comas district. Eight years ago, her mother handed down her sandwich cart, and since that moment she started work with the goal of growing her business. Like all new work, it was a little difficult at the beginning and it took a lot of effort to build up her business. To start, she sold a midday meal to very few customers, but now she has a fixed customer base to which she sells food and at night she sells her “salchipapas”, fried chicken and sandwiches. She is happy with her sales and now, not only does she have her little sandwich cart, but she has also created space to enable her to have a small restaurant in her home. Thanks to her work, she is able to cover the costs of private school for her daughter, the wages of a private teacher as well as several other expenses. Her goal over the next year or two is to rent a small booth located at the side of her house and start a juice stand. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy merchandise. She would like to express her thanks to EDAPROSPO for having enabled her to grow her business and for providing her with the benefit of a short term loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her food making businesses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is fifty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all out school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Esther is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. She supplies to retailers in her community. Esther procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 60 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. All are out of school. She works very hard to support her husband and to be able to provide for her family. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. Ama sells the kenkey with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
L. señora Juana A. está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar L. inscripción y comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares D. sus dos hijos que tiene estudiando ya que desea que tenga los estudios necesarios para su futuro.
Doña Juana tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes el cual es L. fuente D. ingresos que tiene para su familia y con el cual planean pagar este crédito.

loans.use: Pago de inscripción, comprar uniformes y útiles

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one son and one daughter. Both are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Yaa lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Yaa is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. Yaa sells it with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, two sons and six daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Elizabeth is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. She sells it with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. Elizabeth has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is married with a grown daughter. She lives and works in Zaporozhye, a big industrial city in the south-eastern part of Ukraine. Antonina sells lingerie and knitted wear in the biggest city market, which is called Angolenko. She owns a vending kiosk there. She also sells her inventory at regular clothing fairs in local malls. Antonina has a hired employee who works for her as a salesman in the marketplace. It helps her focus more on other aspects of business management and has proven to be a good tool on her way to success.

Antonina has been in this business niche for 10 years. Her enterprise has grown up to 50,000 Grivnyas in merchandise and 3,000 Grivnyas in net profit. Today she is seeking a loan of 11,300 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise for her retail business.

loans.use: To restock her merchandise for the fall season

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 53 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Felicia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Felicia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is forty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Gladys lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. Gladys supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Petronila Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Petronila S. es una mujer de carácter muy osado, quien a sus 45 años de edad, se ha destacado por su arduo esfuerzo para alcanzar sus metas, las cuales ha podido disfrutar con satisfacción. 

Ella posee dos tipos de negocios, de los cuales en uno (Venta de frutas y Verduras) aunque generan menor volumen de ganancia que el otro otros, éstas son a un menor plazo. Su otro medio de ingresos es la venta de ropa variada por encargo, que le generar mayor cantidad de ganancias pero a un mediano plazo. En su conjunto ambos generan ingresos bastante relevantes que le han ayudado a prevalecer en pie en el mercado.

Petronila pretende invertir su crédito en la compra de productos surtidos que ya tiene encargado y seguir incrementando la variedad en sus frutas y verduras. ¡Y por qué no! Dice Petronila, ¡Llegar a tener mi propia pulpería y hasta tienda de cosméticos!

loans.use: Productos varios que tiene encargado por sus clientes

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with two children. His family is a typical Ukrainian family of four from Ordzhonikidze. Alexander sells bags, backpacks, clothing and footwear items in the central city market and travels to remote villages to sell his merchandise in small marketplaces there as well. He started his enterprise 7 years ago. Currently, Alexander has about 26,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His profit is about 3,900 a month. 

Alexander is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to increase his stock and sales as a result. He has been in the business long enough to know that the type of inventory he offers is always in demand. This is why Alexander is hoping to keep his business running and even open his own small store someday.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Esther lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. She supplies to retailers in her community. Esther procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter, who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Abena is a trader. She trades in all kinds of footwear for both genders. Abena hawks and treks to other towns to sell. She procures her goods from Accra. Abena has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: buying footwear in bulk

loans.name: Diez De La Mañana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Diez de la Mañana, está formado por Ivonne Guadalupe J., Verónica M., María del Socorro S., provenientes del Barrio San Judas, ubicado en la Ciudad de Managua.

Doña Ivonne Guadalupe J. de 51 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo; quien desde hace mas de 4 años inicio una pulpería en su casa, con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su casa y las condiciones en las que sus hijos se iban a criar. 

Afirma que con los créditos que ADIM le ha facilitado a podido incrementar sus productos y satisfacer la demanda que tiene por parte de sus clientes, su crédito pretende invertirlo en seguir surtiendo su pulpería y así poder recibir más ganancias para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

El grupo Diez de la mañana tiene 2 años de estar trabajando con ADIM, éste es su quinto ciclo de crédito, y están muy satisfechas con el trabajo realizado.

Doña Verónica M. quien confecciona ropa de todo tipo (Pantalones, ropa de niños, vestidos de dama, entre otros)es la segunda integrantes del grupo y  María del Socorro S. quien elabora jugos a base de frutas, bebidas típicas Nicaragüenses y Refrescos (Coca-Cola, Pepsi-cola) es la tercera.
texts.en:
The "10 de la Mañana" group is made up of Ivonne Guadalupe J., Verónica M., and María del Socorro S., all natives of the San Judas neighborhood in the city of Managua. Ivonne Guadalupe J., 51, the group's coordinator, opened a grocery store in her house more than four years ago in order to improve her home, her standard of living, and the conditions in which her children would grow up. She says that the loans from ADIM have helped her offer more products and satisfy her customers' needs. She intends to invest her loan in continuing to stock her grocery store so she can earn more profits and get her family ahead. The "10 de la Mañana" group has been working with ADIM for two years. This is their fifth loan cycle, and they are very satisfied with the work they have done. Verónica M. sews all types of clothing (pants, children's clothing, women's clothing, etc). María de Socorro S. prepares fruit juices and traditional Nicaraguan drinks, and sells soft drinks (Coca Cola and Pepsi).

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with one child. His family lives in Ordzhonikidze. Alexander is a small entrepreneur and an owner of a kiosk selling food items in the central market of his home town. His vending kiosk is well known at the market for a variety of inventory and reasonably priced quality goods. Alexander has managed to stay afloat for 13 years. He admits that it was partly possible due to the consistent demand on the type of merchandise he offers for sale. Presently, he has 33,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His net profit amounts to 4,200 Grivnyas a month. 

Alexander is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and increase his turnover capital. He has an enterprising spirit and is always full of ideas on how to improve his business and make it even more profitable. Alexander has a good credit history, which secures prompt repayment of the current loan.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is fifty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to provide for her family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Esther is a trader. She trades in all kinds of cosmetics. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Esther procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the group coordinator of the group Minerva Mirabal, which is named after one of the three sisters famous for standing against the Dominican dictator Trujillo and becoming a martyr for the cause. At 61 years old, Carmen is old enough to remember the terror of the Trujillo era. She lives in a house with three other dependents in the northern slums of Santo Domingo, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

She has sought this loan as a means to continue improving her business with the goal of a becoming a prosperous ice cream vendor. She sees a strong market for this product as the Dominican Republic is hot enough to make anyone want ice cream. Finally, her goal is to use the money she makes to construct her own house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: purchasing ice cream

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all daughters who are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Monica is a trader, trading in cereals and other foodstuffs which she procures from nearby communities. She sells in her community and also supplies other food vendors. She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy cereals in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Yevgeniy

texts.en:
Yevgeniy is single and is a small-entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze. He runs a business selling clothing and footwear in his home town and neighboring villages in his region.

Yevgeniy can boast a nice selection of items he offers for sale. He has many loyal customers who trust him and always come back for quality and durable clothes and shoes when they shop at the market. Yevgeniy has been in the trade for four years but already has 25,000 Grivnyas worth of merchandise and makes about 3,700 Grivnyas in net profit each month. 

Yevgeniy is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to increase his assortment of merchandise for the fall season. He is characterized as a hard-worker and a determined businessman with clear vision and sober thinking. We believe Yevgeniy’s business will benefit from the current loan and will continue to grow, bringing him a stable income in the future.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of merchandise for the fall season

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both sons who are in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Comfort is a trader, dealing in local soap. She procures her goods from nearby towns and hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community. She also treks to sell in other towns. Comfort has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy local soap in bulk

loans.name: Nahomi Group

texts.es: El grupo Nahomi está formado por Doña Faviola Robleto R., Jamileth G., María Engracia S. y Mirian del Carmen R.
texts.en: Faviola Robleto R., Jamileth G., María Engracia S., and Mirian del Carmen R.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and other products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader, trading in smoked fish. Mary procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices and supplies to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for twenty-five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is married with a son. She lives in Zaporozhye.

Aya is in the footwear sales business. She launched her trade eight years ago and today she owns a vending kiosk in one of the biggest markets of her home town. She set a reasonable pricing policy which helped her gain a solid client base. Currently, she has about 16,000 Grivnyas in stock and her net profit is about 1,500 Grivnyas a month.

Aya is requesting a loan of 9,100 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal footwear for further retail sales. She is a very outgoing and cheerful person which helps her face the daily routine with a smile and handle business issues with a calm spirit. She believes the current loan will help her business keep its stable standing in the market and develop further in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal footwear

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty-one years old. She is married and currently has no child. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Margaret is a trader, trading in all kinds of jewels. She procures her goods from Accra and hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to sell in other communities. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy jewels in bulk

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana Isabel F. es una mujer de origen muy humilde que a sus 50 años de edad, refleja mucha serenidad y templanza. Desde que era muy joven aprendió la elaboración de tortillas de maíz (Las tortillerías en Nicaragua han sido una tradición ancestral) las cuales representan el complemento diario del plato nica tanto en el desayuno como en la cena.

“Es por esto que el comercio de las mismas no disminuye aunque la economía se decaiga, siempre en nuestros platos sobresale la Tortillita Nica” nos dice doña Juana. Y es la razón por la que sigo vendiendo mucho y deseo ampliar aun más mi negocio. De tal manera que pueda llegar a vender queso, crema, chicharon y leche Agria (Producto lácteo similar en textura al yoghurt) entre otros.

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la reposición de sus comales y utensilios para la elaboración de tortillas.

Es su primer ciclo individual, en ADIM pero lleva ya muchos ciclos en grupos solidarios (Con el grupo Fransela) y por su categoría como cliente A (El mejor cliente), ADIM le ha financiado un crédito individual.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel F. is a woman of humble origins. She is 50 years old and known for her calm and restrained personality. When she was very young, she learned how to prepare corn tortillas (an ancestral tradition in Nicaragua), which complements every Nicaraguan dish for breakfast and dinner.

“Our business doesn’t diminish when the economy declines because our dishes stand out because of the Nicaraguan tortilla,” says Doña Juana. This is the reason she continues to sell a lot of her product and hopes to further expand her business. She wants to sell cheese, cream, fried pork skins, sour milk (a dairy product similar in texture to yogurt), and other products.

Her loan will be used to replace her griddles and utensils for making tortillas.

This is Doña Juana’s first individual loan with ADIM, but she has participated in several solidarity loans (with the Fransela Group). She is categorized as an “A” client (the best rating), so ADIM has approved her for an individual loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment & materials for improving her business

loans.name: Varvara

texts.en:
Varvara is married with a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye where she works in the local market called Angolenko. She sells women’s outerwear and has already gained loyal clientele thanks to the variety of merchandise she has for sale and affordable prices.

Varvara has been running this business for fifteen years. Presently, she has 30,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital and about 3,000 Grivnyas in net profit every month.

Varvara is seeking a loan of 13,800 Grivnyas to purchase additional seasonal merchandise. All the loans she received prior to the current loan have had a big impact on her business and she is excited to be able to use additional funding to increase her sales even further.

This available capital will give Varvara the resources and flexibility to buy inventory in greater volume, allowing her to have more time and energy to focus on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa P. es madre de familia y tiene tres hijos pequeños en edad escolar y a los cuales les quiere dar el estudio necesario. 
Pero tiene un problema que no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares y se los están exigiendo en la escuela para su seguridad y aprendizaje, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y que sus hijos puedan empezar bien el ciclo escolar esté años. 
Doña María Luisa se dedica atender a la familia, el que se encarga de los gastos familiares y del ingreso es su esposo el señor Sotero De La Cruz que es empleado de una clínica en el departamento de guardia de seguridad, esté es el ingreso que tiene y con el cual planea pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. María Luisa P. is the mother of three small school-aged children and wants to give them everything they need to study.

However, she lacks the money to buy uniforms and supplies that the school demands for her children’s safety and class work. For this reason, she is applying for a loan so that her children can get their school year off to a good start.

Doña María Luisa is dedicated to taking care of her family. Her husband, Sr. Sotero De La Cruz, is responsible for the family expenses and income. He is employed by a clinic as a security guard, and his earnings will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase uniforms & school supplies

loans.name: Peniel Group 3

texts.en:
Luchi is the coordinator of the Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Peniel. The group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where electricity and running water (none of which is potable) are unreliable. She lives in a small house with her child. 

Luchi currently runs a mobile business, selling jewelry, belts, and shoes in the streets. She will use this loan to purchase her merchandise in bulk at a lower price. This will help her support her family by bringing in greater profits. It will help her to work towards her dream of owning her own store and being an important businesswoman in her community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy shoes, jewelry and belt buckles in bulk

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes C. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior, con el cual su negocio a tenido muy buenas ventas y a podido cumplir con los productos a su clientes.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir el negocio de verduras y fruta ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que surta de esté tipo de mercancía, pero ella no cuenta con el dinero para poder invertir, y no quiere descapitalizar su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando su cooperación en este préstamo y así poder surtir su negocio y  satisfacer a sus clientes con el producto que están demandando.
Planea pagar el crédito con los nuevos ingresos que generar el negocio con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes is grateful for the help of her previous loan. Her business experienced good sales and was able to satisfy the product requests of her customers.

She is requesting a new loan so that she can stock her business with fruits and vegetables because her customers have been asking for this type of merchandise. However, she does not have the funds at the moment to make this investment and she does not want to take money out of her business because she needs to support her family.

That is why she is requesting your cooperation with this loan so that she can fill her store and satisfy her customers with the products they are requesting. She plans to repay this loan with the revenues that result from this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en: M. Irene is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 25 years old and married with 3 children aged 5, 3 and 1 year. Her first-born child is in school. Hers is a success story. M. got pregnant with her first child while still very young. Her (now) husband has helped to make sure she continues her schooling at the University on the evening programme. During the day, M. is a businesswoman operating a grocery store. She sells general merchandise in Kirinya trading centre. She also has a poultry business at home with broilers for meat. She is a hard working young lady with a strong drive to succeed in life. Irene needs a loan to help buy more goods for her shop. She will use the funds to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread and so on, as well as to buy chicken feed for her broilers.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop, as well as chicken feed.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel C. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. 
Es solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la colegiatura de la escuela y los útiles que le están pidiendo a sus hijos ya que tiene cuatro niños estudiando, y el no tiene el dinero necesario para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus hijas de la escuela. 
Don Juan es una persona que recibe una pensión cada mes y su esposa la señora Crescencia Rea, es empleada de una fabrica en el departamento de elaboración, esté es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual un parte será para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Manuel C. has already had three loans with Kiva partner FVP which he has repaid punctually. He is now asking for a loan to pay school fees and buy supplies for his children. He has four children in school, and he doesn’t have enough money to cover their school expenses. Don Juan receives a pension each month, and his wife Sra. Crescencia Rea works in the manufacturing department of a factory. This is sum total of the family’s income, and a part of it will be to used to make repayments on the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy school supplies

loans.name: Joyas Para Cristo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Taina is the group coordinator for the Joyas para Cristo (Jewels for Christ), for a Banco De Esperanza (Bank of Hope) located in the slums of northern Santo Domingo where electricity and water (none of which is potable) is unreliable. She lives in a small house, which she shares with 5 other people.

She supports herself with a small business making and selling silver jewelry and furniture coverings. She is using this loan to further expand her business towards her goal of having her own store dedicated to interior design. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for making furniture coverings and Jewelry.

loans.name: Intiwara Group

texts.es:
Juana T. D. 46 años, venD. libros en la ciudad D. La Paz, en diferentes zonas, pero en su mayoría  venD. en “ La Tablada”, no tiene un puesto propio es ambulante, en esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, es decir más libros que ofrecer a sus clientes.  
Amalia Q., D. 44 años se dedica  a elaborar masitas, tortas, pasteles generalmente a pedido y necesita el préstamo para  la compra D. insumos como la harina, mantequilla y otros.
Al igual que Julia y Amalia, las demás integrantes del grupo “Inti Wara” tienen diversos negocios, como la venta chamarras, CDs, comida, deportivos, relojes, cosméticos, cotillones y sellos D. goma. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería  e incrementar sus productos  a sus clientes.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA E INSUMOS

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De La Ensenada Group

texts.es:
Antonia V. M. tiene un negocio llamado SERVICIOS GENERALES AVM ahí ve plasmado su esfuerzo y sacrificio, ella  se ha dedicado al trabajo D. la carpintería especializándose en muebles D. computo. La señora Antonia vive en los olivos Perú y nos cuenta que al ver que ese tipo D. negocio era una buena inversión decidió  empezar en este rubro, lo hace con la idea D. ayudar a su hijo  ya que el trabajaba como obrero para otra carpintería con el conocimiento D. el sobre carpintería y sus ahorros ella siente que ha logrado su objetivo D. crear su propia fuente D. trabajo lo que también le servirá para sus otros 5 hijos. Con el resultado D. su inversión pueD. ver crecer día a día su negocio ha logrado comprar algunas maquinarias para su carpintería, mejorar su casa y con sus ganancias logra cubrir todos los gastos que requiere su familia  ella actualmente planea comprar un carro ahora con el préstamo que le proporcionara EDAPROSPO comprara mas maquinas para ampliar su carpintería y generar mas trabajo, con todo esto ella pueD. ver que sus metas se están logrando día a día. 

*La Señora Antonia esta D. pie al final D. la columna (parados D. izquierda a derecha)
texts.en:
Antonia V. M. has a business called SERVICIOS GENERALES AVM which she has created through her effort and sacrifice. The business does carpentry work, specializing in computer furniture. Antonia lives in Los Olivos, Peru, and she tells us that when she saw this type of business, she decided it would be a good investment for her savings, and could utilize the skills of her son, an experienced carpenter. It could also serve as future employment for her 5 other children.

As a result of her investments, her business has grown little by little. She has been able to buy woodworking machinery, improve her house, and cover all her family expenses with her earnings. With this loan from EDAPROSPO, she will buy a car and additional machinery. Day by day, she is achieving her goals.

*In the photo, Antonia is standing at the far right.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
el grupo Las Luchadoras esta formado por 3 mujeres las cuales se conocen desde hace muchos años atras, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan para ganarse la vida:

la sra. nancy G. M. tiene 25 años, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de comida, su mama les enseño a elaborar ricos platos de comida, actualmente tiene 6 años de tener su negocio y a logrado atraer muchos clientes por su forma de tratar a las personas, cabe mencionar que tambien tiene un molino de quebrar maiz, nos comento que su sueño es tener un restaurante grande y bonito.

la sra. Maria Z. tiene 29 años de edad, ella vende cosmeticos, estos productos en la ciudad de san Lorenzo son bien vendidos, ya que aqui hay muchas mujeres en toda la zona y tiene muchas clientes. Maria es una persona muy activa y muy capaz para las ventas. su sueño es tener un supermercado.

la sra. Maria A. tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales estan estudiando en la escuela primaria, Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 6 años. su meta es poder tener un local para montar una tienda de ropa. 

todas ellas necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios que son la unica fuente de ingresos que tienen.

loans.use: compra de pollo, carnes de res y cerdo, frijoles, papas, harina, azucar, cafe, mantequilla, leche, refrescos, embutidos, lociones, pantalones, camisas, blusas, blumers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Communal Association "semilla" Group

texts.es:
En uno D. los Centros Focales D. Pro Mujer que se denomina “Los Andes” se encuentra L. Asociación Comunal “SemilL.”, liderizadas por su presidenta Encarna M., se reúnen cada dos semanas. Están juntas  hace 9 años aproximadamente y les gusta compartir y capacitarse en cada reunión que asisten, sobre todo les gusta temas D. salud porque les ayuda a cuidar a sus hijos y prevenir enfermedades como L. diarrea.

Variados son los negocios D. las integrantes D. este grupo, así Rebeca y GracieL. tejen chalinas D. lana D. alpaca, y ofrecen sus productos a los turistas, otras venden frutas, zapatillas, accesorios D. celulares y otros. En esta oportunidad todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando materia prima (lana) y mercadería (fruta, zapatillas),
texts.en:
In one of the Pro Mujer Focal Centres, the “Los Andes” Focal Centre, you find the Communal Association “SemilL.”. This Association is lead by its president, Encarna M., and the women meet every two weeks. These women are together for 9 years and they like to share their experiences and learn about different topics, in particular health, because it helps them to take better care of their children and prevent diseases such as diarrhoea.

The women in this group have different occupations. While Rebeca and GracieL. knit scarves with alpaca wool and sell their products to tourists, other women sell fruit, tennis shoes, mobile phones accessories and other items. At this moment, all of them need a loan to invest in their businesses, buying raw material (wool) and supplies (fruit, tennis shoes).

Translated from Spanish by Ana Luisa Silva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material and supplies

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
LUCY J. F., tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad y profesionales. Ella vive en la V zona de Collique.
