Tiene 12 años trabajando en su Salón de Belleza, Bazar y Librería.
Empezó con un salón pequeño que constaba de un sillón, un espejo y un mueble, luego de seis meses que pudo juntar un pequeño capital,  se trasladó a una zona mas comercial e invirtió en la implementación y decoración de su salón, además de invertir en mercadería de bazar.
Participó en una feria de venta de útiles escolares con lo que da inicio a su negocio de librería.
Hace cuatro años solicitó su primer préstamo a EDAPROSPO, los cuales lo ha destinado a la compra de mercadería y para terminar los acabados de su salón de belleza.
Esta vez solicita el préstamo para invertir en su librería.
texts.en:
Lucy J. F. is 48 years old, married, and has 2 adult children who are professionals. She lives in Zone 5 of Collique.

For the past 12 years, she has been operating a beauty salon, a bazaar, and a bookstore. She started her salon from a small room that consisted of a chair, a mirror, and a cabinet. After six months, she was able to accumulate a small amount of capital so that she could relocate to a more commercial area. Lucy established and decorated her salon, as well as purchased merchandise for her bazaar. She participated in a school supply fair that gave her the idea to open a bookstore.

It has been four years since Lucy received her first loan from EDAPROSPO, which she used to purchase merchandise and make final improvements to her beauty salon. For this loan, she will use the funds to purchase inventory for her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her bookstore

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
TERESA C.   M., tiene 61 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija mayor de edad. Vive en la zona de la Calichera en Comas.
Cuenta con un negocio de Taller de Confecciones y composturas.
Por dos años tuvo su taller en un puesto de mercado, luego lo trasladó a su casa en donde tiene 10 años.
A raíz de su jubilación, por su característica de ser una persona emprendedora y trabajadora ella inició su taller confeccionando prendas para venderlos en provincia, le fue bien desde el comienzo pero la actividad de confeccionar y viajar era demasiado pesada y terminó dañándose la columna.
A raíz de su lesión se quedó en casa dando servicio de compostura.  
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en mantenimiento de máquinas y materiales, como agujas, hilos, y otros.
texts.en:
TERESA C. M. is a 61-year-old single mother of an adult daughter. She lives in the Calichera zone in Comas, Peru. She owns a fashion tailoring and alterations shop. For two years she's worked at a market, but about 10 years ago she has moved her workshop to her house where's she's been working from. Following her retirement, this hard working entrepreneur started her own business making clothes to sell in the city. But the physical demands of sewing and traveling became too much for her to handle, and she ended up hurting her back. Due to this injury, Teresa has made herself a workshop at home offering her seamstress services. She requests a loan to invest in the maintenance of machines and to buy materials, like needles, threads, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MATERIALS AND MACHINE MAINTENANCE

loans.name: Suma Qhana Ura Group

texts.es:
Elsa M., vende carne y los días jueves y domingo alista su  mercadería para dirigirse a la feria “16 de julio” donde vende su producto hace dos años, otros días vende en la zona de “San Roque”, y para hacer crecer su negocio necesita del préstamo y comprar mercadería ya que con el capital que cuenta actualmente no le es suficiente. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo “Suma Qhana Ura”, también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de velas, chompas, escobas, ají y otras se dedican al lavado de autos. Todas se agruparon recientemente para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus ingresos, así también esperan estar mucho tiempo juntas y asistir a sus reuniones puntualmente en el Centro Focal “Panamericana”.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Tannis

texts.en:
"'Maid by Me' allows me to control my own destiny and make my own success.”

Tannis, known as “Tan,” had her own greeting-card business in Canada before she came to the U.S. in 2003. She had no experience in the cleaning industry, but fell into it when a friend asked her if she wanted to earn some extra money by helping a family member paint his house. The homeowner was so impressed by her work that he asked for her housekeeping help on a regular basis

In the last year, Tan has quickly built a base of 20 clients for her residential janitorial service business, Maid By Me, and has developed a following on Yelp.com. Tan differentiates her business by using only natural cleaning products like baking soda, vinegar, steam, and lemons. She loves a challenge now and then, like carpet stains, candle wax, and hard water deposit removal. She prides herself in not leaving anything unfinished.

Currently, Tan does not have the equipment or staff to service more than three houses a day, and has to turn down clients. Her lack of credit history made her ineligible for a bank loan or a credit card. She is grateful for a $2,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, which she will use to purchase two heavy-duty vacuums, cleaning supplies, and an outdoor storage container. 

Tan has one dedicated full-time employee, and in the future would like the ability to add to her staff so she can take on more of a business management role. 

She says, “One day when I expand, my staff will clean as I do...no exceptions!  I’ve been running the show for about a year and a half now with much success. Success in my definition is keeping my clients happy--not just satisfied.”  

Learn more on the Maid by Me website at http://www.creamofthecrops.toesinthegrass.info/html/maid_by_me.html .

loans.use: Two heavy duty vacuums, outside storage, cleaning supplies

loans.name: Xequisis Group

texts.es: Las cinco señoras del grupo Xequisis, se han reunido para sacar abante a su familia ya que en los ultimo tiempo la vida es dura en el lugar de Nahualà, y ellas se han dedicado a compra y venta de ropa tipica, en años anteriores para ayudar a mantener a sus hijos; las señoras buscando un apoyo y acudieron a la Instituciòn ASDIR para apoyar a las señoras ya que no cuentan con un capital sufieciente de  trabajo, y ellas quieren surtir màs la venta para obtener màs ganancias y asi prosperar y realizar el sueño màs grande ellas relatan y sueñan tener una casita para proteger las inclemencis de tiempo.
texts.en:
The five women in the Xequisis group have joined together so their families can get ahead—life recently has been hard in Nahualà. In previous years, the women earn their living by buying and selling traditional clothing so that they could support their children. Later, deciding they needed help, they went to Kiva partner, the ASDIR Association, as they didn’t have enough working capital. They wanted to have more stock so they could increase sales, earn more money, and prosper. They wanted to fulfil their biggest dream of owing a small house to shelter them from bad weather.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more clothing

loans.name: La Reina 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the group coordinator of the L. Reina (the Queen) which is based in the slums of northern Santo Domingo, where electricity and running water (none of which is potable) is unreliable. She lives here with eight other individuals in a small home which she rents.

Her goal in taking this loan is to continue growing her business selling "ropa D. paca" (used clothing which comes in large containers from the United States) as well as shoes. She aims to use her augmented income to support her children as they go through school. Her long term dream is to own her own home, which will save her considerable money over paying rent. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: More clothing and shoes for selling

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Catarina's Group

texts.es: Las señoras: Catarina, Manuela y Ofelia G., asucieron a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para que se le apoyara para tener un capital de trabajo, ya que las señoras son viudas y quieren sacar avante a sus hijo e hijas en el estudio para tener un buen futuro; ellas se han dedicado a la compra  y venta de ropa tipica nuevas y usadas, y esto a venido a ayudar para los gastos de la familia y el sosten de ellas  pero quiere incrementar sus capital para tener mejor ingreso y tener un mejor nivel de vida y por eso piden esa ayuda.

loans.use: aplicacion de capital

loans.name: Kory Chuyma Group

texts.es: Norma  U. es la actual presidenta del grupo “Kory Chuyma”, se reúnen cada dos semanas y les gusta participar de las capacitaciones, están juntas hace aproximadamente 8 años. Todas tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de frutas, pito, comida, otras en su mayoría, se dedican a la confección de chamarras y deportivos. Aseguran que necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la tela, forro y lana y las que comercializan productos necesitan el crédito para comprar mercadería. Solo como ejemplo Genoveva de U. de 51 años  vende frutas en la ciudad de El Alto, ella es ambulante, es decir, no tiene un lugar donde vender sus frutas, lo que hace es recorrer a píe ferias y zonas ofreciendo su producto.
texts.en:
Norma U. is the current president of the group 'Kory Chuyma'. The group's members have been meeting regularly once every two weeks for the past 8 years. All women in the group own their own business: some sell fruits and food; others make and sell clothes. They request the loan to buy raw materials like fabric, lining and wool, and the ones that sell goods need the loan to buy their merchandise. 51-year-old Genoveva de U., for example, sells fruits in the streets of El Alto; she doesn't have her own shop, so she walks around street fairs and markets offering her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials and Merchandise

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es:
ALCANCÍA COMUNAL “CRISTO REY D. NICOLÁS D. PIÉROLA”


Esta alcancía comunal participa en EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD hace un año y ocho meses, va en su sexto ciclo D. préstamo, lo denominaron así porque los doce integrantes depositan su fe católica en Cristo y la gran parte D. ellos viven en el asentamiento humano Nicolás D. Piérola - Chosica. El negocio D. ellos es la repostería, manualidades, tejidos, venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, productos D. belleza.
Todo el grupo se reúne mensualmente en la casa D. uno D. los integrantes para efectivizar sus pagos y es la presidenta quien se encarga D. supervisar que esto se cumpla, en este caso la señora Ana V. M. ocupa este cargo, desD. hace doce años se dedica a criar animales D. corral en su casa como son: cuyes, gallinas, pavos, patos; además elabora tortas, prepara comida y bufetes para distintos eventos, ella tiene pedidos con asiduidad. Con ello genera ingresos que contribuye en los gastos familiares, arreglar su vivienda, darles una vida sosegada a sus hijos, no depender solo del dinero D. su esposo.
Ana compró tintes vegetales para tortas, moldes D. repostería y menajes con el primer crédito que recibió, pues era lo que necesitaba para la elaboración D. una torta D. quinceaños. 
Con el préstamo reciente comprará una olla nueva, adornos acrílicos para tortas; así no tendrá la necesidad D. seguir alquilando estos implementos. Lo que ella necesita es comprar una refrigeradora ya que es una herramienta esencial en su negocio lo hará más adelante con las ganancias que obtenga D. sus ventas.
texts.en:
Communal Bank "Cristo Rey Nicolas D. Pierola"

This Communal Bank has been involved with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD for one year and eight months. The members are participating in their sixth loan cycle. Their group is so named because they are of the Catholic faith and live in the settlement of Nicolás D. Piérola - Chosica. Their businesses incluD. bakeries, handicrafts, textiles, food sales, clothing, and beauty products.

The entire group meets once a month at the home of one its members in order to collect their payments. The president is in charge of their meetings and makes sure that everything has been completed. Sra. Ana V. M. currently holds this position. She has been raising farm animals from her home for the past 12 years. She breeds guinea pigs, chickens, turkeys, and ducks. She also makes cakes, prepared meals, and buffets for various events. Sra. Ana receives orders regularly, so she is able to generate income to pay for her family expenses and make home repairs. She can proviD. a normal life for her children and not have to be solely dependent on her husband’s income.

Sra. Ana used her first loan to buy vegetable dyes for cakes, pastry molds and kitchenware. These supplies were needed to make quinceaños (15th birthday) cakes. She will use her current loan to buy a new pot and acrylic cake decorations so that she does not have to rent these items. What she needs to buy is a refrigerator because it is a necessity for her business that will help her generate more profits from her future sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Solidarias Group

texts.es: El grupo las solidarias, han trabajado durante 7 años atras,en la compra y venta de ropa tipica usada y nueva para sostenimiento de sus familia y de ellas misma, ya que en este tiempo es dura la vida pero ellas tienen la certeza de seguir creciendo y luchando para sacar avante a sus hijos y poder salir avante vendiendo sus productos en otras areas, Por lo que se han acercado a la Asociaciòn  ASDIR para apoyarlas en el capital que ellas necesitan ya que en el lugar donde se hubican es de extrema pobreza, pero con la yuda ellas venderan màs por tener màs surtido sus mecaderia y tener mejores condiones de vida.

loans.use: aplicaciòn de capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY CHARCOAL, RICE, SUGAR, TOILET PAPER, OIL, FLOUR AND BEANS

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es: Julia A. y Antonia M., se dedican a vender chicharrones fritos, ellas compran el chicharrón semipreparado fritan y embolsan con algún juguete, luego ofrecen a tiendas y puestos de golosinas ya que es un producto muy requerido por los niños. Trabajan en esta actividad  hace 2 años e indican que les  va bien, pero pueden mejorar es por eso que se animaron a agruparse con algunas amigas y vecinas y formar el grupo “Zapatito Veloz” que es parte del Centro Focal “Collpani”, sus demás compañeras también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de licores, sal, comida y la confección de chamarras y mantas. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima o mayor mercadería.
texts.en:
Julia and Antonia sell fried pigskin. They buy the partially prepared pigskin and bag it with a toy. They then sell it to stores or candy stores because it is a product that children enjoy. They have worked at this activity for two years and it is going well. There is always room for improvement and that is why they decided to join with some friends and neighbors and form the group called “Zapatito Veloz”(Fast Little Shoe). This group is part of the focal center “Collpani”. The rest of their partners also have their own businesses such as selling liquor, salt or food or making vests or shawls. All of them need loans to buy raw material or wholesale merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material and merchandise.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Y Luchadoras De San Juan Del Paraná Group

texts.es:
El comité de San Juan Del Paraná esta compuesto por 16 integrantes, todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de comidas ambulante, venta de ropas, venta de frutas, modista, etc. El monto que recibe cada señora varía de 300.000  a 1.400.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya están realizando actualmente. 
1.	Silvia Bustamante S., Venta de frutas ambulante, 
2.	Gloria Estela S. Torres, Venta de remedios naturales 
3.	Nohelia Noemi López Rodríguez, Venta de ropas, 
4.	Elena V., Venta de comidas ambulante, 
5.	Gertrudis A. de Almada, Venta de ropas en un puesto de venta,  
6.	Griselda Q. Bogado, Venta de cosméticos ambulante
7.	Feliciana G. de Meza, Venta de mercaderías ambulante, 
8.	Julia F. Gómez, Venta de verduras,  
9.	Liliana Isabel A. López, Venta ambulante de mercaderías, 
10.	Zulma O. Ayala, Venta de remedios naturales, 
11.	Liduvina R. López, Venta de harina de maíz, Mirian Carmen López de Arellano, Chipera,  
12.	Norma Beatriz O. F., Venta de manualidades, 
13.	Juliana G. Chávez, puesto de venta de mercaderías, 
14.	Barsilisa P., Modista, 
15.	Ramona F. Vera, Venta ambulante de mercaderías
texts.en:
The committee of San Juan Del Paraná is composed of 16 members. All the women engage in productive activities, such as: itinerant food sales, sale of clothing, sale of fruits, dressmaker, etc. The amount that each woman receives ranges from 300,000 to 1,400,000 PYG. All the women are applying their loans to businesses they are currently operating.

1. Silvia Bustamante S., itinerant sale of fruit. 2. Gloria Estela S. Torres, sale of natural remedies. 3. Nohelia Noemi López Rodríguez, clothing sales. 4. Elena V., itinerant sale of food., 5. Gertrudis A. de Almada, clothing sales in a stall. 6. Griselda Q. Bogado, itinerant sales of cosmetics. 7. Feliciana G. de Meza, itinerant sales of merchandise. 8. Julia F. Gómez, sale of vegetables. 9. Liliana Isabel A. López, itinerant sales of merchandise. 10. Zulma O. Ayala, sale of natural remedies 11. Liduvina R. López, sale of corn meal 12. Carmen López de Arellano, sale of cheese buns 13. Norma Beatriz O. F., sale of handicrafts. 14. Juliana G. Chávez, stall for selling merchandise. 15. Barsilisa P., dressmaker 16. Ramona F. Vera, itinerant sales of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, fabrics, flour, oil, meats, corn meal, yarns or thread, cosmetics, fruits, and other items for sale.

loans.name: Unidos Por El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Pilar A., pictured far right, is the bright and engaging leader of the group Unidos por el Progreso (United in Progress). This group has proven themselves extremely credit worthy after taken out and successfully repaying 5 loans together. Each time they take out a larger loan in the attempt to grow there business even more. 

Pilar started out just selling coal from her house. With every loan she is growing her business even more and now she also sells fried foods, fresh juices, and fish. With this loan, she will add fruits and vegetables to her inventory. Her goal is to grow her business enough to one day open up a full blown restaurtant. Pilar is an extremely hard worker and when she isn´t running her business from her home, she works as a house cleaner for her neighbors. 

You can help Pilar and the rest of the women in the Unidos por el Progreso group achieve their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: coal, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Grupo Panyevar1 Group

texts.es: El grupo de panyevar a estado trabajando unos 7 años atras siempre con la mentalidad de superar ya que en el area de Santa clara, hay mucha pobreza y las mujeres han luchado par salir avante y teniendo en mente sobre salir con los hijos y darles estudios y brindarles el apoyo ya que ellas relatan que no tubieron esa posibilidad para estudiar, han venido a la asociaciòn ASDIR para pedir ese apoyo que ellas tanto lo necesitan para incrementar  sus ventas y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida ya que le es necesario ofrecer otros productos de ropa tipica pero no cuenta con el capital necesario, las mujeres se han unido para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Panyevar group has been working together for seven years. They always have in mind that they want to overcome, as there is a lot of poverty in the Santa Clara area. The women have fought to get ahead, keeping in mind that they want their children to get ahead. They want to support their children and give them an education, which is a possibility that they never had. They have come to the ASDIR Association to ask for this much needed support to increase their sales. This way they will have better living conditions. They need to offer products other than typical clothing, but they do not have the necessary money. The women have united to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mi Cajero Group

texts.es:
ALCANCÍA COMUNAL “MI BANQUITO”



Alcancía conformada hacia dos años y medio, sus diez integrantes viven en el distrito Matucana, personas que se dedican a la siembra de la alfalfa, crianza de cuyes, venta de flores, dulces, comidas, abarrotes. La mayoría vende sus productos en los mercados, paradas, cuentan con clientes fijos.
Julia P. P. es la presidenta de este grupo, desde hace ocho años se dedica a vender leche asada, su dulce tiene mucha demanda por los consumidores debido al sabor incomparable, también trabaja limpiando casas de vez en cuando. Con estos negocios ha solventado y mantenido a su familia, lo que además le permitió comprar unos pares de cuyes que hoy en día necesitan el levantamiento de un cerco, porque la que tenían fue humedecida, derrumbándose de a pedazos por el alud que cayó en su vivienda, ella piensa invertir en esto además comprar nuevos vasos para postres que ella misma manda hacer en una fábrica. 
Angela D. R. es la tesorera que hasta la fecha ha sabido llevar bien su labor. 
Hace cuatro años compró unos pares de cuyes diez hembras y un padrillo (macho) con un dinero que juntó de los trabajos eventuales que tuvo, con el tiempo los cuyes fueron multiplicándose, actualmente son 35 hembras y 15 machos; ella invierte con el dinero prestado en la alimentación para sus animales como es la cullina alimento esencial para los cuyes, como también alfalfa y algunas vitaminas. La venta de este negocio le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como toda madre el sueño es darle una vida sosegada a su pequeña hija de tres años de edad. Angela invertirá con este préstamo en la renovación de una rejilla para los cuyes porque con el tiempo la anterior se ha desgastado, igualmente vitaminas. Posteriormente quiere juntar un pequeño capital a fin de empezar a estudiar una carrera técnica algo que quiso hacer pero lamentablemente sus padres no pudieron darle debido a las circunstancias económicas que atravesaban.
texts.en:
Mi Banquito Community BankThis bank was formed two and a half years ago, and its ten members live in the Matucana district. They are people devoted to planting alfalfa, raising guinea pigs, selling flowers, sweets, food, and groceries. Most of them sell their products in the markets and stops. They have fixed customers. Julia P. P. is the president of this group. She has been selling pudding for eight years. There is much consumer demand for her pudding because the flavor is incomparable. She also works cleaning houses once in a while. With these businesses she has supported her family. The businesses also allowed her to buy some guinea pigs. She now needs to put up a fence. The one she had was damp, and it crumbled into pieces from the landslide that fell on her house. She plans to invest in this. She will also buy new dessert glasses that she herself has made in a factory. Angela D. R. is the treasurer; she has known how to do her work well. Four years ago she bought some guinea pigs, ten female and one male, with the money she put together from the occasional jobs she had. In time, the guinea pigs started multiplying. She now has 35 females and 15 males. She invests the money from the loan in food for her animals. She will buy “cuyina” (guinea pig feed), an essential food for guinea pigs, along with alfalfa and some vitamins. Angela will invest this loan in renovating a cage for the guinea pigs because, with time, the outside has worn out. She will also buy vitamins. The sales from this business have allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses. Like all mothers, her dream is to give her little three year old daughter a peaceful life. Later she wants to get together a little capital to start studying for a technical career. It is something she wanted to do, but, sadly, her parents could not provide this due to their economic circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Alberto G. tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero aun y vive desde hace mucho tiempo en el Barrio San Miguel Centro del distrito de Cambyreta.

El señor Carlos posee un Puesto de venta de Cds en la zona baja de la ciudad de Encarnacion desde hace mas de 5 años, y tiene muchos clientes de la zona que siempre compran de su puesto tanto Cds como DVDs y películas. Mediante este trabajo el puede aportar ingresos al hogar, cubrir sus gastos y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se le presente.

El hoy día esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas Cds, DVDs y Películas para su puesto. El monto que solicita es de Gs. 1.000.000.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto G. is 28. He is still single, and he has lived in the San Miguel Centro neighborhood in the Cambyreta district for a long time. Carlos has had a place selling CDs in the lower elevation area of the city of Encarnacion for over five years. He has a lot of customers from the area who always buy CDs, DVDs, and movies from him. Through this work he is able to contribute income to his household, cover expenses, and cover anything unexpected that occurs. He is now asking for a loan to buy more CDs, DVDs, and movies for his place. He is asking for Gs. 1.000.000.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs and movies

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Señor Daniel tiene 45 años de edad, es casado, vive en su casa propia con su cónyuge y tres de sus hijos de los cuales dos están trabajando por cuenta propia, una de ellas tiene también un Puesto de Ventas a lado del puesto de su padre. El cliente nació y se crió en la zona de Encarnación.
EL cliente trabaja en la zona baja de Encarnación desde hace 15 años, allí posee dos puestos de ventas de mercaderías y de productos naturales, artículos electrónicos como calculadoras, linternas, pilas, accesorios para celulares, etc. El señor tiene ya formada una clientela que semanalmente le compran y le genera un buen ingreso como para que pueda cubrir los gastos del hogar y sus obligaciones. 
El señor también realiza ventas de sus productos en su domicilio en donde tiene un pequeño local del que se encarga de atender su señora, eso hace que se pueda tener otra fuente de ingresos en el flujo familiar y que además su señora pueda ayudar a generar ingresos sin descuidar la casa. 
El Señor Daniel esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías para surtir sus puestos. El monto que solicita es de gs. 2.000.000.
texts.en:
Daniel is 45 and married. He lives in his own house with his spouse and three of their children. Two of their children are working on their own. One of them also has a sales stand next to her father’s stand. He was born and raised in the Encarnación area. He has worked in the lower elevation area of Encarnacion for 15 years. He has two sales stands there, and he sells merchandise such as natural products and electronic products like calculators, flashlights, batteries, and cell phone accessories, etc. He has an established customer base, and they buy from him weekly. This generates good income so that he can pay the household expenses and his obligations. He also sells products in his home where he has a small place, which his wife runs. This allows him to have another source of family income, and it allows his wife to help generate income and still take care of the house. Daniel is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock his stands. He is asking for gs. 2.000.000.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise: calculators, radios, flashlights, clocks, batteries, cell phone chargers, natural remedies, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Samaritana Group

texts.es: El grupo las samaritanas han acudido en la Asociaciòn ASDIR para apoyarlas en sus capital de trabajo ya que ellas tiene la neceisad de incrementar màs su capital por las vanta de ropa tipica en ese arèa, ya que han trabajado 5 años con anterioridad y esto le a venido ayudando a mantener en todo sus gastos que realizan y sus necesidades ya que ellas esperan tener màs incremento de venta a traves de sus productos de ventas de ropa tipica, y asi tener mejores de vida y poder superar y alcanzar otra grado de nivel de vida, ya que en esa zona hay mucha pobreza y ellas caminan  varios kilometros para ir a vender sus productos en otra area,pero necesitan surtir su mercaderia; por tal razon quieren tener màs capital para tener màs ingresos.

loans.use: aplicaciòn de capital

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón C. tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Nancy Lopetegui, tienen 1 hijo y viven en su propia casa que se encuentra situada en el Barrio Buena Vista de la ciudad de Encarnación.

El señor Ramón es propietario de una Sastrería cerca de su domicilio en donde las prendas de vestir para caballeros, es decir los trajes, camisas, chalecos y chaquetas, las confecciona el mismo. El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 7 años y esto siempre le ha permitido salir adelante, cumplir sus compromisos y cubrir los gastos familiares. Su esposa, la señora Nancy trabaja como vendedora en un comercio que esta situado en la zona baja de la ciudad y posee un salario fijo. Mediante este trabajo ella también puede aportar ingresos al hogar y saldar cualquier gasto que se les pudiera presentar.


El señor Ramón hoy DIA esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de telas ya que tiene muchos pedidos para confeccionar y tiene mucha clientela. El monto que solicita es de Gs. 1.400.000.
texts.en:
Ramón C. is 33 years old. He is married to Nancy Lopetegui, and they have 1 son. They live in their own house, situated in the Buena Vista neighborhood in the city of Encarnación. Ramón has a tailor’s shop near his home where he makes and sells men’s clothing, including suits, shirts, vests, and jackets. He has made a living from this activity for more than 7 years, and it has allowed him to get ahead, fulfill his obligations, and cover the family’s expenses. Nancy, his wife, works as a saleswoman at a store in the Zona Baja [a commercial district in the city] and has a regular salary. Because of her job she also contributes to the family's income and helps to pay off any expenses that may arise. Ramón is currently requesting a loan for purchasing fabric, since he has many orders to fulfill and numerous customers. The amount he is requesting is Gs. 1.400.000.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Srta Gladys es soltera no tiene hijos pero vive en la casa de sus padres en un Barrio retirado a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad cabe destacar que viven con tres hermanos todos ellos trabajan y aportan en los gastos del hogar.

El negocio de Gladys esta montado en el predio de la terminal de Ómnibus hace muchísimo tiempo y que es atendida por ella y por su mamá. En la misma se dedican a la venta de bebidas como ser jugos, gaseosas, golosinas además venden carteras y remedios naturales para mate y tereré que son dos bebidas típicas y muy consumidas en nuestro país.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercaderías como ser termos y carteras que tiene que traer de otra ciudad denominado Ciudad del Este le conviene traer de ahí por el precio bajo que tiene y así le deja más ganancias.

loans.use: compra de jugos, gaseosas y golosinas.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es: Magno tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 6 años. Desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio de venta de comida oriental, el cual atiende todos los días desde el medio día hasta altas horas de la noche. El local donde tiene su restaurante es arrendado y se ubica en una de las principales calles de su ciudad, lo que le garantiza las entradas económicas. Magno se encarga de cocinar la comida, pues tiene un gran talento para la cocina y de esta manera mantiene a su clientela satisfecha. Para más adelante Magno quiere mejorar la ambientación y presentación de su restaurante, adquiriendo nuevos artefactos y utensilios de cocina, pieza clave para la preparación de sus comidas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se siente muy motivado y comprometido a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita será destinado a la compra de sillas, mesas y utensilios de cocina como sartenes, pailas y espátulas nuevas.
texts.en:
Magno is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and his little son who is six. For the past three years he has had a business selling oriental food. He works every day from noon until very late at night. He leases his restaurant and it is located on one of the main streets in his city. This guarantees his business is good. Magno cooks the food. In fact he is a very talented cook and this is how he maintains satisfied customers. In the future, Magno would like to improve his restaurant’s ambience and appearance. He would like to buy new supplies and utensils for the kitchen. These supplies are key to his food preparation. This is the first loan he has had with MFP. He feels very motivated and committed to be punctual with his payments. The money that he requests will be used to buy chairs, tables and utensils for the kitchen such as frying pans, pans and new spatulas.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and supplies for his restaurant.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: “Inicie la construcción de un baño en mi vivienda, solo que ahora me falta poner el techo de concreto y el enjarrar en las paredes pero con los gastos familiares me ha sido imposible juntar el dinero y llevar a acabo mi proyecto, quiero que mi familia tenga un baño en buenas condiciones y sobre todo más higiénico para mis hijos”. Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para poner losa de concreto y poder enjarrar las paredes del baño de mi casa”.

loans.use: PONER UN TECHO DE CONCRETO Y ENJARRAR PAREDES

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad en casa de su padre en el distrito de Ciudad Eten, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 9 años que su madre creó una bodega – tienda en su casa, al morir ella, hace año y medio, María pasó a encargarse del negocio y también del cuidado de su anciano padre, desde entonces ha sabido salir adelante, allí ella vende abarrotes, frutas, útiles escolares y ropa; su esposo es mototaxista (chofer de vehículos motorizados muy utilizados en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) y del trabajo de ambos depende el sustento económico diario de su familia.

Ella desea trabajar arduamente ahora que sus hijos están aún pequeños para brindarles una mejor educación y en el futuro darles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional, además desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su padre.

Por este motivo ella está solictando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 900 nuevos soles que desea invertir en la compra de más mercadería para ampliar su negocio.

María es una persona muy estimada por los vecinos de su localidad, los que la consideran una mujer muy responsable y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and lives together with her husband and their two children, six and two years old, in her father's house in the Ciudad Eten District which is located about 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Nine years ago her mother created a store in her house and when she died, a year and a half ago, it fell to María to take charge of the business and also to take care of her elderly father. Since then she's known how to get ahead and she's selling groceries, fruits, school supplies and clothing there. Her husband is a taxi driver (since chauffeur-driven motor vehicles are widely used to transport goods and passengers). They both need to work in order to provide for their family's daily needs. María wants to work as hard as she can now that her children are still small in order to provide them with a good education, and in the future, to give them the opportunity to study a professional career. She also wants to provide a better quality of life for her father. That's why, for the first time, she is seeking a loan of 900 New Sols from Edpyme Alternativa which she wants to use to buy more merchandise in order to build up her business. María is a person who is well-regarded by the neighbors in her area. They consider her to be a very responsible woman who is devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to build up her business.

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es:
La señora María Irene S. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. 
Ella tiene ya más de 3 años dedicándose a la venta de artículos de papelería el cual es el ingreso de su familia, pero al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía ya que viene el regreso a clase y quiere tener suficiente variedad. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir. 
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo y así comprar la mercancía, para tener más ingreso a la familia y al negocio con el cual pagara esté crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María Irene S. already has four previous loans with FVP which were paid on time.

She has more than 3 years experience selling stationery in order to support her family. However, she lacks a wide variety of merchandise and wants to obtain more inventory in time for the new school year. She does not have the money at the moment to invest.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can bring in more income for her family. The additional revenue will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora María Cecilia A. a tenido cuatro créditos con FVP el cuales a pagado puntual mente. 
Ella tiene ya más de quince años con su negocio de venta de ropa usada y zapatos en diferentes partes de la cuidad, esté es el ingreso que tiene para ella ya que vive sola. 
Desea invertir al negocio mas variedad de mercancía y empezar a comprar ropa de invierno, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y así poder invertir en el negocio sin descapitalizarse, y con los ingreso que genere de la una mercancía planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María Cecilia A. repaid four previous loans with FVP on time.

She has more than 15 years experience selling used clothing and shoes in different parts of the city. Since she lives alone, this is the means by which she supports herself. She wants to acquire a wider variety of merchandise and would like to start buying winter clothes, but she currently does not have the money to invest.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase merchandise without having to take money out of her business. The additional revenue that she generates will be used repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio R. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior préstamo, con este logró que su casa esté más segura cuando él no está.
Ahora está solicitando su colaboración para comprar mercancía para su negocio que es la estética de belleza, quiere acondicionar el local ya que es la fuente de ingresos y el soporte para mantener a su mamá que es una persona mayor de edad y ya no puede trabajar. Él es soltero y su única familia es su señora madre.
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es el señor Marco Antonio en su salón de belleza (se aprecia en la foto atendiendo a un cliente), él personalmente se encarga de atenderlo, realizando cualquier tipo de trabajo que le soliciten sus clientes.
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio y así tenga más ingreso para su bienestar propio.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco Antonio R. is very grateful for his previous loan which he used to make his home more secure for his family when he is not there. He is seeking your assistance with purchasing merchandise for his business, which is a beauty salon. He wants to improve the condition of the store, since this is the means of support for himself and his mother who is elderly and cannot work. He is single and his only family is his mother. The person that appears in the picture is Marco Antonio in his beauty salon (in the picture he is with a client). He personally serves his clients, doing any style they request. He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in his business and have more income for his family. The revenue he generates will be used to repay this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & equipment

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 16, 13, 11 y 5 años de edad en el distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica al comercio de pescado fresco y salado, todos los días se levanta muy temprano y se dirige hacia el terminal pesquero de su localidad para comprar mercadería y luego ir a venderla al mercado del distrito de Pomalca, ubicado a 10 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo, al igual que la mayoría de los hombres del lugar, se dedica a la pesca artesanal, y durante las temporadas de veda le ayuda en su pequeño negocio, ambos dependen de estas actividades para sustentar los gastos económicos diarios de su familia y juntos se esfuerzan todos los dias para brindarles lo mejor.

Ella desea terminar de construir su casa y también desea seguir invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos brindándoles algún tipo de educación técnica superior por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la ampliación de su negocio con la compra de más pescado para vender a sus clientes.

Manuela es muy conocida en el mercado de Pomalca, sus clientes acuden a ella confiados en la calidad de los productos que vende y sus compañeros de trabajo la consideran una mujer activa y responsable.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 37-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and 4 children ages 16, 13, 11, and 5 in the district of Santa Rosa, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 5 years now, she has been selling freshwater and saltwater fish. Every day, she gets up very early and heads to her local fish market to purchase fish, then sells it at the market in the district of Pomalca, located some 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Her husband—like the majority of men in the area—works in artisan fishing. During the closed season, he helps Manuela out with her small business. They depend on these jobs to cover the daily family expenses, and they work hard every day so that together they can give their family the best.

She would like to finish home construction and to keep investing in their children’s education by helping them get some sort of technical degree. For this reason, she needs to request a 1,100.00 PEN loan from our institute for the very first time. She is planning on investing this money in expanding her business by purchasing more fish to sell to her customers.

Manuela is very well-known at the Pomalca market. Her customers turn to her because they trust in the quality of the products that she sells. Her co-workers consider her to be a very active and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia P. es madre soltera y tiene una hija menor de edad bajo su responsabilidad a quien desea darles los estudios necesarios para su futuro.
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el uniforme y los útiles escolares que le están pidiendo para que su niña pueda cursar el ciclo escolar este año. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para surtir los gastos de la escuela y que su hija pueda estudiar.
Eugenia trabaja en una compañía de botanas como promovendedora esté es el ingreso que genera para su familia y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.

loans.use: Comprar uniformes y útiles escolares

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella L. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Estrella is married and has 3 school-aged children. Estrella operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables to sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP. These funds will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops for raising. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Estrella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops for growing.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida D. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Florida is married and has 2 school-aged children. Florida operates a tailoring business. She provides general alterations & tailoring services to local community members. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In Oct. 2006, Florida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Florida is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP. These funds will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Florida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie A. is from the village of Talusan, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Rosemarie is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a variety store. She sells a variety of products such as vegetables, spices and other items, in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP. These funds will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the educational expenses of children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 51 años, vive con sus hijas Julia de 24 y Fany de 20, en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al cuidado de niños en su Wawahuasi (Casa de cuidado de niños, programa gubernamental) llamado “Los Suspiritos”, lugar donde alberga a 5 niños, los cuales sus madres dejan a su cuidado cuando salen a trabajar. Ella es muy paciente y animosa, ya que dice que “cuidar niños no es nada fácil, están en una etapa en la que requieren mucha atención y aprenden todo lo que ven”, es por ello que Felicia trata de educarlos con juegos ilustrativos y lecturas. Para el futuro desea tener un local de estimulación temprana para ayudar a los niños a desarrollar sus talentos, es por ello que siempre está preocupada de aprender nuevas técnicas de enseñanza en su wawahuasi. Actualmente está pensando en contratar a una nutricionista para que pueda desarrollar dietas con alimentos balanceados para que puedan crecer saludables. Felicita quiere a los niños como si fueran sus hijos y ahora que su segunda hija está estudiando para ser profesora de educación inicial, cree que podrán hacer crecer su hogar y brindar una mejor atención. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y todos los préstamos que ha tenido anteriormente le han ayudado a mejorar su hogar. Ella está muy agradecida y es por ello que siempre es muy puntual con los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará material educativo, así como sacos de arroz, fideos e ingredientes para el preparado de los alimentos de los niños.
texts.en:
Felicita is a 51-year-old woman who lives with her daughters—Julia, age 24, and Fany, age 20—in her own house. For 8 years now, she has been taking care of children for a living in her Wawahuasi (a government-funded day care center) called “Los Suspiritos.” She looks after 5 children whose mothers leave them under her care so that they can go to work. She is a very patient and spirited person, stating that “Taking care of children is no easy task. They are at an age when they need lots of attention, and they learn everything that they see.” For this reason, Felicita tries to educate them by giving them lessons and using illustrative games. In the future, she would like to have her own early childhood educational center so that she can help students develop their talents, which is why she is always concerned with learning new pedagogical techniques in her wawahuasi. She is currently thinking about hiring a nutritionist who can create well-balanced diets for the children so that they can grow up healthy. Felicita loves the children as if they were her own, and now that her youngest child is studying to be an Early Education teacher, she thinks that they will be able to expand their home and provide better service. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. All of her previous loans have helped her to improve her household. She is very grateful, which is why she is very punctual with her repayments. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase instructional materials, as well as sacks of rice, noodles, and the ingredients she needs for the children’s meals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase instructional materials and food for the children that she looks after

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 45 años, vive con sus hijos Estefany de 12 y Matías de 9, en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al cuidado de niños en su Wawahuasi (Programa gubernamental de madres que cuidan otros niños en su casa cuando las madres de éstos salen a trabajar) llamado “Los Chocolatitos”. María estudió obstetricia y cuida a los niños desde las 6 de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 5 ó 6 de la tarde, dependiendo del horario de trabajo de sus madres, dándoles en ese trayecto el almuerzo y muchas veces la cena. A ella le gusta mucho el trabajo con niños porque piensa que son almas inocentes, aunque esto no indica que su trabajo sea fácil, ya que por el mismo hecho de ser niños juegan, se pelean, lloran y ella tiene que abastecerse para cuidar a los 7 que están a su cargo. Pero María no sólo los cuida, si no también los educa como en un jardín de niños, con juegos educativos, tareas, etc. Ella se siente muy feliz y en el futuro espera albergar a muchos más niños, contratar a personas que la ayuden y así poder brindar un mejor servicio. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos de sus créditos anteriores. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de muebles (sillas y mesitas) para ambientar su local, así también alimentos (no perecibles ) para preparar los alimentos de los niños.

loans.use: Compra de muebles y comestibles

loans.name: Hech

texts.en:
Hech N., age 23, is married and has a young child. She lives with her husband and her child in the Takeo province. She is engaged in a business of selling Cambodian traditional cakes made from palm fruit, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in a private club in the city, earning an income of $2 per day. 

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, N. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, N. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike and its trailer to transport her cakes to sell in the village and other nearby places. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike and its trailer

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja tiene 42 años, vive con sus hijas: Nelsy de 21, Mindi de 18 y Junior de 12 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de colchones, los cuales ella misma elabora en su propio taller, el cual implementó en su casa, a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, ya que las cosas no fueron nada fáciles. Hoy en día Maruja produce a la semana 12 colchones con ayuda de un maestro especialista y un ayudante, quienes elaboran los colchones para que ella solamente trabaje en las fundas y forros, los cuales confecciona en su máquina de coser. Posteriormente distribuye su producción en su vecindario y también los vende en el mercado Huamantanga, el más conocido de su distrito. A pesar del pago que hace a las personas que trabajan con ella, las ganancias que le quedan son favorables, por ello Maruja está contenta porque tiene muchos sueños de incrementar su producción y en el futuro tener una fábrica grande y mejor implementada. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida porque los préstamos anteriores que ha tenido siempre la han ayudado a sacar adelante su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita quiere comprar mayor cantidad de material para elaborar sus colchones y aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Compra de materiales

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong E., age 40, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. She sells food at a tourist place in her province, earning approximately US $3.00 per day. Her husband operates a motor-taxi in the provincial town, earning an income of US $2.00 per day. 

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, E. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, E. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase wood to build small benches for tourists to sit on when they visit the river. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo Hernán de 44, quien es taxista, y con sus hijas: Zoila de 15 y Cecilia de 3, en su casa propia. Sara es una emprendedora mujer que siempre está al tanto de una ocasión de progreso, es así que hace algunos años no dudó en aprovechar la oportunidad que le dieron un grupo de monjas para poner una botica en su vecindario. Pues ella vive en una zona en la que no hay este tipo de establecimiento cerca, es así que se animó a incursionar en este negocio. Pero paralelamente, mantiene el negocio al cual se dedicaba, que es la venta de joyas. Sara considera su botica un negocio muy rentable, ya que no tiene mucha competencia y además le permite realizar su antiguo trabajo, además ahora quiere vender ropa y algunos adornos para aumentar su clientela y hacer que su negocio crezca. Es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que sus amigas con las que conforma su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una mayor cantidad de medicinas, asimismo comprará joyas para enviarlas a su hermana para que las venda en su ciudad y también ropa para aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Nesiel

texts.en:
Mrs. Nesiel C., age 35, is married and is a resident of Baybay Bonifacio, Misamis Occidenal. She is blessed with 4 children all of whom are minors. She earns income by selling and delivering fish, a business that she operates with her live-in partner. 

They use a motorcycle to deliver the fish to other municipalities and barangays and earns an average net income of at least P10,000.00 each month. When there is no fish to be delivered, her partner uses their motorcycle as a “jabal-jabal” to transport passengers to other barangays. 

With the income from their businesses, they have able to support her family, especially her minor children. She has remained a good member of her cooperative for one year. For her 4th loan, she is applying for P14,000.00 under the PDP-LP program to add capital to her fish business. Her only dream in life is to provide a better future for her four children.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish business

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: “Hace 2 años me dieron mi casa, es de interés social y esta muy pequeña pero mi esposo y yo tenemos planes de ampliarla para vivir más cómodamente, ahora lo que necesitamos es poner las protecciones en las ventanas y al frente de la casa para que este más segura nuestra familia”
texts.en:
“Two years ago, I received my house through a government-funded program. It is very small, but my husband and I have plans to expand it so that we can live more comfortably. What we need now is to install security bars on the windows and a protective all in front of the house so that our family can be safer.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install window security bars and a wall

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson B. is from the village of Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 56 years old. Nelson is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Nelson has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nelson has been in business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Nelson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to plant. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila V. is a native of Talim Island in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 58 years old and married to Emeterio, who is 47 years old and a fisherman. She has one daughter, Jessa, who is 14 years old and a high school student.

Bringing her family out of poverty is her main goal in life. In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with hopes of having access to capital for her business. Since she joined ASHI and has had capital, she ventured into fishing by having fish cages that she believes have brought her good income for her family. She really wants to continue her business and have more investment in it, knowing that their village is the biggest source of fresh water fish in the province.

Now on her fourth loan, she requests a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital in her fish cage business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for two bundles of fish nets, 100 pieces of bamboo, nails and payment for labor.

She is hopeful that with her determination and hard work, she can expand her business and will have additional fish cages and be able to send her child to school up to college until she find job.

loans.use: To pay for two bundles of fish nets, 100 pieces of bamboo, nails and payment for labor

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny H. is a woman of faith and courage to overcome poverty that impedes the way of her family to success. She is 31 years old and married to Oliver, who is 34 years old and a vendor. She is a mother to three; a girl and two boys. All of her kids are still young and in elementary grades. She lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines.

In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with hopes of having access to capital for her business of raising hogs. Her previous loans were her capital in starting the business of hog raising and she manages it well and it brings in good income. She wants to continue the business and will make more investments in it.

Now she is requesting a loan of 25,000 pesos as her fifth loan in ASHI to pay for five piglets, 14 sacks of assorted feeds, vitamins and transportation expenses. She believes that her hog raising business will grow and she dreams of expanding it and making it a pig farm. She also dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To invest in her hog raising business

loans.name: Mary Catherene

texts.en:
Mary Catherine U. is a 34-year-old manager of her own business. She is married to Ronnie, 35 years old. She has two daughters to take care of. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.  She is a living picture of a mother whose dream is to provide a decent life for her children.

She is an expert in the house rental business, since she has a house in the city and a family is renting it. She receives payment on a monthly basis. The business is good but sometimes she has encountered problems, especially when the lessee could not pay her rent payment for a month. She needed to think of another business to support her house rental business.

In 2002, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with dreams of having capital for her planned business of reselling items. She has been doing the resale business for two years already. The business brings her enough proceeds and seems to be growing. She wants to invest more in her resale business.

On her ninth loan, she requests an amount of 40,000 pesos as additional capital for her resale business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for ten sacks of commercial rice, 45 cases of assorted soft drinks, five sacks of sugar, and ten gallons of cooking oil; all for resale.

She dreams of expanding her business. She also aspires of building an additional housing unit for rent and of course to send her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of commercial rice, 45 cases of assorted soft drinks, five sacks of sugar, and ten gallons of cooking oil; all for resale.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda G. is from the village of Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 64 years old. Alfreda is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Alfreda operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alfreda has been in business for over 40 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Alfreda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to harvest. Alfreda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alfreda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy R. is from the village of Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 26 years old. Joy is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Joy operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joy has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to harvest. Joy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita A., 34, lives in a shanty village near the Manila Bay in Parola, Binondo. Her husband works as a truck helper for a cargo company. They have 4 children, all of whom are in grade school.

Nenita has a general store. She opened her store two years ago, but it has already grown from a small store with only a few items to sell to what it is now. Nenita makes at least P9, 000.00 net sales per month, which she uses to pay for her family's basic daily needs including children’s education.

She dreams of seeing all four of her children finish their studies until college, because it was her challenge to get to college. 

Nenita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in June 2007. She belongs to the Intramuros Branch. She is now on her 5th loan cycle. Nenita applied for a P10, 000.00 loan from the cooperative to  expand her general store. She is buying more items to sell.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception N. is from the town of Tukuran. She is 45 years old. Conception is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Conception owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Conception has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 11,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

Conception joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conception has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Conception is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Conception from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta T.. She is a jolly “grandmother” to her neighbors in Parola, Tondo, Manila – a shanty village near a busy harbor. Her husband Esteban, age 57, is an auto mechanic. They have 4 children, 2 of whom help them to pay for the family’s daily needs with their own earnings.

Violeta cooks and sells "banana cue," a famous street snack made of caramelized bananas skewered on thin bamboo sticks. This snack is very popular among students and workers. She has been in this business for 5 years and her profits have helped to pay for her family’s daily needs. Violeta earns at least P20, 000.00 a month from her business.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the summer of 2007. She is due to finish repaying her previous loan with the cooperative. She already applied for a new loan of P10, 000.00 to expand her business. She wants to open additional stalls for selling banana cue in other areas of the city. She dreams of seeing her children finish their college educations.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Monh's Group

texts.en:
C., 20, has been married to Bunran, 29, for years and has a child who is still young and attends school. C.'s family lives along the Mekong river and C. earns a living selling fish caught by her husband. She is taking a loan to renovate parts of her house.

C. is the leader of this group which consists of five members including her. The other members are:

L., 62, who is also a fish seller and sells next to her house.

T., 42, who is a fisherman along the Mekong river.

H., 56, who is a middleman buying fish in bulk from the fishermen and then selling the fish in bulk to the retail sellers in the market.

T., 27, who owns a small place for selling fish in the market.

loans.use: To renovate parts of her house

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer O. is from the town of Tukuran. She is 38 years old. Jennifer is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

Jennifer joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jennifer from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Managing a bakery gives Erlinda B. a satisfying day. However, she is still hoping for further development to make her bakery more competitive. She would like to borrow PHP 35,000 from Kiva lenders to use as additional capital. her business has been her partner in sending her children to school and also a big help in supporting the needs of their family. She was also able to employ some of her relatives in her bakery. 

Erlinda is 53 years old and very determined to become successful by maintaining her bakery. She loves the business and enjoys entertaining her customers. Erlinda is thankful because she was blessed with two children, Erickson and Ana Kristina, who will someday manage the business and are hoping for its success. Erlinda believes that patience is the key to success. When strategies in life are designed without patience, she says, nothing will happen.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita C. is 32 years old and is married to Alfredo. They have two children, ages 9 and 13. Both are in school, one in high school, the other in elementary. Anita's husband is a fish vendor.

Anita runs her own hog breeding and fattening business while also attending to the needs of her children at home and doing the household chores. Anita's business started about the time she got married. At that time, she had no means of financing a hog breeding and fattening business, so she only bought piglets to fatten. Once fattened hogs are sold, after four months, the original capital is replenished; in fact, profit from this kind of business can be as much as double its capital.

When Anita joined the Kiva field partner, ASHI, in 2003, she was able to get a loan. That's when she started her hog breeding and fattening business. Now Anita has two gilts (female pigs raised for breeding) that produce piglets. Instead of selling piglets for $32 to $53, Anita chose to fatten the piglets and sell them in volume after four months, bringing in from $85 to $127 each. Profits from her business finance the family's daily needs and support her husband's fish selling business.

This kind of business also incurs a lot of expenses when piglets are newly born. They need immunizations and vaccinations to insure better growth. Feed is also expensive. In order to sustain her business by meeting its financial needs, Anita is requesting a loan from ASHI that will be much larger than the one she had previously.

Someday, Anita wants to have her own piggery, where she would breed and raise a lot of pigs. She also wants all of her children to be able to finish college.
