loans.use: To finance her hog breeding and fattening business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy C., age 43, is from Parola, Tondo, Manila, a shanty town near Manila Bay. She is married to Ramon, age 50. They have 2 children.

Amy has been managing her general store for 5 years. She started with just a handful of biscuits to sell to children and a few canned goods. Now, her general store has grown. She makes a monthly profit of at least P8,000.00,  especially on peak months.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2002 and was among the Intramuros Branch’s pioneer members. She needs a loan of P10,000.00 to use as additional capital for her growing general store.

It has been her dream to convert her general store into a larger grocery chain some day. She also works hard to support her children’s education.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Recently, a group of four members including S., 30, who is a mother of two children whom are still young and attend school, is talking a loan to invest in their bamboo baskets service. S. with her life partner Sien, 32, who is also joint her business field have given two children whom are still young and attend school. The family has earned a good income from its making. S. is looking for a loan to invest her hand making of bamboo baskets. S. said that the loan has helped her very much because nowadays she has a more incomes by increase her raw materials of bamboo and increase her products to the users. She will offer her children the degree of bachelor at least.

loans.use: to invest her hand making of bamboo baskets.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:

To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 11,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio S. is from the village of  Salay in Misamis Oriental. He is 52 years old. Eleuterio is widowed and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Eleuterio runs a sari-sari (variety) store where he sells both food and daily-use products in the local community. Eleuterio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eleuterio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleuterio is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will Eleuterio's first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to educate his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie L. is requesting a larger loan than last time from the Kiva field partner, ASHI, to be used for expanding her hog fattening business. She repaid the entire amount of her previous loan on time and with good business performance.

Virgie started her hog fattening business about the time she and her laborer husband got married. Her husband's income is sporadic and insufficient to sustain the basic needs of their four children, so Virgie's profit from her hog fattening business is important for the family's financial well-being. The profit she has from her business is as much as double the amount of its capital, once hogs are sold after four months of raising. However, she couldn't expand her business as much as she imagined, because she had no other sources of capital. Her profits are all used for family expenses.

In 2004, she joined ASHI for a loan which she used for her business. Since then her business started to grow along with the amount she borrows. Based on the growth of her business, the amount of capital it needs and her capacity to pay, Virgie is now requesting a larger loan. She wants her business to expand by buying more piglets to fatten and sell after four months. This way she can increase her profit to help finance the education of her children (ages 12 to 19) who are all in school. Moreover, Virgie wants to have a piggery (raise a large volume of pigs) to be able to sell more and be able to send all her children through college.

loans.use: To finance her hog fattening (pig raising) business.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
This is Cornelia C., who is 40 years old. Her husband Apolinario, age 52, is a street vendor. They have six children, only two of whom still attend school.

Cornelia has been selling soft drinks, bottled water, biscuits, candy, and newspapers to commuters for a couple of years. She also offers mobile phone credits. The business is going well because her small place is in a bustling area right at the foot of a busy train station used by commuters who always need a cold drink. She makes P30, 000.00 a month from this activity.

Cornelia likes her work a lot because she meets a lot of people and she sometimes engages them in interesting conversations. She uses her earnings to cover family’s expenses and she’s saving so she can have a bigger "sari-sari" (general) store in the near future. Her small space is always a victim of frequent clearing operations done by the city hall operatives.  

Cornelia needs a loan of P27,000.00 to expand her business. This is her 10th loan from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. What she likes most about her fellowship group is the level of trust and camaraderie among all the members. She will use the loan money to apply for business accreditation with a prominent telecommunications company, which will provide easier access to mobile phone credits.   



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Mobile phone credits

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita F. is from Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to Samson F.. The family is blessed with two children. Esterlita became a member of the Cooperative in October 2007. She has been enjoying her grocery store, which provides their income. 

She wants a loan to use as additional capital for her grocery store so seh can support her children's education and other financial needs. She started her business when she got married. She is thankful that Paglaum gives financial assistance that can support her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for grocery store

loans.name: Nicolasa

To make a living, Nicolasa sells vegetables to local community members. Nicolasa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Nicolasa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicolasa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nicolasa is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory to be used as working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Nicolasa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Loicith

texts.es:
La señora Loicith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años, y madre de una hija, que aun dependen de ella.

Loicith, es una mujer luchadora que se dedica al servicio de Internet y a la venta de abarrotes, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace.

En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su Internet, cuenta con maquinas modernas, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará cables de red, para implementar mejor su cableado y con parte del dinero también invertirá en la compra de abarrotes. 

Loicith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará cables, para mejorar su cableado

Oliva has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Oliva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oliva is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand he product offering. This will be Oliva's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 03 que aun dependen D. ella.

Tiene varios años dedicándose a este tipo D. actividad, D. venta D. pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central D. su Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo D. Manuela Ramos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.
Así, siguió superándose, ahora venD. pollos en cantidad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un puesto alquilado del Mercado Central, donD. brinda el servicio, a los moradores D. la comunidad y amas D. casa.  Con este préstamo D. S/.3,000.00,  comprara  pollos vivos en jabas, para D. esta manera vender más y satisfacer a sus clientes.
Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Marina Dice: Que el pertenecer a un grupo D. mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina belongs to the Communal Bank, "Nuestra Senora D. la Paz II:, in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, in San Martin Department. She is married, is 53 years old, and has 6 children, 3 of whom are still her dependents. For some years she has been in the business of selling cleaned and cut-up chickens in a stall in the Central Market of her city. She began her business when she received a loan from Manuela Ramos and since that time, has done very well and has good customers. In this, she continued to do better and better and now sells a large number of chickens. Currently she is continuing with the same business in the stall that she rents in the Central Market. There she offers her service to the community residents and to housewives. With this $3,000 sol loan ($1025), she will buy live chickens in crates so that she can sell more and please her customers. Today she is an independent woman, and she is the one who runs and makes the decisions in her business. She says that "to belong to a group of women has helped her know what her rights are and together see that these are respected..

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens in crates to increase her stock

loans.name: Tep's Group

texts.en: This group of three provides a service of hand-making bamboo baskets. The group is led by R., 28, who is the mother of three children who are still young and attend school.  They are looking for a loan to invest in their handmade baskets service. R. is married to Sovann who helps her business through the nearby villages.

loans.use: To invest in their handmade baskets service.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet manages a pharmacy in the public market of Andres Bonifacion in Diffun, Quirino. With the income that she generates from her pharmacy, she was able to help her husband to send their three children to school. 

Now, she needs a loan to purchase additional medical products to sell in her pharmacy. She would like to borrow PHP 35,0000.00 to purchase additional merchandise. Janet and her husband are doing their best to providing their family with a higher standard of living. Janet wants her business to grow because she believes that it is a big help to people in their search for cheaper and effective medicines for their illnesses.   

Janet is 48 years old and happily married to Roy. The couple was blessed with five children. Two of her children have graduated from college and three are still studying. They are Sande Cris, Kathleen, Ilohim, Jinkishe and Jared Omega. She is hoping that her younger children can finish their studies like her two older children.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Oeu's Group

texts.en: C. is the leader of a group consisting of three members, including herself. She is married to Kosal who is a local construction worker. She has three children who are still young and attending school. Recently she planned to grow rice on her field during the late rainy season to be harvested before Khmer New Years Eve. So she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. The other two in the group are S., who is also a local construction worker, providing  housing and other building projects, and C. who farms locally with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:

To make a living, Janice owns a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Janice has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Janice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be Janice's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Alrey

texts.en:
Alrey, or “Cablay,” as he is known, lives in Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is a farmer. He graduated from a vocational course in auto diesel mechanics, but due to lack of job opportunities, he end up helping his parents on their farm, which allowed him to save for his future.  

Alrey plants rice and some vegetables on his parcel of land twice a year. His need for additional capital made him decide to borrow PHP 10,000.00 from Kiva lenders. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and pesticides to maintain crop production. 

With his patience and sacrifices, he can earn a net income of PHP 12,000 per harvest season, which he uses to meet the needs of his family and to pay his debts.  He hopes that he can produce more rice and vegetables to earn more income.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Pictured is a widowed mother of four children, three of whom are married and live separately, and the other is single and attending school.

She is asking for a loan to buy a buffalo for her own farm and to hire out to her neighbors. S. H. owns a plot of farming land inherited from her parents. She has spent almost her entire lifetime on this farm. Her married children always stand in support of her and of their youngest brother who is now studying in university in Phnom Penh.

She believes that she will have a more comfortable income as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her farm and to hire to her neighbors.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Being a member of ASHI since 2005, Lilibeth M. is requesting for a larger amount of loan to finance her variety store and hog fattening businesses which she started up during the time she has availed loan. ASHI is the first and only MFI she joined in order to have an access to business capital. All throughout her membership, she maintained a very good performances in repayment, attendance during center meeting and business. Lilibeth is 33 years old and has four children aging from two to 12 years old. Her husband is a farm laborer. Family daily expenses are hard to manage without Lilibeth's businesses since her husband's income is sporadic and insufficient. Profits her businesses are making are the main source for financing the education of her four children wherein one is in high school, and two are in elementary.
Lilibeth wants to grow her businesses well through loans she can avail from ASHI in order to increase her profit and to be able to send all of her children to school until college.

loans.use: Will be used to finance a hog fattening (pig raising) business and variety store.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion L. is from the town of Dban in Calamba Misami.Occidental. She is 59 years old. Concepcion is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Concepcion makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Concepcion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Concepcion from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
“Plant today and tomorrow you will reap.” This is the guiding principle of Dario B. of Barangay Almaguer South in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married to Josephine and they are blessed with two children, Dickson and John Rich. Despite the hardships in life, they work hard to support the neeir needs and to send their children to school because they want them to be successful in the future.

Farming is their main source of income. They plant rice and vegetables in their farm twice a year. In addition, Dario works as a jeepney driver for additional income. 

Dario wants to borrow PHP 10,000.00 to use as additional capital for their farm. He will use the loan for his crops and also for the maintenance of their jeepney. He is glad that he can earn a net income of  Php15,000 during harvest season and an additional Php3,000 per month from using his jeepney. They budget his income for daily basic needs and also for the tuition fees and allowances of their children, and for the payment of his loan amortizations. 

After years of sacrificing, their two children have finished their college educations. Their  eldest is now working in Canada and the youngest is still applying for a job.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: To make a more comfortable settlement, a lady who had married to Thol, 38, a man who spread its service as a local construction provider, Samiem in the age of 36 has taken to build her wooden house for her family. She owns a grocery store in front of her house selling food ingredients, and household needs for almost one year. She has two children all of whom are still young and attend school.

loans.use: to build her wooden house for her family.

Adelia H. is from the village of Danao. She is 45 years old. Adelia is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adelia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida A. is from the town of Polanco. She is 48 years old. Adelaida is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida plants, harvests, and sells rice. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Adelaida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Adelaida's 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Ingrid

Ingrid joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ingrid has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Ingrid is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Ingrid from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
“ Have faith and God will provide.”  This word of encouragement comes from Celia A., a resident of Barangay Almaguer South in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old and a single parent of one child. Her parents are helping her to care for her child and also helping financially. 

She and her parents are engaged in farming and hog-raising. They also run a village store. For her small businesses to grow, she would like to borrow PHP 28,000.00. She will use the loan to maintain their crops, to buy additional items for their store, and to buy feed for their hogs. Her father cultivates their farm while Celia manages the store and piggery. She is thankful for this financial support because it will help them a lot to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Danao. She is 54 years old. Nena is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Nena is just starting this business.

In 2009, Nena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: H., 46, is the mother of a high school student and is married to Peoun, also 46, who is a local farmer on a plot of land inherited from his parents. She earns her living by raising pigs to slaughter four times a year. Her living standard has now become more and more comfortable. That's why she wants to increase the number of pigs she raises by taking out a loan of $200 from the Kiva field partner, HKL, to buy more pigs for her stall. She dreams of her only child earning a college degree.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her stall.

loans.name: Yim

The others are single and either still in school or employed as a construction worker or as a garment worker. She is married to Teoum, 47, who is a local fisherman along the Mekong river. The family has earned a good income because several members are working. To help increase her family's income, K. decided to take out a loan of $100 to buy fertilizer for her farmland and her vegetable growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and vegetable growing.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a member of the Zilipendwa borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 11, and 9 years.

Zainabu started her own business selling maize 5 years ago,she works 13 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 80,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Zainabu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Zainabu hopes to save money,pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
“Patience and hard work are some of factors to have a progressive life” says Juanito M., a farmer and a responsible husband to Delia. They live harmoniously with their three children at Brgy. Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Their children are now in tertiary and secondary education.  The couple are striving hard to earn a living to support the education of their children.

Farming and hog raising are their primary sources of income.  He cultivates their farm twice a year and his crops are rice, corn and some vegetables. He needs financial support and would like a loan of PHP 20,000 from the Kiva lenders.  He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of their farm.  During harvest season, they can earn an average net income of P 15,000.  They budget their income for the basic needs of their family, for the education of their children and as payment for this loan.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:

Safina started her own food business selling Banana 1 year ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Safina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more banana for sale.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio, or “ Unyol” as he is called in their village, is a farmer.  He lives in Brgy. Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcya. He is married to Elvie and they are blessed with two children. The couple helps one another to earn a living for their family and for the education of their children. 

Rogelio is a college graduate but due to lack of job opportunities, he decided to venture into farming.  He is planting rice and vegetables that he harvests twice a year.  He would like a loan of PHP 10,000.00 that will serve as additional capital.  He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs and some supplies for the maintenance of their crop production. He hopes that he can produce bigger harvests and earn a higher income with the continuous support of the lenders.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas T. is from the village of Campo I, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 60 years old. Felicitas is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Felicitas owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store. Her main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $135 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Felicitas joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Felicitas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding her business. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. Felicitas plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Halim

texts.ru: Халим Саидов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Халим имеет среднее образование. Он вместе со своей семьей более 15 лет занимаентся животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Теперь он хочет приобрести теленка, доить и продавать молоко односельчанам. Кредит просит для этого.
texts.en:
Halim S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 46 years old, married and has 9 children. Halim has secondary education. Together with his family, he has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. He raises and sells livestock. Now he wants to purchase a calf, milk and sells milk to his village neighbors. Halim is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

Arnel is 38 years old.  He is the loving husband of Elvie and a good father to their two children: Simeon - 9 years old, a grade school student and Arvie - 4 years old, already studying in a pre-school in their village in Cutog Grande Reina Mercedes, Isabela. His wife is patiently sacrificing working abroad for many years as a domestic helper. To help his wife in supporting their family, Arnel engaged in a small business.

To become more productive and successful, Regina wants to borrow PHP12, 000 additional capital from Kiva lenders. 	

Their family is patiently battling against the difficulties of life by helping each other, in their own little ways, to attain their goals and success in life.

L., age of 40, with her life partner Chut, 43, has a child who is now working as a local construction laborer. The three members of the family are each very busy with their jobs.

L. is looking for a loan of $200 to buy more piglets for her stall. “The loan has generated me much income,” L. said.

loans.name: Mailaluna

texts.en:
Mailaluna S. of Brgy. Chambery, Manapla, Negros Occidental is 38, married and has 2 children, ages 5 and 14.

Mailaluna opened a "Sari-sari" or General Store last year with the objective of supplementing the income of her husband, so that she could provide for the education of her young children.

Opening the general store in their community proved to be a wise decision for the Segarios as it now earns an average of PHP 5,000 per month additional income for the family.

Mailaluna is thankful for the credit assistance extended to her by NWTF-Project Dungganon because it gives her the freedom to earn an income independent of her husband's livelihood. Now she wants to borrow PHP 15,000 for her 8th loan cycle, so that she can have a revolving capital which will enable her to periodically restock her store and offer more goods to her customers.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Revolving Capital for her General Store

She dreams to have a bigger income and this motivated her to request a loan of PHP12, 000 that she will use to purchase enough merchandise for her store and to meet the demands of her customers.  She hopes to satisfy her family needs with the income she could get from her business. 

Monica is 42 years old and she is married to Mario, a farmer. They have three children: Maria Crisanta - 20 years old, college graduate; Chona - 18 years old and their youngest is Mario Jr. – 15 years old, both are college students.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda and her family reside in the village of Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Jose and they are blessed with two children. They want their children to become successful someday.  Despite the economic crisis, they work hard to earn a living to be able to support the needs of their children.  

Mrs. B. operates a small piggery, manages a general store and sells commercial rice and feed. She wants to improve her business and is now asking for additional capital to sustain her businesses. She is hoping for a loan of PHP 5,000 that she will use for business maintenance.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline P. of Camarin, Caloocan City. She is 46 years old.  Her husband, Lino, is a 56-year-old carpenter.  They have nine children, two of whom are already helping them augment their family’s daily needs through their own earnings.

Evangeline buys scrap fabrics from neighboring garment factories and tediously weaves each thick strand to fashion them into beautiful foot rugs and place mats. She said she feels like just playing with the fabric. She has been in this industry for 15 years and seems to enjoy doing it.  Evangeline earns 250 Philippine pesos a day from the rugs she makes.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative just last year but is already impressed with how the cooperative takes care of its members. She has just finished repaying her third loan with CCT. On her fourth loan cycle, she has applied for PHP 8,000 to be able to purchase more colorful fabric trimmings from the nearby factories.

Someday, she hopes to see her life literally improve from “rags to riches.”      

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase fabric trimmings from garment factories

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn A., is requesting for a loan to finance her variety store which she started through a loan she received from ASHI when she became a member four years ago. She wants her variety store to sell more items and commodities that are basically needed by people in their daily lives. Through the loan she requests from ASHI, she will be able to attain her plan of growing her business and satisfy her costumers with the convenience her store can offer. 
Looking back at the years when Rovelyn didn't have no one for financial and emotional support after her husband. Her eldest child then was only four years old and the youngest was eight month old. She can't afford to put up a business of her own because she has no business capital. She sells vegetables at times and had been doing other kinds of livelihood sporadically. Now, her two children are ages 28 and 33. She wasn't able to send them to school however they tried their best to find a way to earn money in order to help their mother. Her eldest daughter is working in Manila as a while domestic helper while the youngest was left in Antique and lives with her.
Through loans she can avail from ASHI, Rovelyn would really be doing a hardwok to grow her business for her children to take over someday.

loans.use: Will be used to finance a variety store.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre has worked as a tricycle taxi operator for almost fifteen years. His weekly income from his tricycle averages 1600 PHP, and this income is utilized to provide for his family's immediate needs at home. He is 54 years old and married to Catalina, who is a full-time housewife. They have three children who are all married. His family is living peacefully in their simple village of Cutog Grande in Reina Mercedes, Isabela.

Farming is the major source of income for most of the residents. Aside from his tricycle, Silvestre also manages a farm. He wants to maintain his tricycle business, and, as a result, he would like to receive a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be of great help in the maintenance of his motor vehicle. texts.en: A. Karomat is married and has two adult children. She sells groceries like biscuits (cookies), sugar, juices, soft drinks and other items and has been engaged in this business together with her son (pictured) since her early years. Her husband is a pensioner. Karomat uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Currently Karomat needs a loan of 5,000 Somoni. She will use the loan as additional capital to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Karomat plans to save toward extending her house to meet the needs of her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
H. Shavkat is married and has two children. He runs a small business selling coal in the market. His place is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Shavkat has been in business for over 10 years. Shavkat is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business. Shavkat is requesting a loan for 5000 Somoni ($1150 USD) to increase the assortment of his inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Shavkat's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing coal for selling.

loans.name: Muhamadali

texts.ru: Мухамадали Махмудов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Мухамадали имеет высшее образование. Он более 26 лет работает  на своем тракторе, пашет земли односелчан. В данный момент его трактор сломался и он просит кредит для его ремонта, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги, т.к. трактор является единственным источником  дохода.
texts.en:
Muhamadali M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 51 years old and has four children. Muhamadali has high education. He has worked on his tractor for more than nine years, he plows the land of his fellow villagers. At this time his tractor is broken and he is asking for a loan to repair it to resume his quality services as this tractor is the only source of income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the tractor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jasurbek

texts.en: T. Jasurbek is 21 years old. For more than two years he has been engaged in the business of selling coal. Jasurbek buys coal from Kyrgyzstan and resells it to his customers in the market. As a result of his experience in the field, his numerous clients have a lot of trust and confidence in him and the quality of his product. Jasurbek enjoys his business very much. However, he does not have adequate funds to support his business, especially with recent price hikes; therefore, he needs the loan to remain in business and to expand it. With this loan, he wants to purchase a new stock of coal to better serve his customers. He believes the loan will enable him to save more and in the nearest future to have his own family. loans.name: Theresa May

texts.en: Theresa May A. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Theresa May owns and operates a business making and selling food, vending snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Theresa May joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa L. is from the village of Catarman. She is 57 years old. Josefa is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Josefa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Z. Shahnoza is 29-years old and married with one young child. For more than five years, Shahnoza has been running her own business. She has a small saloon where she sells and rents both traditional and national wedding dresses. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large so consequently there are lots of marriages and Shahnoza has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family income. This is her third loan with Kiva partner IMON International. During the previous loan cycle she was accurate and precise in the loan payments. Shahnoza is requesting 5,000 Somoni ($1150 USD) to purchase newer styles of wedding dresses.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
A. Azamat is dedicated to the production of onion, potato and carrot. With a lot of effort and sacrifice he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the conditions of his family, bringing the daily bread to his table and, at the same time, saving for the improvement of his dwelling, which needs a lot of help because it is in bad state which little by little he has come to improve. Azamat is married with 5 children. His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and that in addition he has managed to keep his children in school. The need that this gentleman faces is that he needs to invest in his business through the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. By this Azamat hopes that Kiva will offer him the loan to do well along with his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion S. of Sitio Cagay 4, Brgy. Buenavista, Escalante City, Negros Occidental is 69 years old, married with 7 adult children whose ages range from 31 to 44 years old.

Concepcion and her family earn their living through sugarcane farming and growing and selling vegetables, which nets an average income of PHP 12,000 per month. Negros Island is known as the sugarbowl of the Philippines; in past years, when sugar prices were relatively high, most of the farmers just concentrated on this monocrop industry. But now that costs of farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.) have gone up and the price of sugar has plummeted, many farmers are diversifying to crops that have a faster turnover. This is why Concepcion and her family grow vegetables: namely, so that they will have a regular cash flow which can better support their daily needs.

For her 14th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Concepcion is borrowing PHP 19,500 to purchase fertilizer to sustain the viability of her small farm.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. These women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

texts.en:
Jimmy B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 24 years old. Jimmy is married and has one infant. To make a living, Jimmy owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing taxi services to local community members. Jimmy is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa A. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Adelfa is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Adelfa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Adelfa has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Adelfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelfa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adelfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Alymbubu's Group

texts.en: Here is the leader of the group – Alymbubu, a forty-nine year old mother of three children. About fifteen years ago Alymbubu used to work in a gold-mining complex. She received an industrial injury and two of her fingers were cut off. She no longer was able to continue her work at the complex and had to quit. As a matter of fact, by profession she was a seamstress. So, one day when she was sitting at home, an acquaintance of hers asked her to tailor a trousseau for her daughter and paid her quite a decent sum. Alymbubu thought it over and decided to start sewing as a business. Now, Alymbubu provides all sewing services: traditional bedding, blankets and pillows. She has constant orders from local villagers and sometimes distributes her products to sales outlets. She makes $140 a month, though she had only $24 to start with. Besides, that her old profession and new occupation has given her an opportunity to give her children an education, to buy convenience goods for her home and, most importantly, it has given her an assurance for tomorrow and belief in herself. Alymbubu needs a loan to purchase fabric and thread for the upcoming wedding season. Alymbubu’s partners are: Ryskul, Jyldyz and Ainash. Ryskul, 34, is the mother of six children. She grows clover, sells barley and milk, and soon will be collecting crops from sugar beet. She needs a loan to pay for labor, transportation and the pressing of clover. She also needs to buy clothes for her kids for the new academic year. Jyldyz, 35, is married and has two children. She provides tailoring services to local people and other customers. She used to be a teacher but the salary was very low and she decided to start sewing. Now, she needs a loan to purchase fabric for sewing pillows. Ainash, 51, has raised five children. Currently, she looks after a piece of land and is engaged in the raising and sale of sheep. She needs a loan to buy five sheep to raise. Her dream is to increase her sheep population, sell them and use the proceeds to marry her daughters. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread for the upcoming wedding season

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is into pig farming and has been in this business since 2001. She is 35 years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Evelyn is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more piglets to raise and sell. With this she will be able to meet the demands of her customer. She thanks all her Kiva lenders for their support.

She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more piglets to rear and to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Salohidin

texts.en:
B. Salohidin lives in the town of Panj with his wife and 5 children. He has worked in agriculture for 11 years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. Salohidin’s wife is a vendor and helps support the family. Salohidin would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Safar

texts.en:
K. Safar is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and their 4 children. His children are currently in school and help out with the farm work, too. He plans to improve the living conditions of his family. Safar has been a farmer for 4 years and his hardest time is during the winter when the crops don’t grow well. He began the farm work with his parents, and now needs loans to improve production. This is the third time that he is using a loan to improve his crop yield and sales. Safar will use this loan to buy fertilizers and materials so that he will have a successful crop and he will then sell his production for the best price at the market.

loans.name: Mirzohamid

texts.en:
Mirzohamid is 50 years old. He is married with five children. Mirzohamid says he comes from a humble family, and, from a very young age, he helped his father in the fields, which is why he never finished his studies. Despite that, he feels fortunate to be with his wife, who helps him with their farming business. Mirzohamid cultivates citruses, potatoes and onions. He comments that he is very thankful for what he has, and, thanks to the dedication and support from his family, he can have a dignified life and give a better life to his children. At this time, Mirzohamid is applying for a loan in order to buy more seeds and fertilizer that will help him cultivate more crops.

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en:
Yuldosh previously was a security guard. Now, he is a farmer. He grows onions to feed his family and to provide all his children with an education. Yuldosh has been tilling the farm for five years. His business has helped him buy the things they need like electricity, food and water, and to pay school fees. Yuldosh is asking for a loan of $1,000. He will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. The loan will really help him increase his yield.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia sells wines. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for the past 20 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more wines to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more wines to sell

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima A., 58, lives with her 4 grown-up children in a small village in Silang, Cavite.

She manages a food canteen. She has been in this business for 4 years now and seems to enjoy serving people with sumptuous foods that she herself cooks. She earns P15,000 to P18,000 a month depending on the influx of people eating at her place.

She uses her profits for the continuous operation of her canteen. Most of her family’s basic daily needs are covered from the proceeds of her business.

Maxima needs a loan of P28,000 for the expansion of her business. She has been dreaming of establishing a branch in other parts of the province.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima O. sells sarongs and phone rechargeable cards. She has been in the business for the past 4 years.  She is 50 year old and married with 6 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more sarongs and phone rechargeable card to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more phone rechargeable cards to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is thirty-three years old. She is married and has twins, a boy and a girl who are currently in school. She is a seamstress by profession. Agnes designs and sews for clients and also for sale. She has a workshop by the roadside in her community. She says she has three apprentices in training.

Agnes has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy textiles and other sewing accessories. She desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy textiles and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-two years old. She is divorced and has six children, who are all currently in school. Mary sells vegetables. She sells vegetables such as onions, garden eggs (small eggplants), peppers, tomatoes, etc. on a table top at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities in and around her community. She treks to other markets to sell as well.

Mary has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, who are currently in school. Hannah is a hairdresser. She has four apprentices who are currently in training. Hannah buys her working materials such as artificial hair, shampoo, lotion, etc. from Accra. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy two more dryers, hair creams and weavons (hair extensions) in bulk to be able to render quality services to her cherished clients.

Hannah aspires to expand her business and pay for her children's schooling up through higher education.

loans.use: To buy material for her salon in bulk

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is twenty six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are currently in pre-school and primary school respectively. Charlotte trades in cosmetics. She sells cosmetics such as powder, cream, perfume, etc, on a table top at the lorry station. She buys her stock at the city's central market. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Charlotte aspires to expand her business and provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en: Sargis S. was born in 1971 in the town of Ijevan. After finishing secondary school, he served in the Soviet Army. Sargis graduated from the Ijevan State College with a degree in road-building and worked in his specialty. His wife teaches Russian at the Ijevan Russian Academy. They have two boys who are still at school. Two years ago, Sargis rented a little shop in the central street in Ijevan and began his computer trade business. He needs $2,000 to buy monitors, UPSs, and speakers for his trade.

loans.use: To buy monitors, UPSs, and speakers for his trade.

loans.name: Koegan

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a entamé en 1999 le commerce de boissons alcoolisées appelées « Sodabi », dans son quartier il est le seul à exercer ce commerce ce qui lui permet  de réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices, étant marié et père de 04 enfants, c’est avec cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille. Il veut associer à son commerce la vente de produits de brasserie. Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 bidons de sodabi, 20 casiers de produits de la brasserie.
texts.en:
In 1999, this gentleman began a business selling an alcoholic drink called "sodabi" in his district.  He is the only one in this business.  This allows him to make a large profit.  Being married and father of four children, this business is how he provides for his family.  He wants to include with his business the sale of pub drinks.  He's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 drums of sodabi and 20 cases of pub products. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Dehinatou

texts.fr: Cette femme est une femme très dynamique qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de pagnes, assiettes et autres ustensiles. Elle est mariée, avec ce qu’elle gagne de ce commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de son foyer. Afin de toucher un plus grand nombre de personnes, elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle grandit pour pouvoir bien les satisfaire elle doit rehausser son stock c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit de acheter 15 couteaux de cuisine, 20 pagnes de qualité « Hi-target », 15 glacières et divers ustensiles pour pouvoir satisfaire ses clients.

loans.use: achat  de couteaux, assiettes, pagnes et divers

loans.name: Tongni

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un technicien, faute de moyens pour ouvrir son atelier, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de détail de pièces de machine d'imprimerie, il fait son commerce de façon ambulante. Il demande à WAGES un crédit pour augmenter son stock de pièces détachées.  Il est marié et père d’un enfant, c’est avec cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a technician.  Lacking the means to open his own workshop, he got started in retail commerce selling printing machine parts.  He operates his business door-to-door.  He's asking WAGES for a loan to increase his stock of parts.  He is married and the father of one child.  With this business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy printng machine parts

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce depuis 2008 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, une partie de son stock a baissé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 4 bidons de 25 litres d’huile, 3 cartons de spaghetti, 3 sacs de riz et divers produits d’alimentation générale.

loans.use: achat de produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune célibataire qui pour subvenir à ses propres charges à entamé le commerce de sacs de « SOJA », il a 2 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, il s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Sokodé. Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 19 sacs de « SOJA » et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a young bachelor who began selling sacks of soybeans to support himself. He has two years of experience in this business. He gets his merchandise in the countryside in the town of Sokodé. He is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 19 sacks of soybeans and cover the cost of transporting them.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of soybeans

loans.name: Wolimata

texts.fr: Wolimata C. est âgée de 46 ans. Elle fait du commerce de fruits de saison. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Wolimata C. is 46 years old. She does commerce in seasonal fruit. She’s requesting this loan to bolster her business and to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell seasonal fruit

loans.name: Edjidodo Group

texts.fr: Cette association a vu le jour en 1999, elle est composée de 4 dames très dynamiques qui sont toutes mariées et mère de famille. Elles exercent toutes dans le commerce de produits alimentaires. Cette association a beaucoup d’expérience dans les œuvres sociales. Les membres de cette association veulent augmenter leur stock de marchandises pour gagner plus d’argent et réaliser des activités d’entraide raison pour laquelle l’association sollicite un crédit pour acheter divers produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
This association dates back to 1999. It is composed of 4 very dynamic women who are all married and the mothers of families. They all sell foodstuffs. This association has a lot of experience in helping others. The members of this association want to grow their stocks of merchandise so that they can earn more money and be able to continue to help others, the reasons why the association is requesting a loan to buy various foodstuffs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: La dame Ndèye S. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle tient une boutique et aimerait renforcer sa marchandise. Son objectif est de contribuer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye S. is a lady who is 39 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. She has a shop and would like to bolster her merchandise. Her goal is to help with supporting the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To operate a boutique

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: La dame Aby D. est âgée de 61 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle tient un étal ou elle vend des fruits de saison. Les revenus générés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aby D. is a lady who is 61 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She has a stall where she sells seasonal fruit. The revenues generated enable her to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit in season

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama F. est une femme de 59 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle vend de fruits de saison. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux charges familiales.

loans.use: Vente de fruits de saison

loans.name: Ekoué

texts.fr: Cet homme n’est pas marié. Il a appris le métier de couture mais il n’a pas trouvé d’argent pour ouvrir sa boutique  et exercer son métier. C’est pour cela qu’il a décidé en 2007 de se lancer dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale et d’autres produits. Il a ouvert sa boutique de vente dans la quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il sollicite alors un prêt de WAGES pour acheter des boîtes le lait, de tomates, de sardines, des savons pour peau et en poudre pour cuisines, et bien d’autres produits.
texts.en:
This man is not married. He learned to be a tailor but did not manage to find enough money to open a shop where he could work at his trade. For that reason he decided in 2007 to go into selling foodstuffs and such. He opened his shop in the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé. He is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy tins of milk, tomatoes, and sardines, handsoaps and powdered soap for the kitchen, and many other products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs and various products for resale

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is single and independent. She is thirty - nine years. She trades in men’s foot wears. She sells her stock through 'hawking'(door-to-door selling) around her community and also treks to nearby markets to sell on market days. She has been in business for more than ten years and wants a loan to buy more quality and attractive shoes to serve her customers. Faustina believes she would be able to improve her income. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy shoes in bulk

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de couture. Depuis un certain temps, elle ne trouve plus tellement de clientèle. Pour cette raison, elle s’est lancée en 2006 dans la vente de pagnes de qualité qui lui permet d’apporter financièrement son aide à son mari. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Super Wax et 10 pagnes Hitarget. Elle est mère de 02 enfants.

loans.use: achat de pagnes

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est âgée de 55 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a une boutique où elle vend diverses marchandises. Elle souhaite renforcer son commerce et avec les revenus améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou N. is 55 years old and the mother of six children. She has a shop where she sells various goods. She wishes to bolster her commerce and, with the revenues, to improve her family’s health, schooling, and living situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To operate a shop

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a daughter and two sons. The eldest child is currently in senior high while the other two are in junior high and primary school respectively. She sells foodstuffs such as plantains, cassava, yams, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community to canteen operators. She also supplies her goods to other retailers.

Esi also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Esi aspires to expand her business and pay for her children in school through university.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique N. est une femme de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de tissu, chaussure et parfum. avec cette activité, elle parvient à prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Monique N. is a 54-year-old woman, married, and the mother of four children. She runs a small business selling cloth, shoes, and perfume. With this business, she manages to support her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth, shoes, and perfumes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, who are currently in school. Victoria sells utensils, men’s footwear and ladies' blouses. She buys her goods from the city center at affordable prices and sells them at the market square in her community. She treks to other markets to sell as well.

Victoria has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and pay for her children to attend school up to higher levels

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Waliyou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et père de 03 enfants. Il exerce comme métier la couture ; il s’est spécialisé dans la broderie. Il a beaucoup de clients étrangers qui prennent ses commandes pour la France, l’Italie et les Etats-Unis. Pour élargir son marché, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre, acquérir de nouveaux tissus pour confectionner, des fils à coudre et des fils à broder. Il est fier de son activité
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and the father of 3 children. He works as a tailor and is specialized in embroidery. He has lots of foreign customers who take his creations to France, Italy, and the United States. To expand his market, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a new sewing machine, new fabrics, sewing thread and embroidery thread. He is proud of his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing machines and various other materials necessary for his trade

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is 34 years old and married. She sells phone rechangable card and accessories. She has been in the business since 2004. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more phone rechangable card and  accessories to sell. She say thank you to all KIVA lenders

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Médéouye

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée depuis 2004 dans le quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé dans le commerce de charbons de bois. Ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge et de couvrir aussi les frais scolaires de son enfant. Actuellement son stock est presque épuisé ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 40 sacs de charbons de bois ; ce prêt lui permettra aussi de couvrir les frais de transport à l’intérieur du pays.
texts.en:
This lady has been specialized in selling charcoal in the Hédzranawoé neighborhood in Lomé since 2004. This business allows her to support herself and also cover school fees for her child. Presently her stock is almost expended. This is the reason why she is hoping to have a loan from WAGES to buy 40 sacks of charcoal.
