This loan will permit her to cover the expense of transport from the countryside as well.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean C. is one of the youngest members of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  She is 26 years old.  Her husband, Danilo, is a 27-year-old street vendor. They have two children.

Mary Jean has been selling rice cakes and other native delicacies for the past six years. She earns a net income of at least 7,000 Philippine pesos a month. She makes these delicacies at home.

She joined the cooperative in 2007 upon the invitation of older housewives in her village. Now on her eighth loan cycle with CCT, she applied for a fresh loan in the amount of P8,000, which she will use to buy raw materials for making rice cakes (glutinous rice, flavorings, etc.)

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Raw materials for rice-cake making

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima is 39 years old and married with 6 children. she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuff and has been in the business for the past 2 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuff to sell, with this she can meet the demand of her customer. She say thank you to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She sells provisions and has been in the business for the past 4 years.  She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.  She say thank you to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more provision to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 26 years old. She is married with a child who is currently in school. Lucy trades in textiles. She sells her textiles through hawking, which means she balances the stock on her head and moves around her community to sell. She also travels to other communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk to meet her customers' demand. She aspires to expand her business and improve on her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She sells medicine. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Martha has been in this business since 2000.  She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell.  She say thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 46 years old and married with six children. She bakes and sells cakes. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Queen has been in this business since 1984. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more baking materials to bake and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking material to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida G., 43, almost lost all hope when one of her four kids met an accident that almost took his life. But faith and hard work pulls her through life’s trials. Her family lives in San Lazaro, Tala, Caloocan City. Her husband Rico works as a driver for a well-off family. Aida is into the hand-weaving of foot-rugs out of scrap fabric. She also makes home-made peanut butter and sells it to her neighbors. She earns a monthly net income of PHP 10,000 from these home-based businesses which she has been enjoying doing for the last ten years. Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in May 2005, Aida has been enjoying the many benefits for its members who are mostly housewives. Aida is now on her 9th loan with CCT. She is expecting to receive a fresh loan from the cooperative in the amount of PHP 14,000 which she will use to purchase scrap fabric from nearby garment factories as the chief material for her trendy foot-rugs. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her rug-making

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam bakes and sells baking material. She is 28 years old and married with a child. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 2 years.  She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more baking material to bake and sell.  She say thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking material to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 45-year-old trader. She is married with six children who are currently in school.

Margaret sells used clothes but, with low capital, she is not able to buy larger bale quantities of used clothes to sell. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes with more variety to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Benice

texts.en:
Bernice is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are currently in school.

Bernice is a petty trader and trades in plantain, charcoal, palm oil, cassava, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and retails to her customers who are mainly food vendors. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy stock in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and has been in the business for the past 4 years.  She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. This will help her meet the customer need. She say thank you to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more provision to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is thirty-two years old. She is divorced and has one child. She sells porridge and groundnuts (peanuts) in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods, popularly enjoyed as breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread.

With a large customer base, Linda wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise a good income to support her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette T. is a 44-year-old businesswoman from Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. She lives with her husband, Damaso and their four school-aged children. Bernadette owns a general store located in their house. She is also into buying and selling cosmetics. She also makes homemade sausages and processed meat products which she sells to her neighbors. She earns at least PHP 15,000 a month from these combined business activities which she has been enjoying doing for the last ten years. Bernadette has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2007. Now on her 8th loan, she applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase more cosmetic products for her clients. She will also use portions of the loan for the education of her children. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is fifty - one years old. She is a married mother of five children. Two of her children are currently in school and the rest have completed school and are working. She is a hard working woman. She works to support her husband maintain the home. Grace runs a grocery store and sells shoes along side her grocery business. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store by the street. She has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy more provision to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante C., 43, is a horticulturist based in Silang, Cavite. He is married to Dorotea, 43, a housewife. They have four children: the eldest already makes a living, the second is still in college and the two youngest aren’t attending school yet. Dante has been taking care of ornamental and decorative plants, and making a living doing so, for a decade now. He has a small nursery along the National Highway of their town which also serves as the “showroom” for all his plants and flowers. He is also a transport operator. His jeepneys (small buses) ply different routes in the province. Combined, he earns more than P25,000 per month. Dante was half-hearted when he joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. He thought CCT was just for women entrepreneurs, but has been proven wrong and now even loves to invite other entrepreneurs to join the cooperative. He wants to share with his friends the many blessings he has received since joining CCT. Dante needs a loan of P19,000 to improve his nursery. He wants to buy big and beautiful plant pots and many more plant seedlings. Dante also dreams of having a branch in other areas. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy plant seedlings and plant pots

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 29 years old and is married with two children. Currently both children are in school.

Lydia owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand her business.

Lydia hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide the children with a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a supply of rice and other provisions in bulk

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 37 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions and has been in the business for the past eight years.

Joyce hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ikponwonosa

texts.en:
Ikponwonosa is 44 years old and married with three children. She sells used clothes and has been in the business since 2000.

Ikponwonosa hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She sells drinks and has been in the business for a long time.  She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business since 2002. She hopes for the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. With this she can meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She sells fairly-used clothes and has been in the business since 1998.  She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more fairly-used clothes to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He sells yams and has been in the business since 2001.  He hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more yams to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: El nombre de la Señora Janett del Socorro Ramírez García tiene la edad de 44 es madre soltera. Doña Janett tiene 5 hijos de los cuales todos trabajan de manera. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y con una canasta de productos en los que vendía productos como: ropa interior, y camisas al paso del tiempo es que logra obtener su propio establecimiento y fue aumentando su mercadería y es así  como logra tener más confianza en este negocio además se amplió instalando otro establecimiento de su pertinencia para tener más confianza en su negocio. El financiamiento es  para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de mas productos por lo que tiene que viajar  en Managua por lo que le resulta más favorable la compra al por mayor.
texts.en:
Janett del Socorro Ramírez García, 44, is a single mother. She has five children who work. She sells general merchandise. She started the business on her own. She used a basket of products from which she sold underwear and shirts. As time passed, she was able to get her own establishment. She was able to increase the amount of her merchandise. This gave her more confidence in her business. She opened another establishment, giving her even more confidence in her business. The money is for working capital to buy more products. She will travel to Managua because it is better to buy wholesale there.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells yams and has been in the business since 1999.  She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: Sabine D. est une veuve  de 48 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle tient une boutique et souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer ses marchandises. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.

loans.use: Exploitation d'une boutique vendant divers produits

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes D. R. started her small colmado (a corner grocery store) many years ago by selling basic staples like flour and rice from her home. Over the years she has grown her business and has opened up a separate location right outside her home. 

Her home and her grocery store are made out of wooden planks. When Hurricane Georges hit in 1998 her house and business were destroyed. Hurricanes and tropical storms are very common here and there is always the threat that everything can be lost in an instant. Mercedes would like to reconstruct her house and business out of cement blocks so that they can weather the storms safely when they come.

loans.use: cement blocks

loans.name: Antofagasta Group

texts.es: En la zona Villa Tejada, se encuentra el centro focal que lleva el mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Antofagasta”, actualmente esta formado por once mujeres que trabajan junto a Pro Mujer hace seis años, demostrando ser un grupo alegre y unido. La mayoría de ellas están casadas y tienen niños pequeños, afirman que necesitan generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias. Algunas de las socias venden abarrotes, comida, tienen tiendas de barrio, otras de ellas son artesanas, producen chompas tejidas en alpaca, creación de cotillones. Ellas precisan capital para la compra de materia prima o mercadería, ya que desean incrementar sus ventas de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA O MERCADERIA

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: La señora Claudia Carolina C. tiene la edad de 32 años habita en el barrio Dennis Larios ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual  trabaja como comerciante, en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras al por mayor en el mercado de Masaya, ellos tienen dos hijos una niña de cinco años, la pequeña estudia y un varón de tres años que es enfermo de la vista, doña Claudia desde hace 11 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder lograr una buena producción y vender a buen precio al mercado.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para aplicar ala siembra y lograr una buena cosecha

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan S. has been a successful micro-entrepreneur, selling fruit in his small community of Casa Colorá. He lives with his wife and young child in a run-down house made of wooden planks. The house is falling apart and it is unsafe and uncomfortable. Juan is in the process of building a new house for his family out of cement blocks.

Hurricanes and tropical storms are very common in the Dominican Republic and houses made of wood are swept away every time. With a house made out of cement, Juan and his family can weather the storm safely. Funding this loan will allow Juan and his family to be safe and secure in their home. *Juan was not available for the photo,so his wife Alexandra is pictured above.

loans.use: Cement Blocks

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: El señor Juan Santiago Velásquez, tiene la edad de 57 años, habita en el barrio Pablo Calero, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos, todos independientes, los planes hacia a su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida; don Juan desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, los planes futuros es poder sembrar mas siembras. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder vender a mejor precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Santiago Velásquez , 57 years old, lives in Pablo Calero barrio, together with his wife, who works as a merchant in order to help him with the household expenses. They have three children, all living independently. His plans for his family are to improve their standard of living.

For 30 years Don Juan has dedicated himself to agriculture. The major difficulty that is presented to him is the lack of financing. His plan for the futures is to be able to plant more seed. With the loan he is going to buy fertilizers and raw materials to apply to the crop so that he is able to sell at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and raw materials to apply to crops and improve production

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es: “Manejo una cooperativa (tiendita)dentro de una universidad, en esta época han bajado las ventas y me gustaría invertir en mercancía para poder tener mas ganancias, tengo aproximadamente 5 años con este negocio tanto los estudiantes de la escuela como los maestros me conocen y saben que soy una persona trabajadora y que vivo del ingreso que mi negocio me da”
texts.en:
“I manage a cooperative (general store) inside a university. Since sales have been low lately, I would like to invest in merchandise for my store to increase my earnings. I’ve had this business for five years. The university students and teachers know me well. They know that I am a hard-working person and that I live from the income generated by my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jude

texts.en: Jude is 38 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells foodstuffs such as "gari" (cassava grits) etc. and has been in the business since 1991.  He hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Aurelia Francisca

texts.es: Aurelia Francisca García tiene la actividad económica de venta de mercadería en general. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo por lo que este es su principal fuente de ingresos para ayudar en los gastos de su familia. Este negocio surgió por la necesidad de trabajar, Por los gastos que tiene como madre para sus hijos. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que este es el único método que le da resultados pues tiene que levantarse todos los días muy temprano para preparar las cosas que ofrecerá a sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para comprar cremas, colonias, ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Su mayor sueño es obtener un lugar en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Aurelia Francisca García sells general merchandise. She has two children, and this is her primary source of income to help with the family expenses. This business emerged from the need to work for the expenses she has as the mother of her children. She sells on the street; that is the only method that gets results. Every day she needs to get up very early to prepare the things she offers her customers. She is asking for this loan to buy creams, colognes, clothes, footwear, and cosmetics. Her greatest dream to get a place where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Diombo

texts.fr: Diombo D. est une femme de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de chaussures, tissus teintés « Thioup » et de draps de lit. Les revenus générés par son activité lui permettront de contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Diombo D. is a woman of 57, married and the mother of 3 children. She sells shoes, hand-dyed cloth known as «Thioup», and bedsheets. The income generated by her business allows her to contribute to the daily expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling shoes, cloth, and bedsheets

loans.name: Francisco Anselmo

texts.es: El señor Francisco Anselmo M. , tiene la edad de 62 años , habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos ya independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Francisco desde hace 40 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ya que el cultivo carece de fertilizantes e insumos , los planes futuros hacia el cultivo es diversificarlo .Con el préstamo va a comprar abono para obtener una mejor producción. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los prestamos ya que ha salido adelante con las siembras y ha podido suplirse de las necesidades diarias, este es su séptimo crédito y espera seguir en trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Francisco Anselmo M. is 62 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of San Juan de la Concepción with his wife, who works and helps him with the household expenses. They have two children, both of whom support themselves. His family’s goal is to improve their standard of living. Francisco has made a living from farming for 40 years. The biggest difficulty he is facing is a lack of funds, since he needs fertilizer and supplies for his crop. His plan for the future is to diversify his crop. Francisco is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizer so he can improve his yield. He thanks the lending institution for the assistance it has given him through their loans, since he has been able to get ahead with his crops and supply his daily needs. This is Francisco’s seventh loan and he hopes to continue working with the lending institution.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies and fertilizer to improve his crop

loans.name: Agbemefa Emile

texts.fr: Ce monsieur s’est spécialisé dans la vente en détails des produits chimiques et des savons liquides, des champoings, d’eau de javel, de pommades médicales pour cheveux. Il a ouvert sa boutique de vente dans le quartier Attiégou à Lomé. Sa boutique est très fréquentée par beaucoup de clients. Il sollicite, pour faire de nouvelles commandes, un crédit de WAGES pour acheter  05 bidons d’acide pour ses préparations, du soda, des boîtes d’eau de javel et bien d’autres produits indispensables. Il est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge.

loans.use: Achat de produits chimiques, de savons liquides, d'eau de javel et autres

loans.name: Tawop Arsobeh Group

texts.en:
This is Ramatu K., Wotho F., Mohamed I. K., Mohamed K. and Musu K.. They called their group Tawop Arsobeh. They are petty-traders and farmers in Masorie village, about thirteen miles from Makeni City. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, generate more income to look after themselves and children. 

Ramatu K. is the leader of this group. Ramatu was born in Masorie village. She is thirty-five years of age, married with three children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School II, the other is in class V and the other in class II. Ramatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and vegetables. She buys these items from villages surrounding Masorie village and sells in Makeni City. Ramatu has been a businesswoman for over ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.fr: Cette dame est une vendeuse ambulante de tissus de haute et moyenne qualité. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2004 et ce commerce lui permet d’aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 03 enfants. Actuellement son stock est presque épuisé et il ne lui reste que 05 pagnes ; pour cette raison, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 pagnes de qualité Super Wax, 10 pagnes Hitarget et 10 pagnes Soso.
texts.en:
This is a lady who goes door-to-door selling cloth of both high and medium quality.  She started this business in 2004, and it allows her to help her husband provide for their three children.  Her inventory is almost exhausted right now.  What's left are only 5 pagnes (lengths of colorful West African cloth).  For this reason, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 10 pagnes of Super Wax quality, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 10 Soso pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality fabrics

loans.name: Assa

texts.fr: Assa D. est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle tient une boutique où elle vend divers produits. Cette activité qu’elle mène lui permet de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.

loans.use: Vente divers produits dans une boutique

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: El Señor José Ernesto Núñez Juárez tiene 33 años de edad. La actividad económica de José  es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de tres años que se dedica a este negocio, expresa que la misma necesidad lo ha impulsado a buscar una nueva fuente de ingresos además el quiere proporcionarle a su hijo la oportunidad  de estudia y salir adelante. Los propósitos de José son de mantener su actividad económica ya que es el único medio que posee para seguir manteniendo a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que se comprara ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y cosméticos, con esto podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions and has been in the business for the past 2 years.  She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Koffi Medodji

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un enseignant. Il est marié et est père d’un enfant. Depuis 2007, il a décidé de vendre des produits pharmaceutiques communément appelés "génériques" pour avoir des ressources financières supplémentaires lui permettant d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Pour agrandir son stock et renforcer celui existant, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des boîtes de comprimés, de sirop, des injections, de l’ampicilline et bien d’autres produits. Cette activité lui apparaît de plus en plus rentable
texts.en:
This gentleman is a teacher.  He is married and the father of one child.  In 2007, he decided to sell pharmaceutical products commonly called "generics" in order to have additional financial resources allowing him to improve his family's living conditions.  To expand his inventory and to bolster what he has, he's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy boxes of tablets, syrups, some injections, some ampicilline (an antibiotic), and many other products.  This seems to be more and more a profitable business for him.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products (generics)

loans.name: Juan Rodolfo

texts.es:
“Tengo una niña pequeña y cuando me voy a trabajar me gustaría dejarla a ella y a mi esposa mas seguras dentro de la casa, es por eso que necesito poner protecciones en las ventanas y también tengo planeado poner un portón grande para que mi hija pueda jugar sin correr peligro”. 
Cabe mencionar que en la foto solo aparece la esposa y la niña del solicitante ya que el Sr. Juan Rodolfo sale al amanecer hacia su trabajo y regresa muy tarde a su casa es por eso que no pudimos coordinarnos con el para que apareciera en la foto.
texts.en:
“I have a young daughter and I would like to leave her and my wife in a safe home when I go to work. That’s why I need to add protection to the windows and install a big gate so that my daughter can play without danger.”

The picture above is only of Mr. Juan Rodolfo’s wife and daughter. We couldn’t coordinate a time so he could be in the picture since Mr. Juan Rodolfo leaves to work very early and gets home very late.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make house safe

loans.name: Kory Canastita Group

texts.es: La asociación “Kori Canastita” (Kori Canastita = Cesto de Oro) al centro focal Villa Adela, esta formado por quince miembros, los cuales trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace un año. La mayoría de las socias se dedica al comercio de productos variados, estos de acuerdo a la temporada y festividades, por ejemplo ahora algunas se dedican a la venta de ropa de invierno, otras de ellas venderán comida, refrescos y dulces en la festividad de su zona. Todas afirman que necesitan aumentar capital a sus negocios, necesitan  comprar productos, para  obtendrán mayores ganancias.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Be Honest Group

texts.en:
Here are John P. K., Kadie B., Kadija K., Fatmata K., and Abdulai S.. They call their group Be Honest Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs and farmers in Masorie village, about thirteen miles from Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each for the very first time in order develop their businesses and/or farms. In this way, they will be able to generate sufficient income to look after themselves, their families, and school-going children.

John P. K. is the leader of this group. He is twenty-one years of age. He was born in a village called Benkin but now lives in Masorie village. John is married to a farmer and they have two children who are not yet of school-going age. John sells rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this loan, he will be able to get five bags of rice and six barters of palm oil (five gallons make a barter). John has been a businessman and a farmer for more than five years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is single and has three children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Comfort sells rice, tin tomatoes, green peppers and other food supplies at Cape Coast, which she has done for 15 years.  Comfort uses her income to pay for caretaking of her children. 

Comfort will use the loan to increase her capital to purchase more food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to increase her capital to boost her business.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing more food supplies

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
El señor Salvador S. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
El está solicitando un crédito escolar, para poder pagar la inscripción de la escuela y la compra de los uniformes y útiles, ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar está necesidad que se le presento para el estudio de sus hijos.
Don Salvador se dedica a la construcción y reparación de viviendas y su esposa la señora María Guadalupe Salazar trabaja de limpieza en una casa particular.
Estos son los ingresos que generan para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Salvador S. has had two loans with FVP, which he has paid back punctually. He is asking for a school loan to be able to pay for school registration, school uniforms, and school supplies. He does not have the necessary money to pay this necessity for his children’s education. Salvador works in home construction and repair. His wife, María Guadalupe Salazar, works as a house cleaner in a private home. These are the incomes generated by his family. He will use part to pay for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for registration, uniforms, and school supplies

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Florencia, es natural de huaypata en la convención, ella vive actualmente en Urubamba en la calle comercio s/n, en pleno corazón del valle sagrado.

Nuestra socia tiene 47 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la panadería, nuestra socia tiene 25 años con este comercio minorista, ella es experta en la elaboración de panes, tortas, pasteles, cocciones de todo tipo, ella desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la crianza de sus hijos, y parte del préstamo en la compra de una máquina para implementar su negocio.

Nuestra socia se muestra muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, de modo tal que se compromete a cumplir con el cronograma de pagos en las fechas establecidas.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile F. est une femme mariée de 59 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes et de poissons séchés et fumés. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son capital afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Cécile F. is a married woman of 59, mother of 6 children. Her business is selling vegetables and smoked and dried fish. She is asking for this loan to bolster her working capital so that she can better improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling vegetables and smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Ardimdin Group

texts.en:
These people are Abu K., Aminata K., Hassan K., Fatmata S., and Aminata T.. They named their group Ardimdin. They are small-scale businesspeople and also farmers in Masorie village, about thirteen miles from Makeni. They are each requesting a loan of Le 500,000 to help them expand their businesses.

Abu K. is the leader of this group. Abu was born in Masorie village about twenty-six years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the two of them have two children, two and four years old. Abu sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), cassava, potatoes, and any other vegetables he can lay hands on. He buys in Masorie and the surrounding villages and sells in Freetown. In Freetown, he would buy items like rice, sugar, flour, “Maggi” (used in making sauces) and these he sells in Masorie village. Abu has been in business for over ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 33 years old and married with 2 children. He sells foodstuff like yam, plantain and garri. He has been in the business since 1999.  He hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuff to sell. He say thank you to all kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca M. sells groceries at a market in Cape Coast. Rebecca has received a junior high school education.  She is a widow and has four children.  Rebecca has been selling groceries since 1991. She is responsible for providing food for her children, paying their school fees and also paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to purchase more groceries and other goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and other goods for sale

loans.name: Adjoa Dope Abbam

texts.fr: Cette dame vend depuis 2007 à Lomé une boisson locale très appréciée de la population dénommée « sodabi ». Ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant. Elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour faire de nouvelles commandes et répondre à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 30 gros bidons de « sodabi ». Cette femme n’est pas mariée.
texts.en:
Since 2007, this woman has been selling a much appreciated local drink that people call "sodabi".  This business allows her to support herself and to provide for her child.  She wishes to obtain a loan from WAGES to order anew and to respond to the continually growing demands of her customers.  This loan will enable her to buy 30 huge drums of "sodabi".  This woman is not married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drums of a local beverage

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile F. est une veuve de 70 ans, mère de 8 enfants. Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et divers produits alimentaires sur étal. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de santé de sa famille.

loans.use: Vente de divers produits alimentaires

loans.name: Glenda Maria

texts.es: Glenda Maria R. Rodríguez tiene 35 años de edad. Está casada y es madre de 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida. Su negocio está ubicado en las afueras de su vivienda, por lo que Glenda es una mujer muy trabajadora y a sus vecinos les gusta mucho los platillos que ella prepara. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como fue el tiempo ya que tenía dedicarle tiempo a su familia además tiene preparar la comida que ofrece a sus clientes. Pero con el tiempo fue superando este problema,  además vender su comida por las tardes prepara refrescos naturales y los ofrece en un ingenio en donde tiene muchos clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, arroz y carnes. Su deseo es obtener un restaurante.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Rosa, ella es natural de Urubamba, vive en el barrio de los pisonay,   en pisonayniyoc, estos son árboles típicos y oriundos de la zona del valle de Urubamba, son unos árboles viejos, enormes y muy resistentes, es toda una alameda de ellos y amados por los residentes.

La socia tiene 65 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, la socia paralelamente al cuidado de su hogar se dedica al comercio minorista, ella vende chicha en la puerta de sus casa, tiene un negocio pequeño de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz fermentado, bebida típica en los andes de Perú), la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de que desea invertir en su negocio un poco precario y hacer de este un local bonito a la vista de propios y extraños.

La socia se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas, quedando muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a native of Urubamba. She lives in the Pisonay neighborhood in Pisonayniyoc. The Pisonay are native trees in the Urubamba Valley zone. The trees are old, large, and very hardy. The neighborhood has a large grove of Pisonay that are loved by the residents. Sra. Rosa is 65 years old, married, and has two children. She simultaneously takes care of her house and runs a small retail business, selling chicha out of her house (chicha is a corn liquor, typical of the Andes of Peru). She has requested a loan so that she can enhance the atmosphere of her storefront for locals and visitors. Sra. Rosa is dedicated to making her payments on time and is very grateful for the opportunity the loan will afford her.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nueva Luna Group

texts.es: La asociación comunal “Nueva Luna” es parte del centro focal Villa Exaltación, está formado por trece integrantes, demostrando responsabilidad en sus cinco años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer. Una de las socias más  antiguas es Marleny U., quien formo el grupo con la ayuda de sus vecinas y amigas. Diversos son los negocios de este grupo, por ejemplo, Shirley tiene un pequeño salón de peinados, Modesta vende papa en ferias y mercados de forma ambulante, Aída tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Las socias de  Nueva Luna  afirman que necesitan comprar mercadería para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal organization "Nueva Luna" is part of the organization Villa Exaltacion:it is made up of thirteen members who have demonstrated responsibility in their 5 years of working together in Pro-Mujer. One of the longest members is Marleny U., who started the group with the help of her neighbors and friends. There is a variety of businesses in this group. For example, Shirley has a small beauty salon, Modesta peddles potatoes at fairs and markets. Aida has a grocery store. The members of Nueva Luna state that they need to purchase merchandise for better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Merchandise

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Here are Magret I. K. and Isatu F. of the “In God We Trust Group”. They are requesting their fourth Kiva loan to enable them to further expand their businesses. Previous loans have been a great blessing to these borrowers. With previous loans, their businesses expanded and profit margins also increased. Magret (right), for example, started trading with fried cakes but with consequent Kiva loans, she today owns a very big shop. However, she is still asking for a new loan as she believes in “the more the merrier”.

Magret is the leader of this group. She is 35 years old; she was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a driver and they have five children, who are in secondary and primary schools. Magret owns a shop where she sells grocery items – milk, sugar, bread, mayonnaise, drinks, and many more items. Magret has had ten years of experience in business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Fatimatou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Pour aider son mari chauffeur de taxi dans la gestion du foyer, elle s’est lancée depuis 2004 dans la vente de produits alimentaires et divers articles domestiques. Elle vend ses produits dans le marché d’Akodessewa à Lomé mais aussi dans son quartier Kegue. Pour renouveler son stock, elle  voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 02 sacs d’haricot, 01 sac de riz, 03 sacs de maïs et d’autres articles comme des petits sachets de savon en poudre et autres articles. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de couvrir ses frais de déplacement vers Atakpamé pour s’approvisionner en cérélales
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband chauffeurs a taxi. In order to help him manage their home expenses, in 2004 she launched a business selling food and various products for the home. She sells her wares in the market of Akodessewa in Lomé and also in her own neighborhood of Kegue.

In order to re-stock her supplies, she would like a loan from WAGES (the micro-finance group) to purchase 2 sacks of beans, 1 sack of rice, 3 sacks of corn and a variety of other products, such as little packets of detergent and other items. This loan will enable her to pay for her trip to Atakpamé and shipping expenses to purchase her supply of grains.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products and a variety of products for the home

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
El socio Eusebio, es natural de Apurimac, pero residente ya desde hace 20 años en  la provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas. 

Nuestro socio es casado, tiene 60 años y tiene 1 hijo, el socio hace muchos trabajos diferentes, llamado mil oficios, nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para poder seguir apoyando a su hijo en la compra de un moto taxi así el hace su propio negocio e invertir en otros pequeños proyectos también. 

Nuestro socio agradece el préstamo y el apoyo otorgado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido como lo ha hecho durante 3 años que lleva trabajando con este banco comunal y con el apoyo de sus compañeros de banco, debido a que este socio es cumplidor y paga sin demoras.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a native of Apurimac, but has lived for the past 20 years in the province of Urubamba, which is located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas. He is 60 years old, married, and has 1 child. Eusebio has held many different jobs (often expressed as “a thousand trades”).

Eusebio is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle taxi for his son, who currently does not have his own business. He plans to invest in other small projects as well.

He appreciates the support that this loan will provide and promises to complete his payments as agreed. Eusebio has been working with his Communal Bank for the past 3 years. He has received the support of the other members because he is compliant and makes his payments without any delays.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle taxi for his son & invest in his other businesses

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr: Diatou D. est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est marchande de fruits et aimerait renforcer son capital d’investissement. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diatou D., 54, is married and the mother of 7 children. She sells fruit and would like to bolster her working capital. Her objective is to improve living conditions and the health of her family and pay school fees for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling seasonal fruit

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia se llama Gloria, ella es natural de Puquio – Ayacucho, actualmente reside en la provincias de Urubamba en la calle San Luis de chacma, situada en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad,  ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos aún menores, a los cuales ella cuida y protege, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tienen una pequeña tienda abarrotes, en la que vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, ella solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la implementación y así la mayor demanda de sus productos.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido agradeciendo y valorando el préstamo ella trabajará como siempre para hacer realidad sus metas.

loans.use: Implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Cette dame est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle est expérimentée dans ce commerce qu’elle exerce depuis 1983. Elle maîtrise bien ce commerce qui lui permet aussi de couvrir les frais scolaires de ses 04 enfants, ce qui lui permet d’apporter une aide financière à son mari. Pour renforcer son stock de produits alimentaires, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 20 plateaux d’œufs, 10 paniers de mangues greffées, 5 paniers de patates douces, un panier d’arachide et d’autres produits nécessaires à son commerce. Elle vend ses produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Hédzranawoè à Lomé.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. sells soap, sugar, milk and so on at a market in cape coast.   She is single and has two children. Ekua has been selling soap, sugar, milk and so on 30 years now. She is responsible for paying to take care of her children and also educate them. Her loan will be used to buy to increase her capital to purchase more soap, sugar, milk and other groceries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a new house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy to increase her capital to purchase more soap, sugar, milk and other groceries for sale.

loans.name: Grace Association Group

texts.en:
Here are Fatu S., Kadie B., Isatu C. and Gbassay S. of the Grace Association Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town market, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,100,000.00 to enable them expand their businesses. With a business expansion, they will be able to make more sales, better profit and thus improving their well-being. 

Fatu S. (left) is the leader of the group. Fatu is approximately forty-five years of age, she was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have two children and two foster children all of whom are still attending schools.  Fatu sells dried fish and has been in this business for over ten years now. With this loan, she will travel as far as Yeliboya village to buy the fish. A basket of dried fish at Yeliboya costs Le 800,000.00, thus Fatu will have to add some money of her own to buy a basket of fish.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une dame âgée de 65 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison sur étal. Les revenus générés lui permettent de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou D., 65, is the mother of 6 children. She sells seasonal fruit displayed on a table top. The income thus generated permits her to contribute to the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of seasonal fruit

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia Nelly, es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ella es socia fundadora del banco José Carlos Mariategui, vive en el barrio típico de pisonayniyoc, barrio característico por tener toda una alameda de árboles de pisonay, preciosos y exuberantes, llenos de mucha historia y tradición.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar, con el comercio minorista, ella elabora artesanía con productos de la zona, pero su especialidad es hacer telares, ella hace mantas, muñecos de lanas de alpaca, oveja y cuando se le requiere de vicuña, la socia trabaja con el arte desde muy joven, por lo que ha desarrollado el dominio total de su trabajo, ella solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio, en la compra de lanas, en la de otros insumos y en algunas otras pequeñas cosas que siempre se requiere.

Nuestra socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo establecido y agradece el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Nelly is a native of the province of Urubamba and lives in the traditional neighborhood of Pisonayniyoc, which is characterized by its groves of beautiful and lush pisonia trees and known for its great history and tradition. She is one of the founding members of the José Carlos Mariategui Communal Bank.

Nelly is 45 years old and a single mother of 2 children. She divides her time between performing household chores, managing her small business, and making handicrafts out of local products. Her specialty is making hand woven fabrics. She produces blankets that are stuffed with the wool of alpacas, sheep, and sometimes vicuña. Nelly has always been artistic since she was a young girl, and now that passion totally consumes her work.

She is requesting a loan to purchase wool and other supplies that she always needs for her business. Nelly is committed to making her loan payments at the established time. She is grateful for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool & other supplies

loans.name: Kowuvi Komitse

texts.fr: Ce monsieur s’est spécialisé depuis 2007 dans la confection et la vente d’habits brodés. Il a appris la couture et a choisi la broderie pour se différencier de la plupart des tailleurs. Il reçoit beaucoup de commandes et est très connu dans son milieu. Cette activité lui permet surtout de prendre en charge sa femme et leurs 04 enfants. Pour acheter 20 pagnes à coudre de différente couleur, des fils à coudre et des fils à broder, il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour confectionner de nouveaux habits à vendre.
texts.en:
Since 2007, this man has specialized in the creating and selling embroidered clothes. He learned sewing and chose the skill of embroidery, in order to differentiate himself from the other tailors. He receives many orders and is very well-known in his area. This business enables him to take care of his wife and their 4 children. He is requesting a loan from WAGES (the micro-finance institution) to purchase 20 "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth) to sew in different colors, sewing thread and embroidery thread, so that he can prepare more clothes to sell.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth) to embroider, sewing thread and embroidery thread

loans.name: Grupo Solidario G.m.s Group

texts.es: La Señora Flor de Maria García P. es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 45 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Su compañera Maria Ignacia García M. se dedica a la venta de pelibuey juntas conforman el Grupo Solidario G.M.S ellas son mujeres que trabajan muy duro para proporcionarle a sus familias lo necesario. A pesar de las dificultades de Maria como fue el poco espacio que tenía en su vivienda para tener a sus animales, pero esto no le impidió salir adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos de los diferentes productos. El sueño de ambas es que sus negocios sigan adelante.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria García P. is a very hard working woman. She is 45, and she sells clothes. Her colleague, Maria Ignacia García M., sells pelibuey sheep. Together they form the G.M.S. United Group. They are women who work very hard to give their family the necessities. In spite of the difficulties Maria had, like the small space for her animals at her house, she did not let this keep her from getting ahead with her business. The loan they are asking for is for working capital to buy different products. They both dream that there businesses keep going forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Yakhara

texts.fr: Yakhara D. est une femme de 43 ans mère de 6 enfants. Elle est marchande de fruits de saison. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son capital et avec les revenus participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yakhara D., 43, is the mother of 6 children. She sells seasonal fruit. She is requesting this loan to add to her working capital and with the income will participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of seasonal fruit

loans.name: Manguiliwè

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de couture qu’elle exerce depuis 2006 dans sa maison dans le quartier Novissi à Lomé. Depuis la fin de sa formation, elle n’a pas pu acheter une machine à coudre ; elle se contente d’utiliser une de son amie. Elle sollicite maintenant un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une machine à coudre qui sera pour elle ; elle veut aussi utiliser ce crédit pour louer un atelier de couture pour rendre ses activités professionnelles. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This woman learned the skill of sewing and since 2006, she has practiced this skill from her house in the neighborhood of Novissi in Lomé. After the end of her training, she could not purchase a sewing machine; she was happy to use her friend's sewing machine.

Now she is requesting a loan from WAGES (the micro-finance group) in order to purchase her own sewing machine; she also wants to use this loan to rent a sewing workshop for her business activities.

She is single and does not have children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and to rent a sewing workshop

loans.name: Kabba Group

texts.en:
This is Zainab K., Musa C., Mamusu K. and Ya Marie K.. They named their group K. Group, named after the family name of the group’s leader. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone seeking a loan of Le 500,000 for each for the first time from Kiva Lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make more profit and consequently improving their standard of living. 

Zainab K. (second from right) is the leader of this group. Zainab is age thirty-two; she was born in a village called Yelle, in northern Sierra Leone. Zainab is a widow with two children between the ages of two and five. She sells market food – rice, salt, “margi”, pepper, sugar, flour etc. She has been a businesswoman since 2000.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Madres Group

texts.es:
El grupo las madres está conformado por Darling del Socorro D. M., quien es la coordinadora del grupo, Rosa M. y Verónica del Socorro A., tres mujeres provenientes de  la Ciudad de Managua; de la comarca las Pilas, que está ubicada en la zona urbana de la ciudad. Este Grupo, inicia ya el Octavo ciclo de crédito con ADIM y pretenden seguir adelante hasta ver cumplidas sus metas y sueños.

Doña Darling, de treinta y un años de edad, quien desde hace tres años por motivos de la situación económica que afecta el mundo, inicio  su propio negocio, para respaldar el trabajo de su esposo y poder contar con dinero suficiente para las necesidades de su hogar. Así decidió iniciar la venta de Lentes de Sol de manera ambulante y ha ido incrementando la variedad de productos con cada ciclo de crédito en ADIM.

Doña Rosa M. quien vende cosméticos de la Zermat en la su comarca y Verónica del Socorro A. quien desde hace dos años inicio una pulpería en su casa de habitación, negocio que le ha ayudado a solventar sus necesidades, son las otras dos integrantes del grupo. Ellas creen poder seguir creciendo a través de los créditos y capacitaciones que han recibido.

loans.use: estilos mas variados de lentes para satisfacer la demanda

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Roberto José B. López, tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, el es un hombre esforzado, el trabaja en una financieras en créditos para poder sastifacer sus necesidades de su familia, su esposa también trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , un varón de doce años , actualmente estudiante de secundaria y una niña de nueve la cual estudia su primaria , don Roberto desde hace dos años tiene el negocio de agencia de gas, a veces no llena en cada ronda por falta de dinero por que las ventas están bajas y otras veces  no abastece a todos sus clientes  por falta de productos, lo cual da las gracias Afodenic por el préstamo el cual comprara cilindros de 25 libras para tener en su inventario y poder vender a cada familia Nicaragüense.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Jose B. L. is 39 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He is a strong man who works in a financier in credits to satisfy the needs of his family. His wife also works to help him with the household expenses. They are taking care of two children, a boy who is 12 and currently a High School student; and a girl who is 9 and is in primary school. For 2 years Roberto has had a branch of a gas business and sometimes cannot fully stock it because sales are low and other times he cannot fill all customer orders for lack of supply. He gives thanks to Afodenic for a loan that he used to buy 25 pound cylinders to have in his inventory and so be able to sell to any Nicaraguan family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 25 pound gas cyclinders for public sale

loans.name: Miguel Filiberto

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Filiberto J. ha tenido ya seis créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente.
Don Miguel tiene ya siete años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes esté negocio y su emplea, son la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que tiene cuatro hijos y les quiere dar la mejor educación para su futuro.
Actual mente al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía que sus clientes le están solicitando que venda para la comodidad de ellos. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y crecimiento del negocio, y no se quiere arriesgar el ingreso del negocio ya que es la mayor parte del ingreso familiar. Es por eso que decidió solicitar un préstamo para la inversión y así estar mas seguro. 
El planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que percibe de su trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Filiberto J. has had six loans with FVP which he has paid back punctually. For the last seven years, Miguel has had his business selling groceries and his job is the main source of income for his family. He has four children for whom he wants to provide a good education for their future. Currently his business lacks the variety of products that his customers are asking for since it would be convenient. Right now he does not have the necessary capital to invest in the growth of his business, especially since he doesn't want to risk the funds that form such a major part of his family's income. It was for this reason that he decided to ask for a loan to invest as a safer option. His pan is to pay the loan back with the salary he earns from working as a security guard at a company.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Darling Maria

texts.es: Darling Maria E. R. tiene 27 años. Es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con sus 3 hijos que dependen de ella. Ella dio inicio a su actividad como es la venta de refrescos naturales. Hace más de 11 años que inicio esta actividad por su Mama ya que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a este negocio y quería que su hija Darling siguiera adelante con el negocio, además tenía que mantener a su familia y tenía que trabajar muy duro ya que ella es Madre y Padre para sus hijos.  El desafío que enfrento recientemente es que su hijo lastimo el brazo y ha tenido que gastar en medicamentos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas, hielo, bolsas plásticas entre otras cosas. Sus sueños son que sus hijos logren ser profesionales por el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Darling Maria is 27 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with 3 children who depend on her. She has started her own business selling natural drinks. It's been 11 years since her mother initiated this activity, and she wanted her daughter to continue the work. Also, Darling Maria needed to maintain her family and she has had to work very hard since she is both Mother and Father to her children.

The challenge she has faced recently is that her son injured his arm and she has to spend money on medications. The loan she requests is for working capital to buy fruits, ice, and plastic bags, among other things. Darling Maria's dreams are for her children to become professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL FOR HER FRUIT DRINKS BUSINESS

loans.name: Edda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Edda del Socorro S. de 55 años de edad, es una mujer de “Armas tomar”, según nos describe ella misma. No desaprovecha una oportunidad para iniciar un negocio y sacarle mucho beneficio. Edda trabaja en la venta de Ropa por encargos, actualmente distribuye la misma en un sector más amplio como lo es el Bo. Camilo Ortega y  el Bo. Loma Linda, pero pretende ampliar aun más su clientela. Y esto lo lograra a través de los créditos que ADIM le proporcione.

Edda a trabajado en créditos con grupos solidarios, y este es su 4 ciclo en créditos individuales, afirma estar muy agradecida por qué ADIM, ha sabido apreciar su potencial de comerciante y le ha facilitado créditos para la mejora de su negocio.

Edda lleva ya 20 años en el negocio, y éste para ella ha sido exitoso, con el ha podido criar a sus hijos y garantizarles un nivel de vida mejor al que ella tuvo cuando era niña. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos la superen en cuanto al desempeño en los negocios y puedan establecer su propia empresa. Sueño que piensa ver cumplido con prontitud.
texts.en:
Doña Edda del Socorro S. is 55 years old. She is a woman who “doesn’t mess around,” as she describes herself. She didn’t waste the opportunity to start a business and has now reaped the rewards. Edda sells clothing to order and currently distributes her merchandise in larger neighborhoods such as Camilo Ortega and Loma Linda. She hopes to expand her customer base and is seeking the assistance of a loan through ADIM.

Edda has previously worked with solidarity group loans, but this will be her 4th individual loan. She is grateful to ADIM because, without the help of her loans, she would not be able to grow as an entrepreneur and improve her business.

Edda has successfully managed her business for the past 20 years. She was able to raise her children and provide them a standard of living that was better than what she experienced as a child. Her greatest wish is that her children can overcome all obstacles so that they can establish their own businesses. She dreams that her wishes come true quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise requested by her customers

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es:
El socio Juvenal es originario del barrio de Pisonayniyoc en la provincia de  Urubamba, perteneciente a la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y alterna sus actividades caseras con el  trabajo de artesanía, el se encarga de varias funciones, en las que reciclan el material a usar, combinan la mezcla, luego pasa a laminarlas y guardar en plásticos para que se mantengan frescas, seguidamente las tornean y dependiendo al uso que se les dará proceden a su elaboración, el socio tiene el deseo de poner su propio taller de artesanía con el tiempo, mientras tanto el trabaja para una empresa artesanal, el socio requiere el préstamo para uso personal, ya que con el pago de su mensual cubrirá sus cuotas mes a mes.

El socio se encuentra muy feliz y agradecido por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner, Juvenal, is originally from the neighborhood of Pisoayniyoc in the Province of Urubamba pertaining to the city of Cusco. This partner is 27 years old, is cohabitating, and alternates his home maintenance activities with working as a craftsman. He is responsible for various functions where they recycle materials, combine the mixture, and then laminate and save it in plastic to keep it fresh, followed by lathing, and depending on the intended use, they proceed with the final preparation. This partner has the desire to begin his own handicraft workshop in time while at the same time working for the handicraft company. This partner requires a loan for personal use because with the monthly payment he will cover his fees every month.

This partner is very happy and grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment for his debt in the allotted time.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: personal use

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia, es natural de Andahuaylas, Apurimac, ella actualmente reside en  la provincia de Urubamba en el famoso barrio de pisonayniyoc.

Nuestra socia tiene 26 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la panadería y la artesanía, ella trabaja en la calle comercio 231, ella requiere el préstamo para uso personal, pero una parte desea invertir en la compra de algunos materiales para realizar sus trabajos de forma artesanal.

Nuestra socia se muestra muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, de modo tal que se compromete a cumplir con el cronograma de pagos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member, Lucia, is a native of Andahuaylas, Apurimac. She is currently a resident of the Province of Urubamba in the famous neighborhood of Pisonayniyoc.

Our member is 26 years old and is a single mother. She alternates her household duties with a bakery and a handicraft workshop. She works on the commercial street 231. She needs a loan for personal use, but in part wants to invest in buying some materials to carry out her handicraft work.

Our member is very grateful for the loan granted through this process and so she agrees to comply with the payment schedule on the specified dates.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: materials for handicrafts

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
la sra Fermina V. J. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como ser naranjas, toronjas, chiles, yuca, cebolla, papas etc. 
Fermina tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, nos comento que en estos momentos esta pasando una situacion dificil ya que no tiene capital para comprar las frutas y verduras que ella vende, solo compra poco con lo que vende a diario, ella necesita el credito para poder hacer crecer su negocio.
Fermina tiene un espiritu de trabajo y superacion muy grande.
su meta es poder tener un local solo para tener su producto y tambien le gustaria tener vehiculos para transportar sus verduras y frutas.

loans.use: compra de naranjas, toronjas, repollos, tomates, chiles, yuca, cebolla, melones, sandias, papas.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blanca Irma

texts.es:
la sra. blanca Irma B. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, ella es una sra. de edad y su unica fuente de ingreso es su negocio. para una persona de la tercera edad es dificil conseguir trabajos en empresas y tienen que ver como logran trabajar para sobrevivir, por eso es que ella tomo la decision de poner su negocio y dedicarse a el para el resto de su vida.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas materia prima al por mayor ya que la carga de leña esta bien cara y tambien los costales de harina de maiz, y todos estos productos estan subiendo de precio y ella quiere tener guardado para no tener que comprarlo mas caro despues.
su mejor ilusion es poder terminar de construir su casa y dejarla como ella quiere.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Irma Bustillos has spent many years making and selling tortillas. She is an older woman whose business is her only source of income. It is difficult for an older person to secure a company job, so other forms of work must be created in order to survive. For this reason, she decided to start her business and make it her main priority for the rest of her life.

Sra. Blanca needs a loan to buy supplies in bulk such as good quality firewood and sacks of cornmeal. All of these products are getting expensive, so she wants to buy them now before prices go higher at a later point. She hopes to finish the construction of her house so that she can come and go as she pleases.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Sonia, ella es natural de Urubamba, vive en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de Urubamba, ubicado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco en carro provincial.

Nuestra socia tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos  ella, se dedica aparte del cuidado de su hogar y sus hijos al comercio minorista, ella tienen en su misma casa un espacio destinado a la venta de chicha y leña, ella compra leña al por mayor y lo vende al por menor, la chicha es una bebida a base de maíz amarillo, por lo que tiene muchas proteínas y es económica de elaborarse y de obtener, el esposo de nuestra socia tiene un vehículo motorizado, el cuál les sirve para prestar servicio de transporte dentro del mismo Urubamba, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en sus diferentes negocios un poco por aquí y otro por allá.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is Ms. Sonia. She is a native of Urubamba and lives in the heart of the sacred valley of Urubamba, located an hour and 20 minutes by provincial truck from the city of Cusco.

Our member is 30 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is engaged in the maintenance of her home and children and in a retail business. She has in her own home a space for the sale of chichi, an alcoholic drink made from maize which has a lot of protein and is economical to produce and to obtain. She also sells firewood, which she buys wholesale and sells retail. Her husband has a motor vehicle that provides transportation services within Urubamba. She needs the loan to invest in her different businesses, a little here, a little there.

This member appreciates the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her fees in the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: running her businesses

loans.name: Eduardito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Eduardito, es originario del Bo Maestro, perteneciente a Managua, las integrantes de este grupo son tres mujeres de carácter muy humilde pero de gran osadía.

Doña Fátima del Socorro Fuente, tiene 36 años de edad, y es la coordinadora del grupo quien inicio hace más de 5 años en su casa una mini-pulperia, con la que solventaba sus gastos y necesidades.

Fátima nos dice que ella sufrió un robo donde perdió mucho de su inversión, por lo tanto opto por poner a trabajar como Taxi el carro que poseía. Desde entonces invierte los créditos que ADIM le brinda en el mantenimiento del vehículo (El ciclo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de Llantas; éste ciclo pretende darle mantenimiento al motor) para después ir pagando las cuotas con los pagos diarios del alquiler. 

Ella aspira poder recuperar su pulpería con forme avance en los créditos que se le brindan, asi podrá tener más ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida.

Xiomara Antonia G. forma parte del grupo, posee un negocio de Barbería en su casa de habitación; Doña Xiomara M. trabaja en un Kiosco propio donde vende todo tipo de golosinas, bebidas y algunos alimentos. Todas quieren seguir adelante con sus créditos, este grupo se caracteriza por ser un grupo muy cumplidor, puntual y jamás ha faltado a sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The Eduardito Group is originally from Bo Maestro, which is part of Managua. The three members of this group are women of humble character who fear nothing.

Doña Fátima del Socorro Fuente is 36 years old and the group coordinator. Five years ago, she started a mini grocery store out of her home as a means of earning an income and paying for basic necessities.

Fátima says she lost a lot of money that she personally invested into an automobile that she rents out as a taxi. Since then, she has used her loans from ADIM to pay for maintenance of the vehicle. (Her previous loan was used to buy tires. This loan will be used to pay for engine repairs.) Going forward, she will make her payments using the rental fees she receives on a daily basis.

She hopes to revive her grocery store using the loans that have been provided to her, so that she can earn more income and improve her living conditions.

Xiomara Antonia G. recently joined the group and operates a barber shop out of her home. Doña Xiomara M. sells all kinds of candy, drinks, and other foods from her vending kiosk. They all want to use their loans to help them succeed. The group is very reliable, punctual, and has never failed to make their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for engine repairs & purchase supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Berta Hilda
